150001.name: OSR Gems
150001.description:
designer's blurb:
With description of 50 gemstones and the many reasons to start including them on your equipment.

The book allows for a new level of customisation of items for high fantasy games. The mechanics are straightforward and fit perfectly into your dungeon crawling, dragon slaying Saturday evenings.

from the Introduction:
For many years, players have sought after varied and unique treasure. Their characters have ventured through numerous tunnels, fought all variety of beasts , and overcame every challenge. Sometimes, they found riches. Occasionally, they found greater and more powerful weapons, armor, and tomes. Often, they were left with the option to leave trinkets behind and sell what they could carry. This guide to socketing weapons, armor, and gear provides a new option for characters that fall under the OSRIC series of games. Within this work, we will provide the basic rules to enhance existing gear with the gems characters may find in their travels, if the GM permits it.

150002.name: The Lost City of the Ancients

rpghonor.25531: 2014 ENnie for Best Free Product - Nominee

150002.description:
From the introduction:

The Lost Cities of the Ancients is a Rocket Age episode designed for three to six players. Characters should be early in their careers with a maximum of 15 Story Points. A good mix of academic, rugged outdoorsmen, social, and combat characters will be useful, but the Gamemaster can adjust the scenes to suit their party as needed.

Our episode opens with the discovery of an apparently intact Ancient Martian ruin deep in the Western Highlands. Such a find would draw treasure seekers and archaeologists from across Mars, but this one is even more of an attraction. It lies in territory unclaimed by any faction or nation. This makes it free for the taking and, despite the harshness of the Western Highlands, the need to travel through territory held by the Blue Chanari and the stiff competition, three other expeditions are already kitting out in the French held city-state of Kolpith.

150003.description:
Pocket Golf simulates an 18 hole round of golf using custom made dice, Caddy tips and an exclusively designed course.

Play solo or in a group. Stroke play, tournament or skins formats. The winner will be the player with the lowest score for the round. Try to beat Par for the course in solo play and then try to beat that score next time your play.

The game contains 8 custom engraved dice for your clubs, rules and a uniquely designed 'Green Moose Valley' golf course that shows the course layout with hazards, a quick reference distance chart and Caddy tips. All designed to fit in your pocket!

Ideal for quick game at the 19th hole!
150003.name: Pocket Golf

150004.description:
Pocket Football is a fast paced dice simulation of the beautiful game, football.

8 custom made dice represent your players on the field and rolling one die at a time results in an action. Work the ball up to your Forward and shoot on goal to try and find the back of the net.

Everything from headers, volleys, corner kicks and penalties have been distilled into 8 dice that come in their own carry bag with rules, to fit nicely in your pocket!

Challenge your friends and play as your favourite teams - make sure you bring your best commentary voice! Winning is decided by the player that scores the most goals.

Set up your own tournaments and try to take your team to the finals!


2015 New Edition is a re-release of the game with some changes to dice and gameplay. Still 8 dice, but two new changes (TACKLE die & GOALIE die) include the opponent a little more in the action.



Penalties have been improved and more scoring chances!
150004.name: Pocket Football

34085.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Battle Pack Alpha

boardgameintegration.193024: Lock 'n Load Tactical World War II Era Core Rules

150005.description:
Heroes of Normandy The award-winning, squad-level Lock ’n Load Tactical Series jumps into Western Europe in 1944 with Heroes of Normandy. From the initial D-Day drops, on June 6th, to the fighting in the Norman bocage, and on to Operation Market Garden, this combination of Band of Heroes and its expansion, Swift & Bold, arrives at the battle heavy, with 30 scenarios, over 650 die-cut counters, and the latest v4.1 rules. Command audacious American and British paratroopers and glider troops in daring missions against stalwart defensive positions and fiendish counterattacks by the German Wehrmacht, SS and Fallschirmjägers.

Infantry squads and intrepid individuals, such as skilled Leaders and Heroes, are at the core of the LnL Tactical Series. With them you can fire M1919A4, Vickers, MG34 and MG42 machine guns; take aim at approaching tanks with Bazookas, Piats and Panzerfausts; and find the range with heavy mortars and numerous anti-tank guns, from the American 57mm to the dreaded German 88mm. Vehicles, especially tanks, also clatter onto the battlefield to take on pesky infantry and, of course, each other. M4A1 Shermans, M5A1 Stuarts, Fireflies and Cromwells square off against Panzer IIIs and IVs as well as the big cats: Panthers and Tigers.

Heroes of Normandy has 30 scenarios and tell the battles of the men from the 101st Airborne, 82nd Airborne, British 6th Airborne, 17th SS Panzergrenadier, 6th Fallschirmjager, 91st Airlanding and 352nd Infantry Divisions. The scenarios covers battles spanning the D-Day drops, fighting the Norman hedgerows and Operation Market Garden.

It’s squad-level tactical combat at its most exciting!
150005.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of Normandy

150006.name: Godchild
150006.description:
user summary

Earth is a wasteland. Ninety percent of the Human population has been wiped out during the 666 year Angel Wars, a battle between the Righteous Angels of Heaven and the fallen, Dark Angels of Hell.

A war the LORD of the Holy Bible and his infinite host of angels had prophetically lost.

150007.name: Three Sad Wizards
150007.description:
title page blurb:
Adventure module for use with old school RPGs, character levels 1 – 2.

from the introduction:
The adventure ‘Three Sad Wizards’ consists of three mini-dungeons:

Bymen the Botanomancer (plant mage)lives in a little shack in a garden with beautiful flowers.
Ermard the Entomomancer (bug mage) has many rare specimens of insects and arachnids in his underground laboratory.
Ostal the Ornithomancer (bird mage) lives in a tower.




from How to Use This Module:
This is an introductory module, designed for characters of 1st and 2nd level. If you have an unusually large number of players (say, six or more), or if most of the characters are 3rd level, you should double the number of monsters encountered where possible.

The module is intended for a sandbox campaign.

150009.name: Zhov
150009.description:
user summary

This tome details the city of Zhov, which was once called Manhattan, and is also currently known as City 7. It is a region immersed in conflict and turmoil. Here, Hell Storms are frequent. Werespiders, Wereroaches and Undead are but a few of the monstrosities that consider Zhov their home.

150010.description:
In Tiger Leader, you're in command of a German Kampfgruppe of tanks, armored cars, trucks, halftracks and supporting infantry. Your Kampfruppe may also be assigned air support and heavy weapons support in order to achieve your goals. Your goals are to take your objectives while trying to keep as many of your men alive as possible during realistic tactical missions.

Tiger Leader features nine historical campaigns that can be played as individual campaigns or linked to form one huge mega-campaign that follows your troops from the Invasion of Poland to the final battles on the Eastern and Western fronts. The scheduled campaigns include:


The Invasion of Poland 1939
The Battle for France 1940
The Battle for North Africa 1941
The Invasion of Russia 1941
The Battle for North Africa 1942
The Fight for Italy 1943
The Fight for Russia 1943
The Days of D-Day 1944
The Final Days in Berlin 1945


A major part of the game is mission planning. You decide which vehicles and infantry units to use and which commanders are best for the mission. Vehicle and infantry commanders are rated for skill level and even personality quirks such as how well they keep their heads while under fire. Deciding which commanders are used for each mission is a major consideration. Your units will become fatigued with every mission. If you push a commander and his men too hard, his skills will degrade. Your commanders and their crew also gain experience with every mission. This makes for some great decision-making. Should you keep fighting with your top commanders and crew and further fatigue them to get the job done, or let the new guys fight in order to prep them for the tough missions ahead?

Missions are quickly resolved using an area movement system to display tactical combat. Speed and realism take top priority in this game. Terrain cards randomly generate each battlefield. Double sided terrain tiles provide everything from cities and farmland to snow covered forests and hills to sand dunes and oases.

During combat, you get to resolve every fight with enemy tanks, infantry, anti-tank guns, and squads of infantry. Each enemy tank, truck, infantry, etc is represented by its own counter on the battlefield. A unique fog of war system adds to the tension of the combat as unless you have a clear line of site to the enemy, you may not know exactly what is coming out of the morning fog towards your tanks until it’s too late.

After combat, you can rest and refit your vehicles and infantry. As new technology becomes available, you can replace older obsolete tanks with newer and deadlier models such as the Tiger, Panther and even the deadly King Tiger! If you’ve played Hornet Leader, Phantom Leader or Thunderbolt/Apache Leader, you’ll make an easy transition into Tiger Leader.

We’ve included the cards for every commander to progress in experience from Newbie, to Green, Average, Skilled, Veteran, and Ace!
150010.name: Tiger Leader

150012.description:
Following on the success of No Retreat! where the Russian Front of World War II beckons, and then taking the action to the African Front, game designer Carl Paradis and his trusty developer Alan Emrich have teamed up yet again to present the third chapter in this game series, No Retreat 3: The French & Polish Fronts.

The “Phony War” ended in May of 1940 as the German Army unleashed blitzkrieg attacks into Holland, Belgium and Luxembourg in preparation for their audacious plan to invade France. Dubbed “Case Yellow” (Fall Gelb), it relied on a surprise attack with armored forces through the Ardennes Forest that the French had deemed impenetrable. A German staff study proved otherwise, and their panzers were pushed through this broken wooded terrain with deft speed, catching the Allies by surprise with their appearance.
In No Retreat 3, players command the Allied (French and British) or German forces, operating them in accordance to one of several historical plans (represented by Plan cards). Manoeuvring forces over hexes that are approximately 30 kilometers across, over turns that represent 4 days of real time each, the vaunted No Retreat series card-assisted game systems are there to create on-map puzzles around each hex, unit and battle as the tense engagements rage back-and-forth and nothing is entirely predictable.

Designer Carl Paradis has made an exhaustive study to answer the question, “Could France have staved off total defeat in 1940?” His research yields a resounding, “Yes!,” and the simulation elements of No Retreat 3, combined with its novel gameplay elements, offer a rich and insightful presentation of this controversial military campaign that shaped the trajectory of World War II.

Bonus Game
But wait, there is more! For this deluxe edition, complete with a 2-sided mounted map and oversized counters, the 1939 Polish Campaign was also added.

This little-simulated battle will see many new concepts implemented into the “No Retreat!” game system. Given that both sides had never seen battle before and the units were mostly untried and green, a “Fog of War” game system is in use, adding much replayability to this simulation. Since that this game is fast, a complete contest will consist of two plays, with each gamer taking both sides in turn, trying to best the opponent’s performance. Some intriguing “what if” hypothetical historical options are also added: Could have France intervened more effectively, the USSR acted differently? What if Czechoslovakia was never taken over by the Nazis? Poland better prepared? All these and more are yours to try out. No Retreat!

French Front Scenario Listing
Regular Game: The May/June 1940 campaign, but with an added twist. Both players will draw/choose a “Campaign Plan Card” that will instruct them as to their general objectives. There are over 6 different cards from each side, all taken from actual historical plans; the success of which will add critical Victory Points if the game does not end in “Sudden death”. What if Hitler had attacked in winter 1939 like initially planned? Or the French Air Force had been better prepared?
Historical Game: The May/June 1940 campaign, but with the Plan choices limited to the more historically plausible alternatives.
Simulation Game: Both sides will be given the plans/set-up used during the actual campaign. Fall Gelb no5 for the Germans, Plan Dyle A or B for the French. The game also starting with the offensive already underway, Liege taken and Holland invaded.
Operation Dynamo: In this scenario the German “Sickle cut” maneuverer towards the sea is almost completed! As the Allies, will you be able to save the British expeditionary Corps, evacuating it at Dunkirk, or even better, pierce the enemy lines and re-join the main French Army down south?

Polish Front Scenario Listing
Regular Game: The September 1939 campaign, but with extra choices. Both players will secretly deploy most of their troops on smaller strategic maps. One side or the other could have some extra “initiative” choices for the deployment of their troops.
Historical Game: The September 1939 campaign, with the exact historical set-ups of both forces. For this contest the players will take each side in turns. So the scenario will be played two times.
Alternative History game: Players will explore many “what-if” alternatives. Some randomly determined, some planned by choice. That scenario will be linked to the French Front game and its outcome can affect the set-up of the latter.

Components:
One 22x18 Mapboard (mounted and two-sided, one side for France, the other Poland)
One sheet of 88, 2-sided square units
One sheet of 112, 2-sided round/hex markers.
One rule book (24 pages)
One Scenario Book (24 pages)
Five Play-aid cards
55 Event Cards (37 for France, 18 for Poland)
Two 6-sided dice

Number of Players : 2

Ages: 14 and up

Playing time: Approximately 50 minutes for each scenario; 3 to 4 hours for a campaign game, 2 hours for the Poland mini-game.

Scale: Each unit is one Army or Corps: Each hex is about 30 kilometers from side to side. Each turn represents four days of real time, except the first turn, which is only two days.
150012.name: No Retreat 3: The French and Polish Fronts

150013.description:
(from GMT website:)

Following on the success of No Retreat! Where the Russian Front of World War II beckons, and then taking the action to the African Front, and then the French Front, game designer Carl Paradis presents the fourth chapter in this game series, No Retreat 4: Italian Front 1943-45.

This game will be using a mix of all the previous No Retreat! game concepts/systems, including some from the solitaire module, to depict this long and gruelling campaign with the minimum of fuss and the fastest possible play time. Each turn will represent one or two months (depending on the weather), but not every Turn will see major action! So during Frontline lulls very little combat, if any, will take place but for frontline attrition, so these turns will pass in a speedy manner. When a side decide to go on the offensive then that specific turn will see a series of moves/combat/activations (like was done for NR2); using a variant of the regular No Retreat “Target/Counterblow” rules and markers. The important sea invasions will be shown in great detail, the German fortified positions also, and the long set-pieces battles (like Cassino or Anzio) will be represented correctly without bogging down game play. Like in NR3 “Secret Campaign Plans” will make an appearance, with players vying to attain special high command objectives, thus getting bonus victory points if the game does not end in an early “Sudden Death” and continues to the bitter end.

To make the play surface more easy to use, the long Italian peninsula will be represented by a series of separate maps each showing a part of the battleground. As the frontline moves north or south, players will switch the “play map” map to show the actual areas of operations, thus saving a lot of table space. It will also be possible under certain circumstances for players to actually change sides in the game (keeping their accumulated Victory points): Thus both will be able to get the chance to be on the “attacking side” if wished for; historically the Germans were mostly on the defensive. The Event card system will also be changed a bit, with each card allowing multiple possible effects/events: all the cards will be useful, even when the main event cannot be used because of Strategic Initiative.

Bonus Game
But wait, there is more! For this deluxe edition, the Invasion of Sicily will be added as a separate mini-game. Very fast-playing, and will be an excellent learning or tournament game; that can be also linked to the main campaign game. Could the Axis have delayed the Allies longer on the island? And what if only a token holding attack was made, with the main landings a short while later on the mainland? Or Sicily completely bypassed altogether?

Italian Front Scenario Listing

Regular Game: The 1943/45 full campaign. Both players will choose a “Campaign Plan” that will instruct them as to their general objectives; there is a chance that one could also be imposed by the game system in case of failure! A players’ “switch of sides” could also occur because of the plans or player’s will. The outcome of the Sicily mini-game can be linked to this scenario. Players can also change the Strength of the Armies and rate of reinforcements.
Historical Game: The 1943/45 full campaign, but with the Plan choices limited to the more historically plausible alternatives. No switch of sides can occur. The Sicily mini-game is not used.
Short Early game: The first part of the 1943/45 campaign. Only the Southern Italian maps will be used, and the game will end in Early 1944 (historically after the Anzio invasion petered out).
Short Late game: The second part of the 1943/45 campaign. Only the Northern Italian maps will be used, and the game will Start where the previous “Early game” scenario stops, and continues until the end of the war in 1945.
Sicily Game: This mini-game can be played “stand alone” or linked to the Regular Game Scenario. It also makes for an excellent fast-playing Tournament scenario.




TIME SCALE: 1 month per turn
MAP SCALE: 10 miles per hex
UNIT SCALE: Divisions

Components:

One 17"x22" two-sided map
Two 17"x22" one-sided maps
47 Event cards and 8 Leader cards
One sheet of 88 round markers; 24 hex markers
One sheet of 88 two-sided square unit counters
Rulebook
Scenario Book
Player Aid Mat
Two 6-sided dic




DESIGNER: Carl Paradis
DEVELOPER: Jack Stalica
COUNTER ART: Mark Simonitch & Charles Kibler
MAP ART & RULEBOOK LAYOUT: Charles Kibler
150013.name: No Retreat 4! Italian Front: 1943-45

150014.description:
Team up with fellow wizards to vanquish the sinister monsters that lurk in the dungeon, and save the nearby village. This is a noble and honorable quest, and... oh, who are we kidding? In reality, you're a greedy wizard who is all about fame and personal gain, and your fellow wizards are cut from the same cloth! Prevail over your opponents by learning the best spells and using that knowledge to outmaneuver and kill-steal in the dungeon, so you can gain admiration of the townsfolk, fame across the realm, and achieve Pixel Glory.

In the first phase, the town phase, players will be drafting spells using an auction mechanic. Players will then take their decks into the second phase, the dungeon phase, where they will work together to defeat monsters; however, only the player that deals the lethal blow will get the fame for it. There is a lot of interaction and engagement due to players fighting over learning the same spells as well as fighting over fame.
150014.name: Pixel Glory

150015.description:
Expansion contains three additional cards with elements common with Pick-a-Pig and Pick-a-Dog games. As those cards are rare and hard to match with other cards from the base game, players get more (2 or 3) points for them.

The fourth card contains instruction with illustration of all cards matching with the expansion.

This expansion was published as a promo for the SPIEL 2013. Fair's name and date is printed on the instruction card.
150015.name: Pick-a-Polar Bear: Pig and Dog Expansion

150016.description:
In the solitaire game Shephy, you start with one sheep in your field, and you must manage the event cards presented to you in order to have one thousand sheep in the field before you go through the deck of event cards three times.

The sheep deck consists of values 1, 3, 10, 30, 100, 300 and 1,000; at the start of the game, you place a 1 sheep card in your field, then shuffle the 22 event cards and lay out five cards to form your hand. On a turn, you choose one card, carry out its effect, then refill your hand to five cards. Event cards might duplicate existing sheep cards, add new ones, swap one value of sheep for another, remove sheep, etc. Play through the deck until you have no cards in hand, then shuffle the event cards.

If you go through the deck three times without having at least one 1,000 sheep card in the field or if at any point in the game you have no sheep in the field, then you lose.
150016.name: Shephy

150018.description:
Board game inspired by the popular Polish television series. The game's story is centered around the inhabitants of the Warsaw block of flats. The game is irony of life in communism Poland.

Players take on the characters from the show and everyone is organizing your life so that he lived in the block most convenient.

The game consists of several turns in five rounds. Turn reflects day of life. At the beginning of each round, players choose the location to which they want to go and perform the associated action given a location (or a card on hand).

Each character in the game has different bonuses and ways of scoring. First person who at the end of all the rounds has the most victory points.
150018.name: Alternatywy 4

150019.name: Death: The Final Adventure
150019.description:
From the publisher blurb

Death is not the end. In the Birthright setting, death is the beginning of a final adventure that itself represents the culmination of a life of adventure. This text, designed for use by Dungeon Masters, contains mythological information for the Birthright setting that allows a DM to conduct an adventure of series of adventures that continue beyond the mortal lives of Player Characters. Several monster descriptions are included to support that material. These creatures are placed in the wider context of Birthright cosmology in order to provide the DM with ample motivation and background.

150020.name: The Third Verse
150020.description:
Publisher's blurb:


Culled from the many exploits of Red Box Vancouver and drawing inspiration from four microdungeons drawn by Tony Dowler, The Third Verse is a vast, subterranean labyrinth full of doom. Can you find the missing third verse and use it to banish evil from the land?


MARVEL at the malign magnificence of the Red Mummy's terrifying tomb!
GRIMACE as the grinding gears of evil engines churn beneath the earth!
FLEE when the God of Hellfire's blazing tongue comes dancing down!
DO YOU DARE to brave the Shrine of the Doomed Celestial?

The River Knife series of modules are designed to be used with both Dungeon World and Labyrinth Lord (and by extension any other old school fantasy role-playing game).

150021.name: New Scions
150021.description:
User summary
New Scions: The Blood Ability Point System is a reference work for the Birthright d20 Campaign Setting, a fan conversion of AD&D Birthright setting to the d20 System.

From the publisher blurb
This book revises and updates the entire system of regency, bloodline and blood abilities presented in the original Birthright materials for use with 3e or later versions of the game. This optional system of rules allows for much greater flexibility and variation in developing blooded characters, permitting a practically endless variation in the abilities of scions. The original blood abilities are preserved and developed to create a complete and more fully realized system.

New Scions also updates the regency system using the methods for portraying character in later versions of Dungeons & Dragons. This system is backwards and forwards compatible and based upon the methods used in the original setting materials. In addition, a system of abbreviation and notation is included in this system to standardize characters and ease record keeping.

150022.description:
Promo card given out for free during the Spiel 2013.

Name: Frost Wolf
Domain: Iceland
Mana Cost: 2
Attack: 2
Hit Points: 2
Special Powers: Frenzy, Mail: 1
150022.name: Rawen TCG: Frost Wolf Promo

150023.name: Jäger der gestohlenen Statuette

rpgseries.23840: AHL - Living Greyhawk Ahlissa (Adri/Innspa) Regional Adventures

150023.description:
From the cover of the scenario:

Es ist kalt und grau im herbstlichen Herbergsbad, eigentlich viel zu ungemütlich um auf Abenteuer auszuziehen. Aber wenn eine Belohnung für die Jagd nach einer wertvollen Statuette winkt, kann man schon mal die warme Gaststube verlassen.

Wer weiß etwas über die Diebe? Und was hat es überhaupt mit der Figur auf sich?

Ein Abenteuer in der Stadt Herbergsbad nach den Regeln von D&D 3.5 ausschließlich für neue Spielercharaktere der Stufe 1.

in English

It is cold and the sky is grey in autumnal Innspa, really to uncomfortable to go adventuring. But when a reward is offered for the hunt for a precious statue, one may leave the shelter of a cozy inn. Who has information on the thieves? And what is the secret of those statue?

An adventure in the city of Innspa for Dungeons and Dragons 3.5 exclusively for new first level characters.

150024.name: Wild wuchernder Adri

rpgseries.23840: AHL - Living Greyhawk Ahlissa (Adri/Innspa) Regional Adventures

150024.description:
'From the cover of the scenario:'

Es ist später Herbst in Herbergsbad, die ganze Bevölkerung bereitet sich auf die kältere Jahreszeit vor. Nach den Wirren des letzten Jahres soll endlich wieder Ruhe einkehren in der Stadt. Eine angekündigte Gartenbauausstellung zum Frühlingsbeginn des kommenden Jahres sorgt für Aufruhr im Zirkel der Organisation des „Grünen Daumens von Herbergsbad“. Ein Abenteuer nicht nur für Druiden und Waldläufer.
Für Charaktere der Stufen 1-11 (Durchschnittliche Gruppenstufe (DGS) 2-8).
Das Abenteuer ist NICHT für Kentauren geeignet.

It is late autumn in Innspa, the citizens are preparing for the cold season. After the turmoils of the recent year peace and order should return to the city. An anounced garden exhibition planned for spring break the comming year causes some activity within the "Green Thumb of Innspa".
An adventure not only for druids and rangers. For characters level 1 - 11 (APL 2 - 8).
The adventure is NOT suitable for centaurs.

150025.name: Bajsboule!
150025.description:
Bajsboule! (literally "poop boule") is a dexterity-based Swedish children's game implementation of the sport "Boule". The object of the game is to toss balls as close to the poop as possible.

Plastic turd included.

150026.name: Monsterkuddkrig
150026.description:
Swedish children's game (literally: monster pillow fight).

Dexterity based game where the object is to throw pillows at the opponent's monsters. The first one to knock down all of the opposing monsters is the winner.

150027.name: Rolemodels: The Battle for Vyk' Tornaahl
150027.description:
Rolemodels: The Battle For Vyk'Tornaahl — a limited-edition, RPG-themed card game curated and designed by Light Grey Art Lab — features a diverse collection of alter-egos and fantasy self portraits from 99 artists from around the globe. Each of these artists have traded in their pencils and brushes for battle armor and wands in an effort to embrace their inner swordsman, warrior, and healer. This exhibition of artwork celebrates each artist as a creator, individual, and a modern-day art hero and role model.

Each artist's self-portrait represents a character in the game that players use to outwit their enemies, form their ranks, battle against foes, define their allies, and go to battle in the hope of obtaining influence and, ultimately, power over the fallen land of Vyk'Tornaahl.

At heart Rolemodels is a poker variant with additional rules and flavor. Players start the game with five cards in hand. Three cards from the deck are revealed to form the Adventurer's Tavern. At the start of a round, the dealer rolls a d20 die to determine the amount of influence up for grabs. Each player then takes one of two actions on his turn:


Draw two cards, one from the Adventurer's Tavern and the other from the face-up cards or the deck.



Declare battle, which takes place in two phases:



Scout Phase: Whoever started the battle plays two cards (called "Scouts") face up in front of him. Each other player in turn decided whether to pass or join the battle; in the latter case, they also play two Scouts face up.



Reinforcements Phase: First, a player can choose to surrender and withdraw from battle. All players who don't surrender, then simulaneously play and reveal three cards as reinforcements. Whoever has the strongest cards wins the available influence; in games with three and four players, the second best hand wins half this amount of influence.


After discard all played cards, the player who initiated battle draws two cards, then a new round begins. When one player has fifty or more influence, the game ends and he wins.

150029.description:
IMPORTANT UPDATE:
The second edition of "1911 Amundsen vs Scott" incorporates this expansion inside with 4 white cubes (not wooden tents).

A small expansion for backers of the Verkami crowdfunding campaign consisting of 4 food depots in the form of small wooden tents and a rules card.

Important: If you want to play with this expansion only need to print the rules and use 4 pieces (cubes, discs, peanuts :D ...)

The Rules:
1- Each player receives 2 pieces (Food Depots).
2- Each player rolls a die and place one of their Depots in the resulting track space ("1" is the space adjacent to the ship).
3- The players choose where they want to place their second Depot, exactly 2 spaces ahead or behind (if possible) the first one.
Ex: Amundsen rolls the dice with a "5" result and places his first depot in the fifth (yellow) space. The other depot may be placed in the third (green) or seventh (red) space.
4- At the begginning of the game each player receives 3 cards instead of 1. They must pick 2 of these cards to place face down next to each of their depots.
Note: If this expansion is combined with the "Expansion 1 - Patrons" (included with the game), the Food Depots must always be executed first.
5- When a player ends his turn in a space with a Depot, he takes the corresponding card.
Note: If the new card forces the player to exceed the hand limit, the player must exchange a card of his hand face down with the card of the Depot.

This expansion is called "Expansion 4," as the first three expansions are already in the base game.
150029.name: 1911 Amundsen vs Scott: Expansion 4 – Food Depots

150030.name: Playing with Intent
150030.description:
From the Introduction:

This book is a description of a certain way of roleplaying. We call it "Playing With Intent". If you like to improvise, to explore characters and story, the thrill of never knowing what happens next, this is for you.

The ideas are simple. They do, however, require experience with roleplaying, preferably with different schools/styles of roleplaying. It is possible for an inexperienced player to participate in Playing With Intent, but at least two participants should have roleplaying experience.

We will do everything we can to make you awesome.

The central idea

You will use different roleplaying techniques as you see fit, selecting and incorporating them along the way, following the flow of the game and your own personal desires. In this way, you will explore something that nobody has experienced before you, and nobody will again.

What does this mean?

It means there is no fixed set of rules. You'll be trying out different rules, techniques, ways of play as you go along. Maybe, at some point in play, a player says: "I'd like to turn out the lights and play out this scene in total darkness." Maybe, in a different game, a player says: "Let's put some miniatures on the table to see where all the characters are." Or someone says: "Lie down on the floor! We'll be the voices in your head, whispering your madness."

No rules at all? No structure? Yes, there is some structure. There are some principles.

150031.name: Te Deum pour un massacre, seconde édition
150031.description:
User Summary:

Te Deum pour un massacre is a French-language role-playing game set during the Wars of Religion in XVI century France. The characters are created with a life paths system. The characteristic values are expressed as a polyhedral die (d4 to d20): to decide the outcome of an action, the die roll is added to the skill value, and the sum is compared to the level of difficulty of the action.

The 2nd edition core box contains two hardcover books, each one over 500 pages long. The first exposes the setting in detail, while the second contains the game rules and three adventures.

150032.name: Return to Camp Death
150032.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Last summer’s massacre at Camp Clearwater rocked Barrow Pines, casting a pall over our sleepy town. Only when the inconclusive police investigation and media circus died down and we tried to put our lives back together did we realize our nightmare had just begun.

Barrow Pines is full of secrets, and the deeper we dig into the mystery, the more questions we unearth. Those of us who have dared look have come to one inescapable conclusion: whatever killed all those people last year is still out there, and it will kill again.

To stop the horror once and for all, we must return to where it all started. We must return to Camp Death.

This special release playset is brought to you by James Gabrielsen as a sequel to his classic slasher movie playset Camp Death. For extra fun, play it back to back with the original!

150033.description:
It's night in the mountains and the shepherds are bored.. so they count sheep... taking care not to be the first to fall asleep!

Sheepzz is a card game belonging to the same family as MOW. Players have 5 cards in hand. On their turn they must place one card from their hand on the top on one of the 3 piles, respecting the current law to count Sheepzz: depending on the moment, you have to respect ascending (1 to 19) or descending (19 to 1) order.

If you can't play you get all of the cards of one pile as a penalty, collecting as many "bad" points as there are pillows on these cards.

Some sheep cards give you specific abilities, and the wolves are jokers... but dangerous ones!
150033.name: Sheepzzz

150034.name: TeamWords
150034.description:
Players are trying to build a letter grid: either they succeed each round, and win at the end, or they fail, and lose immediately. Players set the timer then draw letters. Within the time limit, they endeavor to place the letters they drew.

The game requires a electronic timer, which is not included; it is recommended that each round be allowed one minute each, but it can be changed to reflect players' skill levels.

Players must work together to use consonants as they are drawn, within the time limit. Players can plan ahead so that they will be ready for certain letters.

This game is ideal for environments where players are extremely unmatched; instead of one player having to cheat to lose, all players work together and the timer can be adjusted to reflect the skill of the group.

150036.name: The Outboard Motor Race
150036.description: Typical spin and move game published in 1930's by Milton Bradley. The first player, who cross finish line - wins the game.

150037.name: Heinrich Creations
150037.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are about to embark on a story about a successful scientist; who was a prodigy in his profession, but would soon fall victim because of his own success. He was indeed a family man who loved his daughter dearly, rivaled only by his own work.

As you continue on with the doctor’s story, it is tailored to suit any story line for any campaign. Also includes characters to drop in and use right away straight from the good doctors past (to be used as heroes or villains the choice is yours), to present.

150038.name: Sigil
150038.description:
From publisher blurb:

Greetings from AHC. Next we have a new heroin that can see visions of the future, fighting for the city or even the world.

Sigil can see and feel her mother’s death replay over in her mind: the memories are full of that horrific night. Very often when the moon is at its fullest she can feel someone searching for her, someone evil and yet soothing at the same time, Rosa over the years secretly has practiced her abilities, with no outside training, feeling one day she will meet her mother’s killer and have her revenge!

150039.name: Microman
150039.description:
From publisher blurb:

Greetings from AHC. Next we have the biggest - little hero, you may never see unless you were Sherlock Holmes with a magnifying glass.

With his internship at Megatropolos University, and being lucky enough to work with the legendary Dr. Abel and Heinrich, they together created the (Regenerating Nanite Technology) suit and customized its look. From learning some techniques from his mother, who is a professional seamstress; much to Michael's chagrin the suit didn't make him BIGGER, but made him smaller.

150040.name: Slorian
150040.description:
From publisher blurb:

Greetings from AHC. Next we have someone who is outta this world!

No really, he is not from this planet.

He’s The Slorian, from the planet Aseir. And he could very well be our planets last hope to save Earth and Aseir from a Kyldarian attack.

And as a special bonus with this pdf, you will now have two more alien species to add to your campaign.

150041.name: The Delucci Family (M&M)
150041.description:
From publisher blurb:

AHC is both diverse and dynamic. As a sourcebook or single characters for the Mutants and Masterminds 3rd Edition RPG Role-Playing Game.

AHC is populated with many colorful characters. It’s brimming over with chaos, aliens, criminal masterminds, and more. And as things that are currently added in AHC, feel free to update these characters as you see fit.

Characters continuously gain new powers and lose old ones; or become more or less powerful; or acquire (or build) new pieces of equipment to enhance their capabilities.

Here at AHC, it’s about you; “The Players and Gamers”.

Greetings; the wait is finally over. The Delucci Family is now here.,

This pdf has it all - action, suspense, violence, and a staring cast of characters, that you’ll never forget. It’s perfectly designed to drop into any campaign.

So if you’re looking for Mafia Action in your RPG life, this is the pdf for you!

150042.name: Bloodletter
150042.description:
From publisher blurb:

BLOODLETTER!!

Once a hero who was met with fatal brutality, the creature known as Bloodletter is barely an echo of the man he once was. Raised from the dead and corrupted by dark magic, he now stalks the living world looking for souls to feed on.

150043.description:
Terminus Gate is a gritty, brutal miniatures game pitting rival privateer crews against each other as they attempt to fulfill their contracts. You are the captain of a space-faring privateer crew, contracting your services where you can in the vast outer systems. Armed with some fresh recruits, you will ply your trade across the stars, picking up contracts ranging from planetary exploration to deep space salvage, policing actions to hit-and-run raids. As they survive each job, your crewmen will gain experience, granting them new abilities and opportunities to develop in their professions.

In the depths of space, opportunities and dangers abound. Dark and terrible enemies poise ready to foil your crew at every turn. Life as a privateer is a dangerous affair with injuries and even death awaiting your crew as they quest for fame and fortune amongst the stars.

You assemble your team with the Terminus Gate miniatures according to your strategy and then run into a spaceship trying to find the most loot. You try to accomplish game missions or exterminate your opponent's crew.
150043.name: Terminus Gate

150044.name: The Pit
150044.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 40 x 40 inch, full color floorplan of a Sacrificial Pit.

The Product comes with the Hex, Square and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps.

“Justice? Might is the only justice this world recognizes. Smite your foe and show me your righteousness if you wish to expunge the guilt for your crimes!”

The pit is a single map of a gladiatorial arena. One misstep on the center platform and the gladiator finds himself falling into a pit. The product includes a 360-degree panoramic view of the arena.

The pit is intended for use in fantasy games. The various spiked towers give the product an alien feel that may make it appropriate for science fiction games as well.

An adventure hook for use with this product.

The Trial: A draconian emperor has captured one of the members of the group for a crime. Whether this crime was committed by the party member or not, the emperor demands a trial. Not in the court of law, but in the gladiatorial pit. The winner of the match who survives will be cleared of all charges, but the loser is judged guilty of his crimes. The rest of the group can buy tickets and watch, gamble on the match, or actively try and free their friend, possibly even allying with the opponent to fight the emperor and his guards.

150045.name: Flesh Golem Variants
150045.description:
From publisher blurb:

The presence of a flesh golem on in a Pathfinder encounter is a game changer. The golem deals out impressive punishment while the PCs try to overcome its defenses. With Flesh Golem Variants, PCs will experience the horror of their first encounter with these iconic constructs four more times. Each golem has a fresh suite of special abilities and attacks that players will never forget

The pdf includes:

The Crawling Horror: An amalgamation of smaller golems that moves rapidly on broken fingers and shattered ankles. It can split apart from the main golem when the golem is critically struck.
Spiritflesh Golem: A stitched-together, incorporeal golem that can change others to incorporeal creatures. Though mindless, it carries an imprint of the lives it once had.
Stitch Golem: Crafted from the limbs and torsos of dozens of soldiers by practitioners of dark magic, the stitch golem works on the battlefield, dismembering enemy troops and mending friendly ones with the spare parts of fallen warriors.
Witchflesh Golem: An abomination of murdered or stolen bodies of witches, hags, and their familiars, the witchflesh golem can bring to bear malevolent hexes against enemies.

150046.name: Ravenfolk
150046.description:
From publisher blurb:


Raven Tricksters Need You!

Few races live amid so much rumor, suspicion and outright falsehood as the ravenfolk, the Western cousins of the tengu.

They are condemned as solitary wanderers bearing misfortune, and praised as messengers from the gods. They are loyal comrades and treacherous thieves, brave warriors and contemptible cowards. But these truths, half-truths and lies conceal a greater mystery that very few outsiders know…

Advanced Races 5: Ravenfolk gives you everything you need to play as a huginn or heru in Midgard or to bring the ravenfolk into the fantasy setting of your choice. Created for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, this 19-page book by designer Wade Rockett includes:

The ravenfolk of Midgard, their rookeries, and their secret feather-language
13 alternate racial traits, and 6 new ravenfolk feats
5 new archetypes including Doom Croaker, Sea Raven and Thief of Secrets
New spells, new magic items, and 3 exotic weapons
And much more!




The gods have need of you: trickster, prophet, blade-master, spy. Will you answer the call?!

150048.name: Cultists Under the Bed
150048.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our reality is ruled by monstrous gods, invisible horrors that hunger to consume us. Some deluded bastards worship these gods, trading obeisance for power or magic or the privilege of getting eaten last when the world ends. Cults are like cockroaches, breeding in the shadows, gnawing at the walls of society, fearful of the light… and bloody hard to kill.

This supplement for the Laundry Files roleplaying game delves into the murky realm of the cultist and the conspirator, detailing eight of the nastiest, most tenacious foes of the Laundry and dozens of minor ones.

150049.description:
Includes 3 play modes:
A Risk re-implementation based on the popular Mass Effect series of video games.

Includes 3 play modes:

Basic Training – Standard RISK game play,
Galaxy at War – fast-paced and strategic, individual and team play.
War Assets – quick card and dice game play.


Game comes complete with over 250 game pieces. Custom components include 2 Alliance Armies, 2 Reaper Armies, 1 Cerberus Army, 2 Harbinger pieces. 81 Faction Cards representing the 3 factions, 18 War Assets planet scanning cards (which can also be played as a standalone mini-game), Custom game board, 5 six-sided dice and 4 eight-sided dice.

Re-implements:

Risk: Star Wars Original Trilogy Edition
150049.name: Risk: Mass Effect Galaxy at War Edition

150050.name: The Munsters Picnic Game
150050.description: This is a Roll and Move game. On some spaces, players may lose turns or move back a few space. The first player to move from start to finish wins. Players must spin the exact number needed to win.

150051.name: Farmer Jones' Pigs
150051.description: This is a Roll and Move game. On some spaces, players may lose turns or move back a few space. The first player to move from start to finish wins. Players must spin the exact number needed to win.

150052.description:
This expansion-character was given for free for who bought the game from Capstone HK ltd. at Spiel 2013.

She has value 3.5. Before the start of the game there is a preparing round by whom Little Red Riding Hood will know which player is the wolf. She has to look at cards of players who are the wolf, and just like the boy she always says she sees a wolf, or a question mark if it's a question mark. Her objective is to find the hunter.
150052.name: Wooolf!!: Little Red Riding Hood (expansion 1)

150053.name: New Super Mario Bros. U + New Super Luigi U

videogamehonor.34210: 2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Best DLC/Expansion of the Year Winner

150053.description:
User Summary

New Super Mario Bros. U + New Super Luigi U is a compilation of New Super Mario Bros. U and the New Super Luigi U DLC. Both games are included on a single disc, along with bonus videos. The game is included in a 2013 Wii U Deluxe System bundle.

150054.description:
This expansion was given for free at those who bought the game from Capstone HK ltd. at Spiel 2013.

It consists of 3 cards (3 pigs) and can only be used in the advance game. They replace the advanced hunter, hunting dog and sheep.

If you select the action 'peeking at a character' and see a pig, you randomly select a character from that player and he selects one of yours after which you say 'the pig exchanged its identity'. However, after someone has made the first early suspicion, you don't do the exchange anymore but just say 'I saw a pig'.

The value of the pig is 1.5 and his goal is to find the 2 other pigs (if present).
150054.name: Wooolf!!: Three Little Pigs (expansion 2)

150055.name: The Game Of Robin Hood
150055.description: This is a Roll and Move game. On some spaces, players may lose turns or move back a few space. The first player to move from start to finish wins. Players must spin the exact number needed to win.

150056.name: Hostile Realms Fantasy Battle Rules
150056.description:
Hostile Realms uses Piquet games concepts including the Sequence Deck, impetus, opposed polyhedral die rolls and morale chips to bring a new style of warfare to Fantasy miniature tabletop wargaming. This game stands alone and does not require the Piquet Core Rules to play.

There are special sections or rules on:

- Magic This is important but not dominating. More than 40 different spells in 4 levels of difficulty are included.

- Heroes and Champions (who may also be Wizards). These characters command subsections of the army, and may fight on their own as well. Their varying capabilities determine how they impact the battlefield.

- Relics These magical items alter how units and/or heroes perform.

- Fantastic Creatures The Bestiary covers 25 types, from swarms of bats to Wyverns. Many have special abilities such as poison, regeneration, causing disease, and/or use of magic.

- Flight Some heroes may be mounted on flying steeds, and many creatures and even some units of troops may fly above the fantasy battlefield, raining missiles down upon their land bound foes, and/or swooping down from above to wreak destruction with weapons, teeth, and/or claws.

- Starter Army Lists (18) These include many popular armies from other fantasy miniatures wargames and common fantasy tropes to help novice players get started immediately. The introductory scenario "The Battle of the Black Valley," features an Orc army opposed by a High Elven army.

150057.name: The Inheritors
150057.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dear Aunt Agatha is dead, and she’s left the family farm in Kansas to a posse member. The lucky sod just has to go back to Kansas and sign a few papers for a one-way ticket to Easy Street. The arrangements only take a week to complete, so as long as the ranch isn’t haunted, no old feuds see fit to unearth themselves, and Black River doesn’t get a hankering for the family plot, everything should go off without a hitch, amigo. Better bring a few friends…just in case.

150060.name: Bestiário
150060.description:
from the back of the book

Um covil repleto de criaturas terríveis à espreita.

Bem-vindo ao Bestiário do Old Dragon, um livro com presas e garras. Aqui você vai encontrar mais de 200 criaturas totalmente detalhadas, com descrições, comportamento, ecologia e estatísticas de jogo dispostas de forma organizada, precisa e de fácil leitura. Um compêndio de ameaças para você tornar seus combates de Old Dragon cada vez mais heróicos, fantásticos e empolgantes.

Neste livro você encontrará:

- Mais de 200 monstros com blocos de estatísticas e descrições completas.
- Sugestões e dicas para criar seus próprios monstros.
- Modelos, uma nova forma de transformar criaturas antigas em novos desafios.
- Listas de consulta rápida por Dado de Vida, Habitat e Conceito.
- Tabelas de encontros prontas para todos os níveis.
- Nova tabela de Afastar Mortos-Vivos.
- Fichas especiais para suas novas criações monstruosas.

translation from Google
A den full of terrible creatures lurking.

Welcome to Old Dragon's Bestiary, a book with fangs and claws. Here you will find over 200 creatures fully detailed with descriptions, behavior, ecology and game statistics arranged in an organized, accurate and easy to read. A compendium of threats you make your combats Old Dragon increasingly heroic, fantastic and exciting.

In this book you will find:

- More than 200 monsters with stat blocks and complete descriptions.
- Hints and tips for creating your own monsters.
- Models, a new way of transforming ancient creatures on new challenges.
- Quick lists by Dice, and Habitat Concept.
- Tables meetings ready for all levels.
- New table Zoom Undead.
- Chips special for your new monstrous creations.

150061.name: Celestial Rainbows
150061.description:
CELESTIAL RAINBOWS is a light, cooperative card game featuring the fantastic rainbow art by the visionary artist, Aurora. The object of the game is to work together to build as many of the seven rainbows as possible. The game may be lost if players are not able to complete a rainbow, but this game is designed to be a positive game that focuses on improving and not so much the negative connotations of losing. Players work to improve their score from their last game. Though cooperative, players have limited table talk and must coordinate their card plays based on what cards they can see on the table.

A fun game suitable for all ages.

150062.name: Westwater
150062.description:
from the Foreword:
Westwater is a role-playing game emulating the classic role-playing experience of the early 1980s, utilizing Wizards of the Coast’s OGL gaming license. It is a retro clone of sorts, in that the mechanics are those very similar to a basic version of an extremely popular fantasy role-playing game. The rules herein are highly inspired by the work of Tom Moldvay, only applied to a western theme with a few house rules.

from the Introduction:
There are two ways to play Westwater. The first is a historical style. With this style, there are no demi-human races (dwarf, elf, or halfling), no magic of any sort, and no monsters. The maps and political borders will mirror those of the particular decade you are playing in your game. This style emulates the Wild West from a historical point of view.

The second style is to play with the full rules, which enables a Wild West/Fantasy hybrid gaming experience. The political borders of the United States are different than actual historical records to reflect a more wild land- scape that includes monsters and magic.

150063.name: The Typing of the Dead: Overkill
150063.description:
User Summary

A remake of House of the Dead: Overkill that uses the typing mechanic from the original The Typing of the Dead in place of the shooting in the original game.

Also includes the entirety of the PS3 port of House of the Dead: Overkill and will receive a free DLC update that includes co-op play. Details TBD.

150064.name: DEVICE 6

videogamehonor.33685: 2014 Apple Design Awards Best Overall Design of the Year Winner

150064.description:
A surreal thriller in which the written word is your map, as well as your narrator.

DEVICE 6 plays with the conventions of games and literature, entwines story with geography and blends puzzle and novella, to draw players into an intriguing mystery of technology and neuroscience.

Anna wakes up in a castle on a remote island, with little recollection of how she got there. All she remembers is an unusually unpleasant doll...

Why are there two identical castles on the island? Who is the mysterious man in the bowler hat? And above all, what is the purpose of the tests Anna is put through?

Read, listen and peek into three-dimensional photographs to solve the bizarre mysteries of DEVICE 6.

Source: The Game Website.

150065.name: Atlantic City
150065.description:
Atlantic City is a narrative card game set during the time of prohibition in the U.S. Players receive cards to determine their character, relationships and secret goal. The game is then played over six rounds/acts in which the participants freely narrate their story and trade items depicted by additional cards, always having their secret goal (e.g., richest gang, must own no weapons, or most alcohol) in mind.

Atlantic City is the first title in the "Mini Story" series of games from Noris Spiele.

150066.name: World of Compact Heroes
150066.description:
From Introduction:

The World of Compact Heroes is a generic basic campaign setting for you to use in your games. The map and subsequent descriptions are vague on purpose. They are only there to give you an outline in which to expand your own adventures and world. The map setting is supposed to be vague enough that you can plop down any adventure wherever you want with minimal prep time. On the flip side, there should be enough information given that you won’t need to make up everything yourself.

Included on the map are some major geographical features as well as several of the larger kingdoms. Not listed on the map are the hundreds of other towns and villages spread throughout, nor the various caves, dungeons, or other geographical features that you may want to include in your own campaigns.

150067.name: Compact Heroes Starter Deck
150067.description:
From Introduction:

Compact Heroes is a hybrid game that combines the progression and storyline of a traditional role-playing game with the portability and ease of use of a card game. It is intended to be played with 2-6 players, with one player acting as the Game Master (GM), and the rest taking the role of adventurers.

What separates Compact Heroes from other card games is that there is no finishing point. There is no traditional “winner”. CH acts the same as a tabletop role-playing game in this regard. The very first character you create in CH can be used over and over again, gaining skills, magical items, and experience so that he or she grows in power.

The GM’s role is to organize and run the adventure, and will have the maps and adventure descriptions, essentially playing the part of storyteller. The GM will run the non-player characters (NPCs) and monsters. This does not mean that the game is GM versus Players. Quite the contrary. For the most enjoyable
experience, the GM should be an impartial participant.

Tools Needed

In addition to the cards included in this core set, you will also need at least one six-sided dice (d6). A twenty-sided dice (d20) and additional d6 are recommended, but not necessary.

You will also need something to write with as you update your character sheet, and having some scrap paper would also probably help quite a bit. And that’s it! Nothing else is required, and everything should fit in your pocket.

150068.name: The Lion in Fimbulwinter: Sweden After the Serpentfall (Savage Worlds)
150068.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the Midgard Serpent fell to the Americans’ nuclear fire in July 1945, Denmark and Norway sheltered Sweden from the worst of it: Sweden’s survivors could shelter in their damaged buildings from the torrential rain that became torrential hail and snow. A near-civil war in the wake of Serpentfall forced the Crown Prince to flee, and a fragile coalition government holds a tenuous grasp on the reins of power. The Serpent’s body lies humped and cloudy on the western horizon. The Americans have pulled back to the Rockies; the center of the British Empire removed to Australia. The Royal Navy can keep station in the North Sea, but the Red Army commands all of Europe east of the Serpent Curtain. Soviet agents and skulk and plot in Stockholm, Göteborg and Malmö...and there are far fouler things lurking in the dark winter night.

The country its people call Mother Svea stands alone.

Inside this 10-page PDF for the Savage Worlds system you'll find:

The history of Sweden in the wake of Jörmungandr's demise, from the death of a king to the rise of Communist influence!
Details on the society and government of Sweden, and the conspirators, both foreign and domestic, planning its downfall!
Information on the fortress island of Heligoland, refuge of Crown Prince Gustav Adolph!
Statistics for trolls & trollwives, vile and twisted servants of the jötunn!
Scenario Sparks, adventure seeds for your adventures in post-Serpentfall Sweden!

150069.name: The Lion in Fimbulwinter: Sweden After the Serpentfall (Fate Core)
150069.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the Midgard Serpent fell to the Americans’ nuclear fire in July 1945, Denmark and Norway sheltered Sweden from the worst of it: Sweden’s survivors could shelter in their damaged buildings from the torrential rain that became torrential hail and snow. A near-civil war in the wake of Serpentfall forced the Crown Prince to flee, and a fragile coalition government holds a tenuous grasp on the reins of power. The Serpent’s body lies humped and cloudy on the western horizon. The Americans have pulled back to the Rockies; the center of the British Empire removed to Australia. The Royal Navy can keep station in the North Sea, but the Red Army commands all of Europe east of the Serpent Curtain. Soviet agents and skulk and plot in Stockholm, Göteborg and Malmö...and there are far fouler things lurking in the dark winter night.

The country its people call Mother Svea stands alone.

Inside this 10-page PDF for the Savage Worlds system you'll find:

The history of Sweden in the wake of Jörmungandr's demise, from the death of a king to the rise of Communist influence!
Details on the society and government of Sweden, and the conspirators, both foreign and domestic, planning its downfall!
Information on the fortress island of Heligoland, refuge of Crown Prince Gustav Adolph!
Statistics for trolls & trollwives, vile and twisted servants of the jötunn!
Scenario Sparks, adventure seeds for your adventures in post-Serpentfall Sweden!

150070.description:
December Subscriber's Promo Card

Item (Accessory, Magic)

Acquisition Check: (8 Charisma Diplomacy)

Powers:


Reveal this card to evade a bane with the Goblin trait.



When you defeat a bane with the Goblin trait, you may recharge this card to examine your location deck until you find a weapon, an item, or an armor; add it to your hand and shuffle the location deck.
150070.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – "Birdcruncher Crown" Promo Card

133038.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set

150071.name: A Wolf in Cheap Clothing
150071.description:
"A Wolf in Cheap Clothing" was my entry for the 2013 RPG Geek 24 Hour RPG Design Contest. The name just sort of popped into my head after I was done designing the game and realized I didn't have a title. I think the name is a nice fit for this Mystery/Noir/Detective setting. What originally got me thinking of this setting was a discussion about those old Charlie Chan movies, which I loved as a kid.

I wanted to be able to keep characters from being too min/maxed, thus the "assign a die" mechanic seemed like it might work. I'm not sure if other RPGs have ever used a similar mechanic. Flashbacks and Accolades are obviously similar to bennies, or hero points, two mechanics which I'm somewhat familiar with. The difference I liked about flashbacks was that they are really additional background story plots that are conceived during the game.

I really wanted to attach an adventure (job/assignment) within the rules, but the time constrictions kept that on the drawing board. All in all, I spent about six or seven hours on the game design.

150072.description:
June Subscriber's Promo Card

Heavy Armor (Magic)
Acquisition Check: (Constitution, Fortitude 7)

Powers: Recharge this card to reduce Combat or Fire damage dealt to you by 3.

Banish this card to reduce all damage dealt to you by 0; a random character at your location is dealt 1 Combat damage. If your are proficient with heavy armors, bury this card instead of banishing it.

If you are proficient with heavy armors, you may recharge this card when you reset your hand.
150072.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – "Goblin Plate +1" Promo Card

133038.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set

150073.name: Danger International
150073.description:
Back cover:

Launch into action with fast cars, vital secrets and high-tech hardware -- take center stage as the hero of a story you help create! DANGER INTERNATIONAL is packed with challenging adventures (including a solo for first time players), valuable source material and special game mechanics to simulate any modern adventure setting. All you need to add is your imagination!

150074.description: Slay a ferocious dragon, face the magical might of ancient sins, and claim treasures of extraordinary power with the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Sins of the Saviors Adventure Deck 5. This 110-card expansion to the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords Base Set includes new locations, monsters, villains, loot, and more, as well as 5 new scenarios that constitute the complete Sins of the Saviors adventure.
150074.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords - Adventure Deck 5 - Sins of the Saviors

133038.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set

150075.name: No Benefits
150075.description:
No Benefits is a card game about your job. The job you’d quit in four months, five years ago. Relive one week of your life in one hour.

Remember how you said you wanted to be a writer? An artisanal pickle maker? Now's your chance. It only takes you two hours to finish your data entry, but management doesn't know that. Do you really want to make copies of copies all day? Why not work on your novel and brine pickles in the bathroom instead? You’re pulling a paycheck either way. At the end of the day, players that didn't complete their tasks will be reprimanded, unless of course they can play an excuse to get out of it. Watch out for Wednesday, though, as there's always something that goes wrong on hump day.


No Benefits is set in an average workplace, where players are average employees trying to get through the daily grind. You need to balance not getting fired with working too hard, in order to finish the week as the least productive worker.

The goal of the game is to gain the most slack by the end of the 5 day working week (5 turns).

Each turn, players will be given an assignment from the day's inbox by the current Assistant Manager. On Wednesdays, crisis cards are also drawn and dealt with. Players can then play morning memos, plan their workday by selecting Grind cards to play, and then revealing their selected cards to show their progress towards their assignments. Players with incomplete assignments can plead their case with excuse cards. Without an excuse, players receive a write-up, and are fired if they gain 3. Finally, any late memos are resolved and that round's slack scores are tallied up.

The game involves a careful balance between putting off work for points, or doing work to gain sway and perks from your superiors.

150076.name: The Dread Crypt of Skogenby
150076.description:
Publisher's blurb:


The remote village of Skogenby is just a day up the Post Road from the famed House of the Three Squires, and it's suffering under a terrible curse that has left a number of villagers dead, seemingly of fright. Perhaps your adventurers can help Skogenby appease the terrible spirits that haunt them.


The Dread Crypt of Skogenby is intended as a starter scenario that you can run in one or two sessions. It serves as a great lead-in to Under the House of the Three Squires, or a sequel if you've already played through it.

150079.name: Ich spiele Einkaufen
150079.description:
Translated from the German introduction:

"Dear parents, Ich spiele Einkaufen shall support children playfully to develop a better understanding of the numbers and quantities from 1-5. The vocabulary can be expanded as well. For this discuss all items on the shopping lists and the names of the shops repeatedly. Since there are regional differences in naming the goods and shops just use the one most appropriate to you."


Ich spiele Einkaufen is a children's game which shall help to develop competence in the number range 1-5. Each player is given a list with 5 different items on it in 5 different amounts (1-5) which need to be gathered from 5 different shops.

The game map shows the different shops (3 times each) as well as a supermarket where you can get every good and 3 spots without any action. A 6 sided die numbered from 1-4 (1&2 are doubled) is rolled and the number is advanced on the shops track around the board.

If the player ends on a shop where he needs some good from he can claim it by naming the good and the amount of it (e.g. "I take 5 sausages from the butchery"). The player then picks the needed item token from the map and places it on his/her shopping list. The first player to collect all 5 items from the shopping list wins.

150080.name: Krackades
150080.description:
Krackades is a wild party game where you compete against the clock and each other to Act, Draw, or Sculpt (playdoh included) the most outrageous and irreverent things imaginable!

Players have 60 seconds to Act, Draw or Sculpt a wild phrase. To win teammates must guess 3 cards in each section before the other team.

However, the opposing team doesn't sit idly by -- they can choose to trip up the other team's success by using special cards called Krack Attacks! The first team to correctly guess enough cards wins.

150081.description:
This set of 27 promo cards was a special exclusive accompanying the Nature of the Beast: Prairie vs. Polar, and was only available to Kickstarter supporters.

Components:
1x Instruction card
8x Animal cards
4x Legend cards
10x Event cards
2x Item cards
1x Human card
1x Location card

Summary:
These special expansion cards can be added to any of the existing Nature of the Beast games, to customize their decks. Some of the cards were inspired or commissioned by Kickstarter backers. The cards offer alternative animals, legends, events, items, humans, and locations to use with the base games (Farm vs Forest, City vs Suburb, and Prairie vs Polar), and are not part of any of the battle boxes.
150081.name: Nature of the Beast: Kickstarter Exclusive Promo Card Set

20907.name: Nature of the Beast: City vs. Suburb

150082.name: Brunan, l'aventure au comptoir
150082.description:
Brunan is a party game. Players are old heroes that gather in an old tavern to remember their former lives as heroes. The active player has to tell an adventure they all lived together and challenge the other players. There are five types of challenges:
- dexterity (throw dice on the tavern map)
- physical and mental fights (dice-resolved)
- memory (remember a list of words, usually directions)
- auctions to buy a object or guessing a secret code to open the safe where it's kept
- acting (mime)

Players who successfully complete one of these activities wins a card on which a certain amount of money is indicated. At the end of the game, the player with the most money wins the game.

150083.description:
The 4th Expansion is a new game board with Monasteries printed next to the play area.
It comes with 4 new boards numbered 13a to 13h (back to back 13a-13e, 13b-13f, 13c-13g, 13d-13h)

The following rules are then added to the basic game play of "The Castles of Burgundy":


As soon as a player creates a direct, straight connection between two monasteries with 5 connecting tiles on his game board, he earns 5 victory points.



The first player to complete all three connections between his monasteries wins an additional bonus of 5-7 victory points (for a 2-4 player game). The second player to complete all three connections wins 2-4 victory points.


This means that a player can win a maximum of 3x5 + 7 = 22 additional victory points over the course of one game.

Per comments from Stefan Bruck (Alea), this will show up in the BGG Store in the near future

boardgameversion.224079: The Castles of Burgundy: The 4th Expansion

150083.name: The Castles of Burgundy: 4th Expansion – Monastery Boards

150085.name: Tansania-peli
150085.description:
Players are doing development aid by founding projects (water, hospital, farming, school) in provinces of Tanzania. Winner is the player who has founded all his projects first.

Game consists of:
1 game board,
6 pawns (jeeps),
1 dice,
72 project chips,
6 flying tickets,
40 chance cards,
15 hazard cards,
and game money (Tanzanian shillings)

150087.name: Blood of Four Kings
150087.description:
From the introduction

This scenario is a standard RPGA Network tournament.

DMs and players need not be very familiar with the Birthright setting to enjoy this scenario. Rounds One and Two require no special DM knowledge. To run Round Three, however, the DM must have access to a Birthright boxed set and be familiar with the rules for domain turns and war cards.

Most of the events of this tournament fit into the estabilished history of Cerilia: in the three rounds of the adventure, the wicked Rowena becomes the awnshegh known as the White Witch.

user comment
publication year is unknown

150088.description:
The Redshirt cards are a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 2, "The Battle of Chin'toka," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, The Dominion War. Each is a Federation Crew Upgrade card and costs 4 Squadron Points.

There are 2 versions of the card, which have different photos but the same card text. One card depicts a living "redshirt" crew member, the other a deceased "redshirt" crew member. Each Month 2 organized Play Kit includes 12 cards, six of each version.
150088.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Redshirt

150089.name: The Kingdom of Aerenwe
150089.description:
From the author's foreword

"I decided to detail the lands of Aerenwe for several reasons. Chief among these was to add to the already detailed southern coast; now if only someone would do Diemed (hint hint), a large stretch of Anuire is complete.

I tried to stick to other player secrets in the format of this document, to make it easier upon myself but to also keep the document recognisable to those familiar with the published material".

150090.name: Truncheon World
150090.description:
User Summary:

Truncheon World is a truncated version of the Dungeon World rules, to be referenced by the GM during the game and during prep. The material here is presented in a slightly different order than in the Dungeon World book.

"I got sick of lugging my hardcover copy of Dungeon World around. I thought it would be much easier to just have the GM section in a book and that's it. All the PC stuff is on the character sheets, and I mostly run prepared dungeons (or Dungeon Planet stuff) so I have monsters in my prep already.

So I made Truncheon World, a [digest-sized] book with just the GM sections and the rules I might want to reference when running the game."

150091.description:
Promotional item given away at Spiel 2013 for those who bought Yunnan at the fair.

The Tu Di Gong Shrine is a progress building. The progress of the shrine allows you to double the progress of 1 of the other progress buildings you successfully bid on.
150091.name: Yunnan: Tu Di Gong Shrine

150092.name: Construction Site
150092.description:
In Construction Site, you and your friends are builders. You have received the plans for the buildings you will construct and you have ordered the materials you will need to build. However, there has been a mix-up. Instead of receiving the materials you asked for, you get random shipments delivered at regular intervals. You and your fellow builders must team up to sort through the mess, selling what materials you can to pay for the materials you need before time runs out!

One to four players must follow Blueprint cards and play Material cards to build the structures on the Blueprints before the deck runs out.

Players have to "pay" for any Materials that they play by discarding other cards from their hands or removing cards from the Material deck. When a Blueprint is completed, players earn a reward, which is to return some cards from the discard pile to the Material deck.

Construction Site fits in a small box that fits in your pocket, containing all necessary components to play.

150093.name: Adventurer and Troll
150093.description:
TWO PLAYERS -
ONE TROLL ONE ADVENTURER.
THIS IS ABOUT NEGOTIATION
AND GETTING TO YES
OR MAYBE BEING EATEN BY A TROLL
TELL A STORY TOGETHER
INTRODUCE SMALL IDEAS
MAKE SMALL IDEAS BIG
BOTH BE REAL

150094.description:
Set of 8 cards that was a Kickstarter stretch goal and a giveaway at Spiel 2013.

Description from the Kickstarter-page: "During extraction, this card triggers an explosion that makes a driller lose a power level. For players looking for danger and additional challenges!"
150094.name: Rockwell:  Explosion Cards

150095.description:
Set of 8 cards that was an exclusive stretch goal for those who backed the game at Kickstarter.

Description from the Kickstarter-page: "During the extraction, this card allows you to earn money instead of resources."
150095.name: Rockwell: Diamond Cards

150096.name: Extra Edition!
150096.description:
RPG Introduction:

In «Extra Edition!» players form the editorial staff of a popular newspaper of the 50s: each of them will be the journalist responsible for a certain page, for instance the crime news, local news, showbiz news, sports news or whatever else they like.

If a player wishes to be the photograph, he’s allowed to do it: there shouldn’t be more than one photograph in the game though, as his task is simply to take one or two perfect photos to be published in the page, not pick up pieces of information (although he may help the other reporters with his contacts).

As in any proper RPG, the players will cooperate, each one for his own competence area, to pick up pieces of information about a specific news event that has only just occurred and cover it with an article or two in an extra edition soon to be printed. It goes without saying that this event needs to have some exceptionality and the potential to shake the town quiet: a wicked murder or an extraordinary robbery are the obvious favorites but obviously the event could be anything the GM likes it to be.

150097.name: Vercingetorix: Twilight of the Gauls
150097.description:
His father's name was Celtillus, of a noble family and a chief of the Averni tribe of Gauls--a people with a remarkably sophisticated civilization and tradition as warriors and craftsmen, but fiercely resistant toward having a ruler at beyond the tribal level. Celtillus tried to assert authority to organize and ally the disparate tribes against Roman incursions, but tradition and habit were against him and he was killed by his own people. But strife with Rome worsened, and his son elected to try again for tribal unification to survive against the two threats of voracious Rome and ambitious Julius Caesar. The son negotiated, inspired, made alliances, and finally took on the traditional title of "supreme warlord" that his father had died reaching for.

That title was "Vercingetorix," and he bore the title so well that people today think of it as his name (which we do not know). But then, no Gaul ever bore the title again. Maybe you can change that.
