ATO #44 offers Vercingetorix: Twilight of the Gauls, a new game by designer Richard Berg, that challenges players to unify Gaul in around the 1st Century B.C. from 2-4 players compete for power in all three of the main Gallic areas. The Romans and Germans are NOT active players, but introduced with random and temporary control to interfere with active player intentions. Players draw chits each turn to improve their holdings, begin campaigns, or obtain more tribal allies. Or, they may draw surprising "Opportunities" that allow them to interfere with other players' turns and even launch revolts that could suppress Roman activities and elevate player esteem. Game length varies with number of players, but most games will last 2-3 hours.

The choice is yours. Can you make the title "Vercingetorix" your own?

150098.description:
Goodie given at those people who bought Origin at Spiel 2013.

Normally when someone has taken away the hunting token from the green grassland region, it's useless to be on that region. With this die, you can roll whenever you end your move on an empty green region. Depending on the roll you will get a orange, violet or tan card, an innovation tile, the hunting token that had been put back into the box, or nothing.
150098.name: Origin: Ranger Die

150099.name: Speedcatch Doraemon
150099.description:
Doraemon is a robotic cat featured in a Japanese comic/animation series of the same title. The game comes with 5 Doraemon figures and 6 sets of 5 cards of the same color.

When you play, you take Doraemon figures, one less then there are players, and put them in the middle where everybody can reach them. You take as many sets of colored cards as there are players. You shuffle all these cards and give each player 5. Then everybody passes one of his cards at the same moment to his right hand neighbor. When a player has a set of 5 cards of the same color, he grabs a Doraemon figure and calls out 'Doraemon'. Then the remaining player have to grab one of the remaining Doraemon figures as fast as possible. The player who wasn't able to grab one, gets 1 minus point.

As soon as 1 player has 3 minus points, he loses, while all the other players win.

150100.description:
The Space Cowboys is a special "scape board" for the meeples from Rampage to the buyers of the game in Essen 2013.
This scape board accepts only grey meeples and the player who fills the scape board receives a new Secret-Super-Power card.
150100.name: Terror in Meeple City: The Space Cowboys

150101.name: Intake
150101.description:
"Intake is the new retro-futuristic drugstep arcade shooter from Cipher Prime. In this polychromatic love child of Dr. Mario and Ikaruga, you battle a never-ending barrage of pills, pushing your skill and reflexes to the limit to avoid a lethal dosage. Blast and combo your way through an epic cascade of audiovisual mayhem so intoxicating it comes with its own warning label."

Source: The Publisher Website.

150102.name: Popeye's Treasure Map Game
150102.description:
Object: To be the first player to reach his or her Treasure X near the center of the gameboard.

For 2 - 4 players

Ages 7 - 12

Contents: 24 cards, 4 playing pieces, spinner and gameboard

150103.name: Intelligensspillet Investor
150103.description:
Intelligensspillet Investor is an intelligence game with endless possibilities. It has to work formåk entertaining and educational. The rules and procedures of the game are broadly the same as those used in everyday life when you place (invisterer) money in real estate or mortgages.

The purpose of the game is to buy properties (there are 12 houses to choose from), pay out your mortgage - and avoid bankrupcy and foreclosure!
The game mechanism is a roulette with 12 (six large and six small) tiles - divided into five options;
- H: The six large green ones where you have to pay the rent for your house(s)
- D: One red where you pay taxes for roads and sewers
- S: Two reds where you pay Property Tax
- T: Two reds where you have to pay mortgage
- ?: Black where you have to pay out the last loan of the house.
Every player spin the wheel for EVERY property (s)he owns - if (s) owns more than one it is needed to state which house there is on spin.

If a player can't pay up and can't get money by other means the house will be set on auction.
The profit will go to the bankrupt seller.

The game is over after an agreed time, where every player sells there propertied back to the bank (they will get the price in the deed MINUS the eventually debt). The winner will be the one with most profit - or least loss.

Designed by real estate broker Aage Eliasen, Copenhagen

150105.name: Agents of Five
150105.description:
from the designer

In Agents of Five, players are Yuansu Shi, people of the elements, in service to the Celestial Hierarchy. In your role as one of the Agents of Five, you will use your connection to the elements to overcome obstacles and right the wrongs identified by the Celestial Hierarchy.

150106.name: Piggies
150106.description:
designer summary

Deep in the huge Machine the Piggies live their little Piggie lives. They eat. They Sleep. They watch the screens. They follow the commands of The Voice of the Machine. They are kept calm and docile so they don't get to tough. They keep themselves tender because they know the Piggies are raised to be eaten.

Between the walls of the machine the Humans eek out a life of things stolen from the Machine. Some of the humans were Piggies once. Some have always been. They live. They explore. They fight. They know the blue of the sky. They die. But they know that they will die free, and when they die they will not be eaten.

Role play humans trapped in the Piggie world of machines!

150107.name: Faëria
150107.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – IN BETA




This game is in OPEN/CLOSED Beta and has not been fully released yet.




Faëria has been designed to become the new benchmark in terms of Strategy Card Game (SCG).

Cross the TCG tradition with tactical battles, resource management and ground control... Add the particularity that players build the battlefield as they play and you get a completely new gaming experience.

Source: The Game Website.

150109.name: AGE Bestiary: Alien Horrors
150109.description:
From the publisher's web site:

Alien horrors are terrible creatures from beyond space and time. Their bodies and minds conform to strange laws foreign to normal mortals. Possessing potent sanity-bending abilities and physical might, they are a threat not only to the stalwart adventurers who battle them, but to reality itself. This product includes tips on integrating alien horrors into your AGE campaigns, along with rules for three different breeds: the alien hybrid, the extra-celestial spawn, and the hunter horror. Also included are the alien horror template for customizing other creatures, a new focus (Eldritch Lore), and notes on using forbidden texts and playing an alien hybrid.

150110.description:
Guderian Crosses the Desna takes you to the place where Guderian made his turn to the south and started the encirclement of Kiev. Two of his Panzer Divisions, 3rd and 4th, attempted to take the major bridge over the Desna River by a Coup de Main. After failing the Germans make a more deliberate attempt the next day and the fate of the Soviet Armies at Kiev is sealed.

The game has units built as Battalions for Infantry, Armor, and Artillery. Supporting arms such as Recon, anti-tank, anti-aircraft, engineer, and military intelligence are built as companies. These supporting arms units are used to multiply the combat strength of the battalions. The system uses a variable strength table that eliminates gaming the system for a few extra strength points. Players will find that combined arms are the ticket to success.

This game makes an excellent introduction to the Armored Knights game system. It is small and yet challenging. Once you learn the basics of calculating strengths things move along nicely.
150110.name: Armored Knights: Guderian Crosses the Desna 1941

150111.name: This is the Way the World Ends

rpg.23847: This is the Way the World Ends

150111.description:
Excerpt from the RPG:

It's all but over for humanity. A massive invasion has left the world in ruins with a scant few people desperately fighting back, most likely with no chance of success. You are the leader of a small group of resistance fighters, one of the few survivors who have chosen to not just hide and wait for the inevitable but to strike back against a foe that seems impossible to defeat. This is your story. This is a game of choices, values and introspection. You will play alone by imagining yourself placed in situations where you are forced to make decisions that affect the lives of your fellow fighters, and perhaps the fate of all of humanity. The key to enjoying this game is to do just that: imagine. Put yourself in the situation the game introduces and consider your emotions, your own thoughts, what your options are, and then choose. Commit to the choice, and when the consequences come accept them, contemplate them, and try to decide if what you gained was worth what you lost.

150112.name: Haunt
150112.description:
Excerpt from the RPG:

THE OLD AGE

Very little is remembered of the Empires that existed in the Old Age. The cities seemed to stretch on eternally and their spires touched the heavens. Those who are old enough to speak of these cities weep silently, remembering the atrocities that lead to their downfall. Some still dream about the blinding light that changed the world forever, while others whisper about the dark shadows that seem to exist in the ruins.

THE CURRENT WAY

The remnants of society still exist, broken and shattered in unimaginable ways. Those who survived the apocalypse were forever changed by their surroundings, becoming twisted versions of their former selves. Underground shelters and caves turned their inhabitants into dark and stout creatures; while the deep forests created pale and spindly ones. Rumors persist of enclaves of surface dwellers, relatively unchanged by the blight.

150113.name: Columna
150113.description:
2 player game, played on the spaces of a 7x7 board.

One player plays black the other white.

2 pawns, black and white.
A supply of black and white stackable pieces.

THE WIN – There are two ways to win, one way is if on your turn you manage to form an unbroken orthogonally adjacent path, connecting your pawn, your stacks and your opponent’s pawn. The second way is if you control the most stacks of 4 pieces high at endgame.

STACK - A stack is one or more pieces of either color.
The color of the stack's top piece determines its owner (e.g., a black top piece makes it a black stack).

Stacks cannot be greater than 4 pieces high.
Stacks of 4 pieces high cannot move.
Stacks cannot split.

MOVEMENT – Pawns start out on base tiles on opposite corners of the board and move along the outer edge of the board. Pawns may move to any point along either side of the board, so long as they do not jump over their opponent's pawn and so long as they do not occupy the same side of the board between base tiles.

Stacks move orthogonally along empty spaces(no jumps).

Stacks move equal to the number of pieces within the stack. (e.g. , a stack of 1 moves one space, a stack of 2 moves two spaces and a stack of 3 moves three spaces.)

Board starts out empty, then pawns are placed on the base tiles.

TURN - Black moves first, turn then alternates.

On each turn, each player must take one of the following actions, which constitutes a valid move:

•Move your pawn and drop a single piece onto any empty point that lies between your pawn and the target point as long as all the points between your pawn and your target point are also empty or
•Move your pawn and drop a single piece on top of a friendly or enemy stack that is less than 4 high, also the stack most be in line of sight of your pawn and any stacks in-between your pawn and the target stack must have less pieces than the target stack, or
•Move your pawn and then move one of your stacks.

The game ends when neither player can make a valid move on their turn.

150115.name: Far Gone Misadventure Game
150115.description:
From the Introduction:

Far Gone Misadventure Game is a role-playing game: an activity designed to be fun in which the participants entertain themselves by pretending to be people other than themselves. This game requires one person to act as a facilitator (call the GameMaSter, or GMS) who presents the rest of the players with situations. The players then interact with the GMS' events and characters to produce a shared narrative world of adventure and wonder.

You may try running a game with any number of players, but the recommended number for this game is zero.

150116.name: Walking The Tight Rope
150116.description:
The images and story for the game include the most famous tight rope walker of the time, Blondin.

Charles Blondin is famous for first walking across Niagara Falls Gorge on a tight rope in 1859. He would later walk across numerous other times and entertain the crowds by crossing blindfolded, on stilts, or with his manager on his back.

Game board shows an amusing scene with a tight rope stretched across a river flowing down from a waterfall. Directions for the game state ‘Ben’, who stands on the cliff dressed in the sailor suit has already crossed safely. The four walkers still attempting to get to the other side by way of the rope are named Ez, Uncle Tom, Fatty Fisk, and ‘the expert Blondin’.

The game board also shows people falling from the tight rope and landing in the water below. These are named in the directions too. Ebenezer is tumbling into the water, only Nebuchasnezzar’s feet are shown as he sinks below the water, Ezekiel is swimming to shore, and Jeremiah is said to be going up the ladder.

The boat in the scene is named as well. Commanded by Uncle Sam and carrying a small African-American boy, the boat represents the Freedmen’s Bureau. This agency was created in 1865 to help the newly freed slaves. With the tight rope bridging the gap, and the dangers of failing, the game is seen to give subtle references to the post civil war era.

Tight Rope is played by the spinning the indicator (earlier edition - rolling the two dice).

To step on the rope (place his piece on space 1), a player must spin a 1. To move across to number 12, a player must then spin the next number to where his piece rests. This is done by spinning two times in a row. If a player does not spin the number needed to move his piece one step ahead, the player then moves down the grid. Whenever he spin the number needed (no matter how far down the grid he is), he moves to the number near the rope. If the player does not spin the needed number and is in the last space below his numbered step, he moves back one step.

The first player across wins!

150117.name: Worms Ultimate Mayhem
150117.description:
Worms: Ultimate Mayhem is the definitive 3D Worms game! Load your weapons and experience a whole new dimension in destructive turn-based cartoon action! Taking the game into 3D creates all-new strategic and gameplay possibilities. With over 70 single-player missions and challenges, online and local multi-player for up to 4 players, 5 multi-player modes, Achievements/Trophies, unprecedented customization of both worms and weapons, and fully destructible environments, it's bursting with anarchic mayhem. Battle and puzzle your way through all of the missions from both Worms 3D and Worms 4 Mayhem - it's essentially two games in one. With the addition of HD visuals, gameplay enhancements and new extra content, it is the ultimate 3D Worms collection!

Extensive single-player content. A vast array of single-player content spanning the very best of the 3D Worms games, ranging from shooting challenges to speed runs, whilst a collection of crazy missions, interspersed with newly fully voiced narrative FMV sequences, make up the single-player campaign. Additionally, a huge number of challenges ask the player to master the individual skills of the game (such as piloting a Jetpack or steering a Parachute) in order to complete tasks such as target shooting or collecting targets, all against the clock.
Online and local multi-player for up to 4 players. Full online play for up to 4 players over a wealth of game modes such as Statue Defend, Homelands or just plain Deathmatch, plus the ability to create your own custom game settings to play against your friends! Because of the turn-based nature of the game, it can be played multi-player offline on one screen.
Fight on the randomly generated landscapes, even save and share them, which allows for a huge amount of multi-player map options!
Get competitive - Play standard or ranked games in a bid to scale the Steam Leaderboards!
Talk trash - In-game voice-chat so you can cheer on team mates or indeed win the battle against opponents verbally
Massive customization options. Players are able to name their teams, choose which hats they want their worms to wear, whether they wear glasses, have moustaches, what they say, which flag represents them, and even what gravestone they leave behind when they die.
Worms weapons and utilities. Many of the classic Worms weapons are present and correct, with the Holy Hand Grenade, Bazooka, Dynamite, Banana Bomb, Baseball Bat, Super Sheep and many more in your arsenal of destruction.
There is also a sprinkling of even more crazy and surreal weapons too, such as Alien Abduction, Fatkins Strike, Flood, Inflatable Scouser, Old Woman, Starburst and Bovine Blitz with which to wage war on your enemies.
Custom built weaponry. Players are also able to construct their own weapons from a wide selection of components. These weapons are added to the players’ arsenals and remain secret until deployed, giving opponents a nasty shock.
Fully destructible environments - deform everything in real-time.
New picture-in-picture display - This tracks every action a player makes when attacking, whilst at the same time allowing the player to retreat and not miss a single moment of the glorious action.
Numerous gameplay improvements and enhancements. New camera enhancements make it easier to follow the action; optimized AI means more intelligent enemies, and the addition of speech and lip-synching to the single-player missions makes for even more cinematic fun!
New visual improvements, with dynamic real time lighting and post process effects and shaders, make the mayhem look even more impressive.

Source: The Developer Website.

150118.name: Worms Pinball
150118.description:
The Worms crew returns, and this time they've got balls! The classic Worms Pinball sends the cute little pink guys spinning across one of the most realistic pinball tables ever created. Battle with honour through the mystic art of Worms Kung-Fu or hang at high noon with the grizzliest, pinkest cowboys this side of Texas. Only Worms Pinball offers an action packed pinball simulation of pure wormage! WormsPinball leaves nothing to the imagination. The table sports 3D LED displayed sub-games and parallel objectives, transparent ramps, user-controllable moving gadgets, moving mechanical parts and wild sound effects and music. The table contains over 150 animated parts and thousands of frames of rendered FMV animation for the LED display. It's got tilt functions, hit combinations as well as drop and dead catches, bounce and flip passes, bang backs, death saves, magnetic fields and countless other exciting features. The depth of gameplay, variety of action and sophisticated table rules ensures that Worms Pinball will have all gamers, not just hard-core pinheads, hooked.

Source: The Developer Website.

150119.name: Superfrog HD
150119.description:
In 1993 the world witnessed the birth of a new type of super hero. Now, twenty years later, Superfrog is back! But wait! Before you get all gooey-eyed, Superfrog HD isn’t just some quick and easy port of the 16-bit version but with fancy graphics! It’s a complete re-imagining with tweaked gameplay, reworked levels and, of course, enhanced high definition cartoon style artwork. A nod to the 16-bit platformers of old, Superfrog HD is a retro classic reborn.
In the greatest traditions of fairy tales our story sees a handsome prince turned into a slimy frog by an evil and jealous witch; who, in turn, kidnaps the prince's bride to be and heads for the hills. Our little green friend happens upon a mystery potion (wow, how lucky was that?). Chugging on the vial, the frog prince is bestowed with amazing powers. Determined to defeat the witch our hero sets out on an adventure that, with your help, will lead him to his true love.
You must explore and traverse 24 finely crafted levels and additional boss levels across 6 differently-themed worlds. The goal of each level is to collect a set number of coins, and then reach the exit. The ultimate aim, as ever, is to save the day, beat the witch and get the girl.

Source: The Developer Website.

150121.name: Merry Christmas Game
150121.description:
Typical race spin and move game. First player, who cross 77 stations (24 of them are numbered) wins the game.
Game board is on the bottom of the box.

150122.name: Disciples: Reincarnation
150122.description:
Called "Disciples 3: Rebirth" in Russian.

Available thru GamersGate and Steam activation only.

User Summary

Disciples: Reincarnation is a single game containing overhauled versions of both Disciples 3: Renaissance and Disciples 3: Resurrection. It introduces a significant number of additions and changes to both games.

The various changes and additions include the introduction of online multiplayer for Disciples 3, naval combat, while there has also been a redrawing of the environments to make the levels more open and the combat arenas smaller. Other differences from the earlier versions include a modified inventory for units, greater statistical feedback, new quests, spells, and a map editor for the creation of custom campaigns.

Source: The Game Website.



A true rebirth of the legendary series.
The Almighty has turned away from Nevendaar and its denizens. He is busy thinking about the fate of the world. Above Nevendaar, rent by perpetual wars, a new star flashed out. What will it bring with it? Who will claim its great power? Immerse in the struggle of four powerful races!Features:

- Unique visual style and magnificent gothic atmosphere in a new implementation.
- Dramatic and intriguing plot, written by Ekaterina Stadnikova, the author of the most successful Disciples-themed novel "Precious Blood"
- New combat and magic system. Dozens of new global spells
- Totems and flags in the inventory and on the battlefield
- Aquatic spaces with majestic ships and terrifying bosses
- Over 180 hours of gameplay. Four companies; 27 large detailed missions, over 70 new side quests, significantly extending the main storyline
- Over 200 new objects on land and sea; 13 new neutral units
- Multiplayer in hot-seat mode and over the net. Playing for neutral units is now possible
- Gaming editor to create your own campaigns.

Source: The Game Website.

150123.name: 1, 2, Hüpferei!
150123.description:
Who can guide the frogs to the pond? In 1, 2, Hüpferei!, two kids try to walk frogs to the pond by rolling a die. The die determines whether the frog moves one or two spaces, and the player whose frog first reaches the pond wins.

Included in 1, 2, Hüpferei! are an extra die and rules for a more advanced game.

150124.name: Machinations of the Space Princess
150124.description:
From publisher blurb:

Machinations of the Space Princess is a Science-Fantasy role-playing game. That means it’s very much about style over substance, mixing science-fiction, magic and psionics in a game world that owes much more to Metal Hurlant and Star Wars than it does to 2001 or Bova’s Grand Tour. This is a game of strangeness and fun, of space pirates and beautiful alien princesses, of living planets and robot hordes, of blasters at noon.

This is...

Sexy, sleazy, swords and sci-fi!

A full game combining old and new school thinking, packed with GM and player advice and with simple tools for creating your own monsters, adversaries, weapons, armour, ships and alien races.

150125.name: Exotic Encounters: Centaurs
150125.description:
From publisher blurb:

This particular installment of Exotic Encounters focuses on the centaur. These icons of Greek mythology have fulfilled many roles in fantasy media, from savage barbarian stand-ins for Mongols, Huns, and other nomadic horselords, to fey-like guardians of nature and wilderness, with many roles in between. In Pathfinder, their lowly CR 3 status and the fact that their horselike bodies don’t really belong in underground dungeons means that many adventurers may never encounter one, but the new centaurs in this book may just change all that. The first such centaur, the plainsrunner centaur (CR 4) ties into the image of centaurs as steppe-dwelling nomads, and these centaurs are exceptionally fast and agile, making for incredibly maneuverable opponents. The second centaur in the book, the skyborn centaur (CR 6), is partially celestial in nature, and has great white wings that allow it to fly through the air. It specializes in jousting and duels, and is incredibly proficient at charging with a lance. Finally, the nightcharger centaur (CR 8) is the spawn of a night hag and a nightmare, and combines their most dreaded powers in new and unusual ways, as well as having its own curse of doom ability, which blocks its victims from having any lucky breaks, and exacerbates the effects of bad luck.

150126.name: OpenQuest 2nd Edition Deluxe
150126.description:
From publisher blurb:

A complete and easy to play Fantasy Roleplaying game, with monsters, magic and exotic locales.

OpenQuest uses the classic D100 rules mechanic, which uses percentages to express the chance of success or failure.

This is the 2nd Edition of the game in full colour with 80 new pages of content. The Deluxe version of the game aims to be a self contained game with rules and advice on how to run a full campaign where the adventurers progress from their poor and ill experienced beginnings to the lofty heights of Godhood!

Open Quest is based on the Mongoose RuneQuest SRD (MRQ SRD), with ideas from previous editions of Chaosium's RuneQuest and Stormbringer 5th, mixed in with some common sense house rulings from the author's twenty years of experience with the D100 system.

150127.name: Spinechillers: Lovecraft Inspired Tricks and Traps for Any RPG
150127.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spinechillers is a system free add-on for tabletop RPGs. It’s full of 500+ highly configurable traps, spinechillers, omens and other hazards or surprises. The content can be put to a number of uses:

Scattering unexpected and unusual events through an adventure or across a campaign.
Designing high intensity gameplay using clusters of high impact encounters.
Adding layers of mystery, suspense and mayhem to adventures and campaigns.
Remixing existing adventures or campaigns by parachuting in hazardous and/ or menacing encounters.
Raising the emotional content of the gameplay by reinstating the sense of the unknown and the unexpected so often reported as part of new players’ gameplay.
Building gritty and grimy gameplay.

150128.name: Wall $treet Raider
150128.description:
User Summary

Wall $treet Raider is a long-running, stock market trading game.

At the start of the game the player(s) decide how long the game will run by setting the difficulty level and the number of game-years to be played. Each year has four trading quarters each of which represents one turn per player. Players start with a small inherited fortune and when it is their turn to play they can do virtually anything a trader can do, and more.
Stock in any company can be traded, loans can be arranged, companies can be researched, the holdings of other players can be investigated as can their relative net worth. The player can arrange buy-outs, mergers, issue junk bonds, make public offerings, liquidate companies, sue competitors and much, much more. The game even allows the player to become CEO of companies which they can then asset strip, liquidate or nurture.

The game was initially developed as a board game in 1967 while the author, Michael D. Jenkins, was at Harvard. Over several years of playing and refinement the board game, then called "Robber Baron", grew and became very complex taking many hours, even days to complete.

A computer version was released commercially in 1986 and despite good reviews it did not sell well. Michael Jenkins reacquired the rights to the software in 1988 and released the game as shareware, it has been in continuous development and improvement ever since, initially running under DOS and under Windows since 2001.

150129.name: Gadget Guide: Installations
150129.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each Gadget Guide in the series takes a look at a particular type of devices in Mutants & Masterminds game terms, putting together the effects and modifiers from the Hero's Handbook to present different a wide variety of gadgets of that type. It also looks at specific concepts related to creating and using those devices in play. The Guide is a catalog of ready to use toys for your M&M game!


Installations

Even in the modern world of superheroes, archaic weapons like swords, hammers, and bows remain common. Some of these weapons are enhanced by magic or technological gadgetry, while others rely solely on the tremendous skill of their wielders. In either case, old school weapons are primary tools for many heroes and villains and this Gadget Guide looks at them in detail.

150130.description:
Bonus card for Dungeon Fighter at Essen 2013.

German:
WISSBEGIERIG: Du erhälst 4XP
ERZFEIND (Mensch): Du verursachst +4 Schaden gegen Menschen, selbst wenn du den Trefferspielplan nicht triffst.
DREIZACKSTICH: Berührt ein geworfener Würfel mehr als eine Zone des Trefferplans, verursachst du die Summe aus allen berührten Trefferzonen an Schaden.

English (note: this is a user translation):
INQUSITIVE: You get 4XP.
NEMESIS: You deal +4 damage against humans, even if you don't hit the target board.
TRIDENT HIT: If a rolled die borders on more than one area of the target board, you deal the sum of all touched areas of damage.
150130.name: Dungeon Fighter: Marielle, the Mermaid

150131.description:
This expansion provides players with a set of mini modules, each adding a different species of zombies to the game. These special species modify the entire horde they are part of inside a room. However, before these type of zombies can be defeated, all other zombies in the room must be eliminated, as the other zombies in the horde will protect this more powerful species.

The following zombie species are introduced:

Disco Doll Zombies - The horde can move 3 instead of 2 tiles
Guts Zombies - One bite result of the horde cannot be dodged by a defense roll
Chunk Zombies - Horde can only be defeated in close combat
Tuff Guy Zombies - You need 2 hits to kill the zombies in this horde.
150131.name: Dark Darker Darkest: Zombie Expansion

150132.description:
The expansion adds up to 3 victims who are hiding in the Mortimer's house and must be kept alive until the endgame is triggered.

During the setup phase players place one or more victims, each in a separate locked room in the house. The team shouldd try to prevent creatures entering a victim's location. if one or more survivors share a room with a victim, they automatically protect the victim during an attack.

All victims are removed from the board when the endgame is triggered.
150132.name: Dark Darker Darkest: Victims Mini Expansion

150133.description:
In this expansion the team has an extra mission to accomplish in order to win the game. After defeating the Nemesis, they must safely reach a helicopter that's circling above in order to escape the doomed house of Doctor Mortimer.

As soon as the team has defeated the Nemesis, the Darkness track is reset and the team is given 4 turns to reach the helicopter. For the team to win, at least half of the survivors must escape the house.
150133.name: Dark Darker Darkest: Heli Escape Expansion

150134.name: Deck Hockey
150134.description:
Deck Hockey is a Co-Operative game that replicate a Street Hockey game. Team up to be the ones who finish the 3rd period with the most goals scored and win.

Played 2vs2 or in team (3vs3, 4vs4, 5vs5)Deck Hockey is a family game. Designed to be played by all member of your family and kids, you will enjoy "break sticks", play "the trap", get the "Momentum" and carefully use your Slap Shot.

Players are places around the table so they have an opponent at their right and one at their left. One full deck represent one period and the game have 3 periods.

The "ice" is represented by 5 cards places on a table. 1 neutral zone, 1 red zone, 1 blue zone, a red and a blue goalie. A puck with 2 sided coloured (Blue and red obviously) serves to mark the progression of the puck on the ice. The puck will advance from zone to zone up to the goalie where you can attempt a shot... if the opposing team do not intercept first.

As the game start each players will draw 6 cards from the deck. In this deck are the shot cards, pass cards, interception cards and save cards. The deck also contain a series of number cards from 1 to 8 (6 of each). If your team has the control of the puck, you can pass or shot by playing the right card. if not you can intercept or have to attempts saves if you opponent shoots on you.

2 piles are set for the played cards on the table. One for the action cards and on for the numbered cards. The numbered cards mostly works the same way as the action cards: If you can match from you hand the numbered card on top of the "Number pile", you create an action. If your team has the control of the puck, you create a pass or shot and if you dont you can intercept or attempts make the save if you opponent shoots on you.

A set of card in the deck serves as interaction between players to add more reality to the game and to give you an edge on your opponents. The Brocken Stick, The Trap, The Time Out, The Momentum, etc.

150135.name: Demon Pack 02
150135.description:
User summary:

A collection of three fan-created demon races submitted to Apocalypse Prevention and chosen to be published in an official supplement.It covers the Dunbar, Grandels, and Olivers.

150137.name: Just For Kicks New Frontier
150137.description:
J.F.K.'s "Just For Kicks New Frontier Game" is based on President John F. Kennedy, family and politics.

Game play: roll the dice, move exact spaces, take a card and follow the instructions written on them.

The object of the game is to reach the White House before your opponents. The first player to enter the White House wins and is President; 2nd - Attorney General; 3rd - Secretary of State and the last one becomes Vice President.

Games pieces include:
1 dice
4 tokens (white token is the PT-109, red token is a bottle of scotch, blue token is a football and the silver token is a cracked spaceship)
20 Brownies Ye Olde Apple Polish cards
20 Boner cards
1 game board 18 7/8" X 18 7/8".

150138.description:
Diez Negritos (translated as And Then There Were None) is a cooperative board game based on the Agatha Christie novel of the same name. In this game, players take control of a group of characters isolated in a mansion on a lonely island. The characters start getting murdered one after another, and players need to make groups with the characters and send them to different locations, either in the mansion or on the island, in order to discover clues and disclose the identity of the murderer.

Players decide when to take advantage of each character's ability and cards, in addition to guessing who is necessary and who is dispensable. Ideally you'll reveal the killer's identity before time runs out — but not all of the players are what they seem to be and the murderer may have an unsuspected accomplice amongst your group.

Will you be able to cooperate and unmask the killer and his accomplice before the last of the characters dies?


Diez Negritos es un juego cooperativo basado en la novela homónima de Agatha Christie. En él tomaremos el control de un grupo de personajes aislados en una mansión de una solitaria isla. Poco a poco los asesinatos se irán sucediendo y deberemos ponernos de acuerdo para formar grupos con los 10 personajes y enviarlos a los distintos emplazamientos disponibles, tanto en la mansión como en la isla, para desvelar las pistas y así revelar la identidad del asesino.

Tendréis que aprovechar la habilidad y las cartas de cada personaje, decidir cuales serán necesarias y cuales prescindibles y, con un poco de suerte, lograréis revelar la identidad del culpable antes de que se agote el tiempo. ¡Pero cuidado! No todos los jugadores son lo que parecen y tal vez el asesino tenga un cómplice insospechado entre vosotros...

¿Seréis capaces de cooperar y descubrir al asesino y su cómplice antes de que muera el último de los personajes?
150138.name: 10 Negritos

150140.name: El Gran Escape
150140.description:
It's a roll and move game about fowarding pawns across a 50 boxes path with many traps and short-cuts. Its theme is about a persecution of a dangerous gangster, called "Mr. Kill" and his exotic gang.

The game was a board made with collectible stickers as a promotional resource of a Chilean Gas Station Company (COPEC) in year 1988.

150141.name: Res Romana: Class et Religion
150141.description:
From the Weird Wars Rome Kickstarter:

A supplement by Jack Emmert (of Cryptic Studios) on the role of class and race, the gods, and myths and legends of ancient Rome.

150142.name: Heroes of Rome Figure Flats
150142.description:
From the Weird Wars Rome Kickstarter:

Six pages of figures, including everything from a variety of player character legionaries to optios, signifiers, civilians, marines, and many different auxilia

150143.name: Guerra en el Pacifico
150143.description:
War in the Pacific is a board game set in the armed conflict between 1879 and 1883 faced Peru , Bolivia and Chile, for 2, 3 or 4 players ages 8 and older . There are two sides through which you can play : the alliance of Peru and Bolivia and Chile .

The goal is to achieve 10 victory points or take one of the enemy capitals , who achieved first of these two goals are procalama winner.

The game has several dynamics : the first war strategy with troop movements and historic ships of the conflict, the second political- diplomatic strategy to gain advantages in combat or otherwise, and the third heroic dimension , with different characters historical choose to modify the game mechanics, as Grau, Prat, Abaroa, Bolognesi, Baquedano, Pinto, among others.

The aim of the game is to contemplate war two centuries ago from a different perspective, with serenity and spirit edutainment. It's time to watch episodes of our history with distance and reflection that gives time, without national animosities at a table where camaraderie reigns.


Guerra en el Pacífico es un juego de mesa ambientado en el conflicto armado que entre 1879 y 1883 enfrentó a Perú, Bolivia y Chile, para 2, 3 o 4 jugadores de 8 años de edad en adelante. Existen dos bandos por los que se puede jugar: la alianza de Perú y Bolivia o Chile.

El objetivo del juego es lograr 10 puntos de victoria o tomar una de las capitales enemigas, quien logre primero una de esas dos metas se procalama vencedor.

El juego tiene varias dinámicas: la primera de estrategia bélica con movimiento de tropas y de los barcos históricos del conflicto, la segunda de estrategia político-diplomática para conseguir ventajas de combate o de otra clase, y la tercera una dimensión heroica, con diferentes personajes históricos a escoger que modifican la mecánica del juego, como Grau, Prat, Avaroa, Bolognesi, Baquedano, Pinto, entre otros.

El objetivo del juego es que contemplar la guerra de hace dos siglos desde un punto de vista distinto, con serenidad y espíritu lúdico-educativo. Es hora de ver episodios de nuestra historia con la distancia y reflexión que el tiempo otorga, sin animadversiones nacionales y en una mesa donde reine la camaradería.

150144.name: Stak Bots
150144.description:
The battling robots card game comes to iOS! It's easy to learn, quick to play and impossible to put down! With dozens of adorable (but also deadly) robots!

Build your Stak and attack your opponent using the army of bots at your disposal. Every bot is unique and the game will be very different depending on which bots you have and how you use them. The last player with cards left in their Stak is the winner!

Stak Bots is a two-player game which lets you challenge your Facebook friends. You can also jump straight into a game against the next available opponent or play offline with pass-and-play and practice modes.

The app features all 16 bots from the original card game, and the "Bot of the Day" feature offers a sneak peek at several of the upcoming expansion bots too!

You have arrived to help your Bots during a time of great crisis, for they are in the midst of what will later come to be known as "The Great Bickering". Bots who once stood alone have found others with similar ideals and formed together to create mighty Staks, with new Bots coming to join them at every turn.

You must guide your Stak of Bots to victory, by scrapping all other Bot Staks that stand against you, for they are clearly in the wrong. Learn what each of your Bots is capable of and how to command them.

Stak them wisely, choose your attacking Bots carefully, rely on your skills, trust to luck and maybe you will be able to defend what you and your Bots stand for.

Get to know your bots and they will serve you well!

Source: The Publisher Website.

150145.description:
Grandpa Beck's Scheming and Skulking, a.k.a. Skull King, is a trick-taking game similar to Oh Hell!, Wizard and Spades, with players needing to state how many tricks they think they'll win each round. Special cards can throw off your best efforts, however, so watch how others bid and play carefully.

Skull King uses a 66-card deck that consists of five "escape" cards, four suits numbered 1-13, five pirate cards, 1 "Scary Mary" card, 1 "Skull King" card, and 2 mermaid cards. The game lasts ten rounds, and in each round, each player is dealt as many cards as the number of the round. All players simultaneously bid on the number of tricks they think they'll take by holding out a fist and on the count of three revealing a certain number of fingers (or possibly a closed fist for a bid of zero tricks).

Standard rules apply for the playing of cards, with one player leading off a card and other players following suit, if possible, and playing something else if not; however, a player may always choose to play one of the special, unnumbered cards — and the power of those cards might let you win a trick that otherwise would have gotten away. In more detail, the black skull-and-crossbones suit trumps the other three suits, a mermaid trumps the black cards, a pirate trumps the mermaid, and the Skull King trumps everything — except if he appears in the same trick with a mermaid, in which case she seduces him and wins instead. An escape card can't win a trick, and the "Scary Mary" card serves as either a pirate or escape card as desired by the player. Whoever wins a trick leads in the next trick.

If a player makes his bid exactly, he scores 20 points per trick; if he collects more or fewer tricks, he loses 10 points per trick he's off. If a player makes a bid of zero tricks, he wins points equal to ten times the current round number — but if he takes even a single trick, he loses this many points instead. If a player catches pirates with the Skull King, or the King with a mermaid, he scores bonus points. Whoever has the most points after ten rounds wins.
150145.name: Skull King

boardgamehonor.26782: 2014 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee

150146.description:
"Welcome, girls and boys. My name is Rattlebones, and you have been cordially invited to spend the day at my Fabulous Festival of Dice! Play games! Win prizes! Ride the train! I'll be wandering about the park, and if you're the first one to find me, you win! Won't that be delightful?"

Rattlebones is a game about transforming dice. You start with standard six-sided dice, and throughout the course of the game you can remove sides and replace them with other sides that let you do all sorts of wonderful things. Every time you score points, you get closer to finding Rattlebones and, er, winning the game. Yes, winning! It's an experience to six-sided-die for!


Game Summary
Setup
- Place the Rattlebones meeple at 55, 60, or 65 VP space (for 2-4 players). Players each get 3 d6 (black, white, gray) -- basic d6 but the '1' is replaced by Rattlebones.
- Place random tiles on the empty spaces on the board.

Your Turn
Roll a die. May spend 1-2 gold to roll an extra 1-2 dice. Then, use each die one at a time:
- if Rattlebones shows, move Rattlebones back one space; game ends immediately if it hits a player score marker and most points wins.
- if pips or Rattlebones showing, move one of your pawns clockwise that many spaces (RB=1) and use the space you land on. Typically, you may add a die face matching that space to the die you used (replace any face except Rattlebones).
- otherwise, take whatever action the face allows (e.g., earn a stock marker or star token, which you may later turn in for VP; earn VP; steal stuff from other people; etc.).
150146.name: Rattlebones

150147.name: Break In
150147.description:
Break In is a push-your-luck card game in the vein of Incan Gold, with players trying to steal as many gems as possible from a bank before they get caught. The longer you stick around, the more you'll earn — but stay too long and you'll find yourself wearing handcuffs!

Break In — first published online in the game compilation "Femtitvå" — can be played with a standard deck of cards or with the free downloadable card deck provided online. To set up, remove the 7-10 in each suit from the deck. Shuffle the cards into three or four equal stacks, after which each player can look through one stack, then reshuffle that stack.

On a turn, a player draws the top card from a stack of her choice. If a face card shows up, it counts as a guard and is placed face-up on the table; any other card counts as cash and is placed in front of the player. (An ace also allows the player to look through one stack, then reshuffle it.) At any time during the round, a player can cash out, scoring one point for each pip on the cards in front of her and one point for each card face-up on the table, whether cash or guards.

If a second guard shows up in a suit, then the round ends and no one still in the round scores for the cash in front of them. After five rounds, whoever has the highest score wins.

150149.name: Quests of Shadowgate
150149.description: Quests of Shadowgate is a 2-4 player card game based on the world of Shadowgate. Each player takes turns playing items from a shared adventure deck to help complete quests. Completing quests gives a player victory points based on which items were used to complete the quest. Once a player has amassed enough items to defeat the "Staff of Ages" quest, the game ends and the player with the most victory points wins.

150150.name: OSRIC Referee Screen Charts

rpg.1297: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

150150.description:
from the cover sheet:
These sheets have been compiled from Version 2.00 of the OSRIC rules. The intent is to allow you to print them out and insert/glue/attach or otherwise secure them to your Referee screen of choice. There are 3 pages of screens/charts available.

On some of the charts, columns (mainly cost in gold) have been omitted to allow as much information as possible onto the screen. See the OSRIC Appendix A “Compiled Tables” for additional information.

150151.name: The Coon Hunt Game
150151.description:
This is a simple spin and move game where you begin your adventure from Uncle Hastus, follow the directions on the stops and should come back to Uncle first to win the game.

Complete game: 6 wooden game pieces, spinner, & box. The bottom of the box is the game board.

150152.name: Dr. Nagelius' Miszellen
150152.description:
user summary

This Supplement brings more types of adventurers and new skills for Midgard Abenteuer 1880, a game masters screen and two maps.

150153.description:
This is a set of two cards with different winnings for the number of Small Rides and for the number of Medium Rides in your park.
It was given to the buyers of the game at Essen 2013.
150153.name: Steam Park: Essen Special Cards

150154.name: Der Kodex
150154.description:
user summary

Der Kodex contains the core rules of the fifth edition of Midgard. Unlike it's fourth edition predecessor it contains a bestiary.

150155.name: Das Arkanum
150155.description:
user summary

Das Arkanum is the second book of the core rules of the fifth edition of Midgard. It contains the spells, magical items and descriptions of the faiths and magical schools found on the world of Midgard.

150156.description:
A wine testing trivia/word/memory game which includes a wine tasting element.

The game starts with the wine tasting part of the game. A blind wine tasting is performed and the players try to guess as many attributes of the wine as possible (Country, district, grape, year). With at least two correct answers you get a wine card.

From here the game is a roll and move game where you perform a task depending on which spot you land on.

Fun facts: The player reads a fun fact about wine, this player is rewarded with a wine card
Intermezzo: Good or bad things happen to the player. Follow the instructions on the card
Bubbly letters: Try to find the correct word from the scrambled words
Word rally: Make your team mates say four words
Picture memory: The team tries to memorize a picture for 30 seconds. The other team then give them a question about the picture

When one team have reached the end of the game track the team with the most wine cards is the winner.
150156.name: Prova vin!

150157.name: In der Hitze des Südens
150157.description:
user summary

A collection of three adventurers in the southern regions of Midgard:


Die Herrin der tausend Tode - The mistress of a thousand deaths
Im Land des fliegenden Feuers - In the land of flying fire
Vatarahrn (der dunkle Diener) - Vatarahrn (the dark servant)

150158.name: Nikostria - Im Herzen Chryseias
150158.description:
user summary

A description of the greek inspired city of Nikostria in central Chryseia. The book also includes three adventures and a map of the city.

150159.name: Das kleine Kompendium
150159.description:
user summary

Das kleine Kompendium is a shortened version of Das Kompendium, missing the two parts Das Buch der Abenteuer and Das Buch der Ferne.

150160.name: Zombies vs. Wrestlers
150160.description:
Zombies vs. Wrestlers is the fourth game in the Army vs. Aliens series, with each game being playable on its own while also allowing for any faction in one game to be played against any faction in another or for multiple sets to be combined for team games or "last man standing" challenge matches.

As in the other games, Zombies vs. Wrestlers features two new asymmetric forces: zombies (lead by the necromancer) and wrestlers (lead by the Luchador). Each player takes one of the factions and rolls all nine dice. Taking turns, players then either attack the opponent or use a special power. Dice that are used are placed into the dice cup. If a player cannot attack or use a power, he instead "rallies", rolling the dice cup and simultaneously rerolling all of his dice still in play.

The zombie dice are unique in that they have no rank 4 unit, and instead have an additional rank 1 unit on their dice. However, they have several powers that revolve around gaining extra rank 1 units. The wrestlers have a more standard 123456 ranks, but have unique special powers involving "roll offs" and "tag team" plays.

150161.name: Foreign Element
150161.description:
From Mystic Ages Publishing web site:

Foreign Element is a roleplaying game of furious science fiction in a universe gone mad.

Humanity's ambitious push into the stars is halted with a mysterious event known as the Great Blackout. Thousands of colonies, space stations, and space craft go silent in a matter of days and weeks. Now, the Interplanetary Union is scrambling to discover what happened, sending out RX teams to diagnose the rot spread through known space.

That's where you come in. Infiltrate remote outposts, hack into corporate secrets, and blast your way through enemy hordes as you unlock this mystery and your hero's destiny.

150162.name: Pirates vs. Ninjas
150162.description:
The second game in the "AvA" series that started with Army vs. Aliens. It is a stand alone 2 player game, but can be combined with the other games in the series for variety or for larger games.

Each player takes one of the factions and rolls all 9 dice. Then players alternate either attacks or using a special power. Dice that are used are put back into the dice cup. If a player cannot attack or use a power, they instead 'rally' and roll the dice cup (and reroll any or all of their dice still in play).

The two forces have different special powers.

150163.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 56 - Oct 2008)
150163.description:
This issue contains the adventure Unbekannte Schmerzen (unknown pain).

Articles of this issue that are considered official:


Söldner und Piraten - (page 10)
Die Izba - (page 14)
Rang und Namen (32 & 33) - (page 32)

150164.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 58 - Sep 2009)
150164.description:
user summary

This Issue contains articles about a cloister and saints in Chryseia.

Articles of this issue that are considered official:


Die Götter Ta-mekets - (page 30)
Rang und Namen - (page 54)
Leckereien aus der Halblingsküche - (page 66)

150165.name: Schreckensgespenst
150165.description:
user summary

The adventurers travel to the Halfdal, the home of the Halflings, and have to safe it from an outside danger.

150166.name: Der Glanz der Mondscheibe
150166.description:
user summary

This adventure was inspired by the Nebra sky disk. In it the adventurers are searching for a druidic artifact.

150167.description:
From publisher's website:

On June 25th, 1950, North Korean forces surged across the 38th Parallel into South Korea, starting what would become the Korean War. Within days the South Korean capital of Seoul had fallen and the Republic of Korea (ROK) Army had been routed. Remnants retreated southward and finally gathered around the port city of Pusan, where American troops had begun to arrive under the authority of the United Nations. Here on the Pusan Perimeter the U.N. forces would make their final stand.

Korean War - Pusan Perimeter is a complete boxed game in the Panzer Grenadier series based on these fearsome battles. You do not need any other game to play all of its 48 scenarios. Design is by Jay Townsend, creator of our Saipan game.

The North Koreans have a wide array of Soviet-made weapons, spearheading their attack with T-34/85 tanks. The South Koreans are fairly lightly equipped, while their American allies bring the tanks and guns that won the Second World War: M26 Pershings, M24 Chaffees and a blistering helping of air power.

The game includes four semi-rigid mapboards, with art by Guy Riessen. The maps are fully compatible with all others in the Panzer Grenadier series (and those from Panzer Grenadier (Modern) and Infantry Attacks, too). Plus 517 playing pieces: ultra-thick, scorchless, sootless laser-cut piece, a joy just to hold in your hands. And 48 scenarios.
150167.name: Panzer Grenadier: Korean War – Pusan Perimeter

150169.description:
The Martian DreadBall Team, whilst not being written into the background (Earth is a ravaged wasteland in the Warpath universe after all!) will be a balanced team comprised of 2 Strikers, 4 Jacks and 2 Guards.

Source: Mantic Games
150169.name: DreadBall: Mars Attacks Martian Team

150170.name: Anduin (Issue 73 - Jun 2002)
150170.description: Another 80 pages filled with three adventures, articles, a comic, and reviews.

150171.name: Beatrix Potter's Peter Rabbit Race Game
150171.description:
From the box -

A fun race game for all the family between Peter Rabbit, Squirrel Nutkin, Jemima Puddle Duck and Jeremy Fisher.

In the game each players (2-4) takes one of the famous Beatrix Potter characters from their starting square to the party being held in the woods (centre of the board), by throwing a die and moving the number of squares, drawing cards when indicated by the board with instructions (i.e Miss 1 Turn or have another go etc). First to the centre wins.

150172.name: When Vikings Attack!
150172.description:
When Vikings Attack! plays like an arena melee brawler game. The only hard rule is that throwing objects are only allowed. Players control a small group of civilians fighting hordes of vikings. The objective is to pick up objects and throw to knock out enemies. Every vikings and civilians are fragile to every strike from a thrown object and will be knocked out in one hit. Each time an object collides with a figure, they're knocked out and excluded from the group, but larger or wide objects may even knock out an entire group, resulting in the player being eliminated. Lost civilians can be replaced by recruiting stray people roaming field. The game also features special items to be thrown such as explosive bombs for an area of effect attack.

Source: Wikipedia, "When Vikings Attack!," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

150173.name: Best of PlayStation Network, Vol. 1
150173.description:
User Summary

When Vikings Attack - Unite the townsfolk and fight back against the invasion

Sound Shapes - Play, Compose and Share in a unique take on the classic side-scrolling platformer where your actions make the music

Tokyo Jungle - Unleash your inner beast to hunt your way to the top of Tokyo's post-apocalyptic food chain

Fat Princess - Rescue your beloved princess through teamwork in this comic medieval battle royale

150174.name: Lilly Looking Through
150174.description:
What Lilly sees is about to change her life forever….
Help our heroine through a variety of enchanting environments brimming with magic and wonder, as she seeks to rewrite the past, change the present, and unlock the ultimate mystery. Geeta Games presents an animated adventure for all ages:
Lilly Looking Through.

Source: The Developer Website.

150175.name: The Cadet Game
150175.description:
The object of the game is to reach West Point, the first player to do so wins the game. Players spin the dial and advance their counter as many spaces as the number spun.

If the counter rests upon a space with the picture of cannon on it, players follow the instructions: lose next turn, start over again, move up to next player, all players move one space forward, etc.

If it rests upon a space with a star, the player reads the meaning, which does not affect the game, such as: You will marry young and happy; You will become a great general etc.

150176.name: The Little Soldier Boy
150176.description: Typical race spin and move game. The first player who travel from "Home" to "Commander in Chief" wins the game.

150177.description:
Triple Threat is a two-player micro strategy game set that includes three micro games: Better Gnomes and Gardens, Conquest of the Cosmos and Dragon's Dinner.

Better Gnomes and Gardens:
The greatest magazine known to gnome-kind, Better Gnomes and Gardens (BG&G), is about to announce the Gardener of the Year Award. That winner will be elevated to gnome celebrity status overnight if selected. And it just so happens that this year, the magazine will be judging gardens in your area of the kingdom.

Any gnome worth their garden hoe knows that only fairy dust will grow the best flowers. For years, you and your partner have found the perfect spot where the little winged dandruff-sufferers fly. However, with the contest looming, the magical gloves are off between you two. You’ll use your spells to rearrange the garden a bit. Hey, you can’t help it if your flowers happen to be the only ones under the oncoming flying fertilizers. As they say, "That’s just how the seedling sprouts."

The goal of Better Gnomes and Gardens is to maneuver your Flower cards into the path of oncoming fairies and earn the most points.

Conquest of the Cosmos:
Space, a word that means lots of nothing. Your mission is to seek out five points of planetary goodness. To destroy civilizations and others that get in your way. To boldly go and say, "This is mine!"

The goal of Conquest of the Cosmos is to be the first to earn 5 points by outmaneuvering your opponent and conquering planets.

Dragon's Dinner:
For centuries the Elder Dragons have been telling younger generations not to play with their food, but you and your friend want to challenge that. To your surprise, there is so much your food can do. You can keep decorative trophies or intimidate your food in to doing things for you. Sure you could just chomp them down to restore your strength, but it’s so much better to be entertained. Now fun is what’s for dinner.

The goal of Dragon's Dinner is to To collect the most Trophy points from your meal(s).
150177.name: Triple Threat

150179.name: Biberbau & Co.
150179.description:
Today is the groundbreaking ceremony! Full of beans, the frog, rabbit, beaver and hamster want to build houses of different heights. It doesn't matter whether the buildings end up a little unsteady as long as no two floors are identical. If you decide to stop drawing cards at the right moment, you will be the happy winner in the end.

In Biberbau & Co., players have to construct a house with two floors (for the frog), three floors (rabbit), four floors (beaver), and one with one to five floors for the hamster. They take turns drawing cards — which represent levels of a building — deciding after each draw whether to finish the house with the current number of levels for the specific kind of animal or continue drawing to go for a higher house worth more points in the end. If they draw two identical levels, however, the building is forfeited and their turn is over.

150180.description:
The rules from two authentic ancient Egyptian games, Senet and The Palm Tree Game, form the basis of this game. The track comes from a wall painting from a tomb in Thebes. The pawns mimic the escape of slaves from the garden.

The players are the slaves who try to escape the garden of Amon. The game consist of two phases. During the day phase the players run through the garden, obtaining Fate Cards along the road. When a player reaches the resting place with his 5 pawns, the night phase starts. The players now race for the boat at the end of the vineyard. The first player who gets his 5 pawns on the boat wins the game. Fate cards, who resemble various Egyptian gods can help you or hinder you... The gods are unpredictable!

Moving your pawns doesn't require any dice: the game uses Throwing Sticks ('Djebao' or 'Fingers'), just like in the old Senet game.
150180.name: De Tuin van Amon

150181.description:
The Shadows over the Empire: Promo Pack includes three new Distinct Personalities with unique abilities — Priscilla: Mother of the Empire, Azarias the Conspirator, and Aribar the Loremaster — as well as twelve new level C cards that can be used with Shadows over the Empire. This mini-expansion also includes a player's aid that explains how some of the new cards change the rules.

(Azarias the Conspirator was distributed on its own at Spiel 2013 in addition to being included in this mini-expansion.)
150181.name: Shadows over the Empire: Promo Pack

150182.name: Anduin (Issue 74 - Jul 2002)
150182.description: This issue offers a generic Sci-Fi adventure, a DSA adventure for 3-6 heroes (level 3-7) and the German translation of a Gamma World scenario by B.J. Johnson. It also includes articles on weapons with character, types of players, pseudoscience, some fiction, and, as always, 2 NPCs and reviews.

150184.name: VludKin ClaNz
150184.description:
VludKin ClaNz is a card game for two players about the struggle of the VludKin for control over the Vlud, the energy upon which their world is built. Each player starts with two VludKin cards from different ClaNz, and their goal is to not have the lowest influence VludKin when the game ends, and therefore be the player controlling the Vlud.

This is an original "stack-building" card game for two players, with a set of rules that are quick and simple to learn, but offering numerous strategic options and dirty tricks on the path to victory.

Each player receives two random VludKin cards from different ClaNz, and during the game they draw a card from the central deck which they then try to win with one of their VludKin, rolling over that VludKin's Influence modified by the card. If this card is an Influence card, they can then place it under one of the VludKin, altering their Influence value based on the Clan type shown on the card. If it's a Power card, then they can carry out the special action on that card before it is discarded.

Failing to win a card will earn the VludKin a -1 Influence token to their total, and they can get rid of these only through trading an Influence card matching their Clan or the use of certain power cards, which might actually move all the tokens to an enemy instead. If an Influence card is failed, then the other player gets a chance to win it. If a Power card is failed, then the power is automatically played by the enemy VludKin opposite; sometimes it's in your advantage to fail a Power card...

During the game, the stacks of cards under each VludKin are built, changing their Influence up and down over turns until the game ends and the player with the lowest VludKin loses. With the ability to play Influence cards on the other player's VludKin and with the use of Power cards to move Influence cards around the stacks, a level of strategy is added to the simple core rules.

The game ends when either a VludKin reaches ten Influence or the central deck is empty, so through the use of Influence and Power cards a tense game builds in which the balance of Influence can change right up to the end on the asymmetrical board game playfield. There is little down time for the players and no hidden hands of cards, so this provides an exciting head-to-head experience.

VludKin ClaNz comes with eight VludKin from four ClaNz, two copies of each of the twelve different power cards, and forty Influence cards. Adding extra sets of the Power and Influence cards gives you the option to customize the central deck to how you want to play, and also gives the option for a longer game.

Can you gain influence over the VludKin in this original card game?

150187.name: Hunt and Seek Young Xpert
150187.description:
Hunt and Seek™ Young Xpert is for youngsters who love challenges. Like the other games in the series, this game develops a child’s reactions, sense of observation, visual acuity and concentration. Numbers written in French and English allow children to learn the basics of reading a second language. Different levels in the game add to the challenge.

The aim of the game is to find 50 objects hidden in the beautifully illustrated game boards. Other challenges face players who may try to locate the little mouse found in different locations on the game boards or find the six mystery characters.

150188.name: Psycho-Slasher: The Game
150188.description:
Psycho-Slasher: The Game is a 30-page miniatures game homage to the low budget slasher films of the 1970's and 1980's, playable in any scale from 15mm to 54mm.

Psycho-Slasher is easy to learn, and fun to play, with each player acting as a Writer and running their own Slasher. The competing Slashers don't interact directly, but the Writers have the ability to hinder or help other Slashers with the placement of new weapons, or, more importantly, manipulating the horde of Pawns (Victims) that populate the Slasher film tableau.

You say that you love the idea, but that you don't have miniatures for a game like this? No problem! Included with the game are printable paper miniatures... you get 5 distinct Slashers, a Cop, and 4 distinct Pawns. Print as many Pawns and Cops as you need, snip, fold, glue, and you are all set! Also included are printable Weapon counters, and Pawn Special counters that introduce twists to the game like Phones (self-explanatory,) Beer (dangerous for Pawns), and Hysteria (AHHHHH!!!).

Whenever a Slasher ends his/her movement in contact with a Pawn or Cop, the Slasher must conduct an attack. If the Attack is successful your Slasher removes the Pawn from the board, earning Collection Points.

Collection Points translate into ratings, or popularity, for the Writer’s Slasher and Slasher story line. So, earning Collection Points in the game, while preventing rival Slashers from collecting points when you can, is how you can win the game.

Not recommended for children under the age of 16. This is meant to be a fun game, based on a movie genre, and does not take itself seriously... still, the subject matter may not be appropriate for everyone.

150190.name: Fate Core Character Journal
150190.description:
publisher blurb

A 32-page booklet designed to bring your Fate Core character from idea to campaign completion! Includes worksheet-like pages that help you visualize your character's stunts and aspects, and even assists with milestones!

150191.name: Table Pack 16: Flight 2000 and Goin' Nuts
150191.description:
User Summary:

This pack adds recreations of two pinball tables to Pinball Arcade.

Flight 2000 was released in 1980 by Stern Pinball. It is themed around the launch of a futuristic Space Ship and was the first Stern table to feature speech. The main aim of the table is to activate the 3-ball multi-ball. In order to do this, the player must lock two balls in the top left, light all the letters in B-L-A-S-T-O-F-F by hitting various targets on the table, and finally hit five drop targets marked 5-4-3-2-1 in the correct sequence!

Goin' Nuts was a prototype created in 1983 by Gottlieb, but never released. Only 10 physical tables were made. It is a highly unusual design featuring Squirrels collecting nuts for winter. There are no out-lanes, and the design is based on a timer as well as the number of balls draining. Each turn three balls (the squirrels) are launched for a 3-ball multiball. The aim when two or more 'squirrels' are in play is to collect nuts (drop targets) which both score points and increase the timer. When only one ball remains in play, the timer starts counting down and the player must reactivate the multiball before the timer runs out. If the timer reaches zero, the flippers lock and the final ball will drain, losing a life (of course if the last ball drains while there is time on the timer, the life is also lost). Extra lives can be gained by collecting all five sets of three drop targets three times each.

150192.name: Lords of Gossamer & Shadow
150192.description:
From publisher blurb:

This world is but one of untold many, a flux of chance caught between shadow and light. It is a world poised between great powers that shape and define all matter, one of many battlegrounds in an epic struggle between form and cacophony. The lords and knights in this battle move between realms with impunity: they are the creators, shapers, and destroyers of worlds.
In Lords of Gossamer & Shadow, the player-characters are agents caught up in this immense, multi-dimensional struggle. Born into it, their birthright is one of unimaginable power... and with it great danger! They will bear unique and idiosyncratic magical artifacts, command legions drawn from the myriad of otherworlds, and wield incredible powers that alter the very substance of reality. They are players in a Machiavellian conspiracy with the greatest of stakes, and arrayed against them are the deadliest of foes... each other!

Lords of Gossamer & Shadow (Diceless) is an original sourcebook and roleplaying game using Erick Wujcik's diceless rules system, the same system that powered Amber Diceless Role-Playing. Lords of Gossamer and Shadow will be a standalone product, but is fully compatible with the existing rules system and can be readily used in new and existing campaigns.

rpgpodcastepisode.131407: Amber Diceless/Lords of Gossamer & Shadow GM Jam Special Episode #4

150193.name: Table Pack 17: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
150193.description:
User Summary:

This pack adds a recreation of a single pinball table to Pinball Arcade.

Terminator 2: Judgment Day was released in 1991 by Williams and is based on the Arnold Schwarzenegger movie, including speech from the cast. It was the first Williams table with a dot matrix display and the ball was launched by pulling the trigger on a gun-grip mounted on the front of the table. The playfield includes a model of a T-800 Endoskeleton skull. The aim of the table is to pass through five levels of Security at Cyberdyne Defense and then entering the Skynet Command Center to activate Payback Mode.

This table was funded by a Kickstarter campaign which raised the initial funding to obtain the various licences required.

150194.description:
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island - Trait Cards II is a promotional expansion of five "trait" cards that were first released via a Kickstarter campaign for The Dice Tower. Players choose a trait at the start of the game if they like to; each one gives a disadvantage, but also an advantage. These cards are:


Loss of Time
Pirate
Leader
Lazy
Cold-blooded
150194.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Trait Cards II

121921.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island

boardgamefamily.26563: Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island

150196.description:
In Drag Ball: The Game, players play as one of twelve drag queens, developing her skills throughout the game to try to outlast the competition to win the crown. You need to be the one with the most sass, sophistication and aesthetic to reign victorious.

Drag Ball: The Game plays in fast-paced rounds, with one player being eliminated each round. Each round consists of a mini-challenge, a main challenge, a runway look construction, critiques in which players are ranked, and finally the "fish or filth" phase when the bottom two players face off to see who continues in the game. In addition to managing their hand of cards and creating a cohesive runway look, players will compete in small physical challenges such as lip-syncing in order to gain advantages in that round.
150196.name: Drag Ball: The Game

150197.description:
Les Guerres de Bourgogne 1474-1477 (Wars of Burgundy) is a historical simulation from October 1474 to January 1477. One player plays the role of the Burgundian armies and their allies (Duchy of Savoy and Italian states), led by the famous Duke Charles the Bold, and the other player is in command of the Swiss Confederacy and its allies (Duchy of Lorraine and German states). The objectives are to take control of the Savoy and Lorraine territories, win pitched battles or major sieges, and neutralise the opponent's allies.

This is both a strategic & tactical game with armies and garrisons evolving on the main strategic map and units fighting on a tactical map featuring a typical XVth century battleground. Units are men-at-arms, pikes, bowmen, crossbowmen, halberdiers, hangunners, and early cannons, from 2,000 men at full strength, 1,000 horsemen or 200 cannons of all calibers. The "chrome" of that period is added with tactical chits (charge, harassment shots, raining arrows, ditch, fence, clash of pikes, cannon battery) and events such as rain, snow, minor ally, no fight or betrayal, no wing deployment. Optional rule includes a possible intervention of the French kingdom to support one side or the other. You will be able to fight the famous battles of Hericourt (1474), Grandson & Morat (1476), and Nancy (1477), the latter involving a fatal outcome for Charles the Bold.

The complete sequence of a turn:
I/ Burgundy
1) Reinforcement, replacement
2) strategic move
3) attrition phase
4) combat phase (battles & sieges)
II/ Swiss Confederacy
Same sequence
III/ Diplomatic phase
check for victory

The game includes 108 die-cut counters, an A3 size strategic and an A5 size tactical map. One 6 sided die is necessary.
150197.name: Les Guerres de Bourgogne

202951.name: Bear vs Gorilla vs CEO vs Hippie: Extra Things

150198.description: Bear vs Gorilla vs CEO vs Hippie is a fast-paced card game in which players choose a random character, get some cards and chips, then attack other players to try to win their chips, knocking other players out when their chip supply vanishes. The last player standing wins!
150198.name: Bear vs Gorilla vs CEO vs Hippie

150200.name: Witch Hunt
150200.description:
From the back cover:
After years of losing children to the witch in the woods, your village has had enough. Find some friends and brave the dark woods in search of revenge on a good, old-fashioned... Witch Hunt.

User note:
Calls for CandyLand cards.

150201.name: Super Robot Go! Rulebook
150201.description:
From the back cover:
You have been chosen to protect our world. Gather your friends and utter the phrase that summons Earth’s greatest defender: Super Robot Go!

150202.name: Robot Go Manual
150202.description:
From the text:
Operation Manual - Welcome on your purchase of Robot Go. Pilots should get to know their ranged and melee weapons -- feel free to note them on the sheet.

150203.name: Keetonian Invasion Adventure
150203.description:
From the back cover:
Lord Keeton, God-King of the Keetonian Empire, has declared Earth his private hunting grounds. The armies of the world are helpless. There is only one hope for mankind... Super Robot Go!

150204.name: Murderous Ghosts: Northampton State Hospital MC Book
150204.description:
from the inside cover

The story of an an urban explorer trying to escape the haunted upper stories of an abandoned hospital.

150205.name: Murderous Ghosts: Northampton State Hospital Player Book
150205.description:
The story of an an urban explorer trying to escape the haunted upper stories of an abandoned hospital.

From the inside cover.

150206.name: Prophecy (2013)
150206.description:
From the author:
What if you had the power to see a glimpse of the future? In this game you play people who can. You need two different kind of tokens and a deck of tarot cards.

150207.name: Realm Works

rpgpodcastepisode.169683: Lone Wolf Development Talks Hero Lab and Realm Works

150207.description:
from the kickstarter
Streamline RPG preparation, spend more time focusing on the game, and increase the engagement of your players with Realm Works!

How many times have you struggled to keep your tabletop RPG campaigns completely organized? Have you ever lost track of what your players have and haven't learned? Is “real-life” limiting the time you have to prepare for games? Do you waste precious time during games searching for details from previous sessions, some of which occurred months or even years ago? These challenges, and others, are what we set out to solve with Realm Works.

Realm Works takes campaign management for tabletop RPGs to the next level, making it faster and easier to prepare for games, and greatly enhancing the actual game experience. You can use Realm Works with any RPGs you play — it’s “game system neutral” and can be used no matter what type of campaign you run.
