GMs can create, manage, and share their world using a single tool, rather than trying to cobble things together with multiple, disconnected applications. Realm Works was built by GMs and players for GMs and players.

150208.name: Pockets Full of Adventure
150208.description:
From the author:
Characters go dimension hopping to recover lost artifacts. Very quick chargen and adventure creation. Characters have 4 traits and use cards as tokens.

150211.name: Fate Dice

rpghonor.27226: 2014 Origins Awards Best Game Accessory Nominee

150211.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add color and excitement to your Fate and Fudge games with Fate Dice! Fate Dice are a premium line of Fudge Dice. Each package contains three sets of four 16mm fudge dice each (12 dice total). We’ve gotten right down into the details and rethought everything about Fudge Dice. We’ve made the symbols larger and wider, so they’re easier to read. We’ve given the symbols more personality than before, with rounded, flared ends and a gentle curve expressed throughout the stroke. We’re using materials and color combinations that have never been on the market before for Fudge Dice.

When it comes right down to it, these are dice that you can display proudly alongside all the other fancy dice in your collection (we know you have one) giving your Fate and Fudge games an extra dose of style. Top to bottom, these are Fudge Dice reimagined — Fate Dice!

150212.name: Tabletop Connect: 3D Virtual Tabletop for Windows and Mac
150212.description:
from the Tabletop Connect website

Tabletop Connect is a system-neutral 3D virtual tabletop that lets you connect with your friends to play role-playing games just like you’re around a real table.

You play in a true 3D environment—with miniatures, terrain tiles, physics simulated dice, character sheets, and handouts—you can almost feel the dice in your hands.

Tabletop Connect has successfully funded. If you missed out on the Kickstarter, Tabletop Connect will have an open-access pre-sale available in the future. Watch this space for an announcement.

150213.name: Pure Halloween
150213.description:
Pure Halloween is a strategy game for two players in which the player who first occupies all nine regions of the Sudoku-type game board wins.

Players control a "team" of Halloween figures, with each figure having a unique way of moving. The rules are simple and easy to learn, but winning the game requires complex strategic maneuvers and well-planned tactics.

150214.name: Fire Call
150214.description:
"During the earlier days of firefighting, volunteer fire brigades used deception to compete with one another in order to be the first responders on scene, and subsequently receive payment from the property owner's insurance.

Fire Call positions you at the front lines of modern-day firefighting with a heated twist reminiscent of the combative early years. As you battle opposing fire departments, pull out all the stops to gain control of the most districts by collecting equipment, sabotaging opponents, and successfully completing fire calls to win the game."

The game objective is to become the Fire Department (player) with the most occupied districts by collecting and using the necessary equipment to complete Fire Calls. Once all the districts are covered, the Fire Department with the most occupied districts wins the game.

On their turn, players roll the die and move their markers along the track. The space they land on can have one of a number of effects. Players may gain fire equipment, have the opportunity to complete a fire call and occupy a district, gain cards for special effects later or sustain on-the-job injuries and be put in hospital. Players will also gain ranks throughout the game, starting off as Firefighters and being promoted up to Fire Chief.

When fire calls are completed by players, the corresponding district is covered and occupied. Immediately after all 11 districts are occupied, the game ends and the player with the most wins.

150216.name: QuickWits
150216.description:
QuickWits is a fast-paced card game based on naming items within certain categories and descriptions. The game is very similar to Anomia, but the content is more mature in theme.

During the game, players take turn drawing a card and placing it in front of them. Each card has one of six different symbols on it, and when two players have the same symbol on the card on the top of their pile, they face off. Each player has to name something in his opponent's card category before his opponent names something in the category on his own card. The fastest player takes his opponent's card and places it face down in his score pile.

The game ends once all the cards have been dealt, and the player with the most cards in his pile wins.

150220.name: Kampen om Fredriksten
150220.description:
In the family-friendly game Kampen om Fredriksten, players are merchant families in the city Halden in southern Norway during the 17th century. Players run their businesses and try to adapt to the events of the period, all while helping building the fort Fredriksten, which will protect the city from repeated attacks from the Swedish king, Karl XII.

Each round, you roll your dice and use them to activate your buildings. Each building can only be activated by a certain die value, and will provide money, construction material, soldiers, or victory points. If you erect buildings with different dice values, you will be able to utilize your dice most efficiently. Also, you can customize your buildings according to your needs by upgrading them with different combinations of cards, increasing or changing their production, or changing their required dice value. Contribute to the building of Fredriksten to receive extra resources, and make sure to have your private army ready when Karl XII attacks.

150222.name: Intrepid: A Storytelling Adventure
150222.description:
Publisher's blurb:


… Desperate to maintain his immortality, a captain in the imperial army ventures deep into the uncharted jungle searching for the fabled Amulet of blood!
… An old woman, wise but frail, struggles through the blizzards of Eversnow Peak to find a power stolen from her!
… A young water spirit looks on in horror at the smoking ruins that used to be her home, her mind filled with thoughts of death and vengeance!


Intrepid is a storytelling game for 3–5 players. You and your friends will collaborate to tell the epic stories of characters braving quests filled with glory and adventure. Explore a fantasy world drawn straight from your imaginations during play! Take control of characters within that world and create it around them as you experience their loves and losses, failures and triumphs.

The game contains complete instructions for how you and your friends can explore a fantasy world; both in one-shot sessions that last a few hours and longer campaign games that take multiple sessions. A GM-less structured freeform game from Kiwi RPG Design, part of the UKRP Design Collective.

150224.name: AutoHARP Fantasy: College of Magics
150224.description:
From publisher blurb:

AutoHARP Fantasy: College of Magics is an add-on database (drawing upon the College of Magics supplement) for the AutoHARP Fantasy software.

The database file includes all the new professions, new skills, new spells, new talents and more introduced in College of Magics

The software works under Windows and most Linux distributions. Use the exe file for Windows and the jar files for Windows or Linux - note the jar files require the Java Runtime Environment.

150225.name: AutoHARP Fantasy: Martial Law
150225.description:
From publisher blurb:

AutoHARP Fantasy: Martial Law is an add-on database (drawing upon the Martial Law supplement) for the AutoHARP Fantasy software.

The database file includes new combat rules, combat actions, new skills, weapons, armor, combat styles and martial art styles, new talents and new items. Players can now use Martial Law combat in the Combat Tracker which includes new critical tables and attacks by location. There are also new rules for social classes which include random starting money for the character based on their social class. Additional armor information from Martial Law is also included: new armor pieces, armor quality and armor material.

The software works under Windows and most Linux distributions. Use the exe file for Windows and the jar files for Windows or Linux - note the jar files require the Java Runtime Environment.

150226.name: Faster Combat Presents: Game Master's Guide – How To Run Fast & Exciting Combats
150226.description:
From publisher blurb:


Let me show you how to create and run Hollywood Blockbuster encounters that’ll blow your players away

For any D&D edition, Pathfinder or D&D-esque game that involves monsters, minis, initiative and mayhem.

Slow combats kill games. They drain fun out of sessions and leave your group tired, bored and frustrated. And if you are like me, you feel responsible and want to do something about it.

You’ve come to the right place because we know exactly what you can do to make your combats sleek, fun and exciting. In these 267 pages we’re going to show you exactly how to be a great combat GM.

You’ll run games with more confidence, more skill, and more excitement with our playtested proven methods.

150227.name: 100 Roadside Encounter Ideas
150227.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes a GM needs a little inspiration. Especially for the frequent question of, “So, what happens while we’re on the road?”

This ebook will give you ideas on how to answer that question.

Roleplaying Tips ran a prize-filled contest where readers sent in ideas for interesting roadside encounters. Over 2000 submissions poured in! Dozens of hours later, what you will soon have in your hands is the pared down, edited and polished result.

150228.name: Færdsels Teori
150228.description:
Everyone is a winner, because by playing this game you broaden the knowledge for traffic rules!

In FÆRDSELS TEORI your purpose is to answer questions correctly and gather the four tokens: Orange, Blue, White and Black.

There are four large fields (one in each corner) where you will get a token for correct answers.

From the center to the corners there are fields divided into Red, Yellow and Green.
If you land on RED your turn is over.
If you land on GREEN you can roll the die again.
If you land on YELLOW you will have to reply a question: Wrong answer will end your turn, a right answer will give you another go.

The winner is the one who got all four tokens AND returned back to Start where (s)he will have to answer correctly on FOUR out of SIX questions.

150229.name: Inns, Taverns, and Restaurants
150229.description:
From publisher blurb:

The best guide for designing story-filled locations

Where do the PCs go when they enter town? Inns, taverns and restaurants of course! But after dozens of such encounters in your games, these places have lost their novelty and excitement. It's time to shake things up.

Make it impossible for your players to take the table in the back corner by designing a round tower tavern. Tired of characters doing the cliche thing of never sitting with their back to the door? Design a jungle-themed room with four doors!

This 141 page book shows you how to create cool, interesting and cunning locations for better storytelling. Written by award-winning industry veteran Johnn Four, you will discover advanced GMing techniques including:

A complete urban location stat block and how to flesh it out to create unique inns, taverns and restaurants
How to design for locations for better encounters, adventures and stories
The secret ingredients for adding dice-grabbing conflicts to location scenes
How to create food menus and services - and how to price them!
Populating your locations with realistic employees who add to the story




In addition, the book contains a horde of tables to inspire you:

50 Room Quirks
100 Interesting Patrons
100 Interesting Events
Furnishings
50 Intriguing Fantasy Business Themes
Random Name Generator (10,000 names)
Menu Generator including exotic meat
And several other tables




Next time the PCs hit the tavern, surprise them with a place that's alive with activity and oozes atmosphere and story.

150230.name: Holiday Essentials
150230.description:
From publisher blurb:

Designing new adventures and encounters for each session is tough. It gets to feel like a treadmill at times. How can you get inspired to create something new your players have not seen a thousand times before?

Enter Holiday Essentials, a toolkit that helps you create intriguing and original material for your games.

This eBook helps you plan, prepare, and GM better adventures through the lens of world design. While you can use the information inside to craft interesting events, you will also find out how to use the unique world element of holidays as the launch point and structure for great adventures, and encounters.

This book puts a focus on telling great stories. Once you've designed something, you need to wrap a great story around it at the game table to get your players leaning forward and wanting experience it. Holiday Essentials show you how.


What's Inside Holiday Essentials?


Chapter 1: How To Design Compelling Holidays

Step-by-step instructions for building a culture's holidays, celebrations and dark events.

Learn how to pick the right level of detail so you don't waste time over-planning and don't get caught under-planning.

Chapter 2: Holiday Design Elements

This is your design toolset. It goes into full detail about how and what to design for each of the steps needed to pull off a great story based on or triggered by a world event.

You also see numerous examples in action.

Chapter 3: GM & Campaign Advice

Tips and more tools! Advanced advice for game masters who take their settings seriously.

150232.name: One Year In The Savage AfterWorld
150232.description:
From publisher blurb:

CATACLYSMIC QUESTS!

Inside this crumbling tome is a collection of unique micro-adventures through a post-apocalyptic world! One Year In The Savage AfterWorld presents 52 "dangerous encounters" that originally appeared at The Savage AfterWorld!

Mutant Lords who need a springboard for a new campaign, a quick side-trek for his players, or a single one-shot adventure for an evening's entertainment will find a variety of quests within! Each of these short adventures through the radioactive wastes is designed to be run over the course of a few hours. Is your band of stalwart survivors up to the challenges they'll face?

One Year In The Savage AfterWorld is fully compatible with Goblinoid Games' Mutant Future and Labyrinth Lord role-playing games as well as other Original Edition Fantasy RPGs.

150233.description: Dungeon Roll: Winter Promo Pack is a winter-themed mini-expansion for the dice-rolling fantasy game Dungeon Roll that consists of twelve treasures (snowball, cake, presents, etc.) and four legendary heroes: Ebenezer, Jack Frost, Sugar Plum Faerie, and Klaus, Saint of the North.
150233.name: Dungeon Roll: Winter Heroes Pack

150234.name: Wiseguys
150234.description:
Set in the Golden Age of organized crime, players head rival crime families attempting to gain control of organized crime in the city. In the vein of Citadels, deceive your opponents and deduce their strategy as you gain wealth and respect in your rise to power. Plot and alter your own strategy as the game unfolds and as fortunes change hands quickly and unexpectedly.

Each round, players select characters through a secret draft. After all players have selected a character, they take their turns in order depending on the character they have chosen.

In the first part of each player's turn, they will use their character's tactic to their advantage to either earn cash, to take cash from their opponents, or to derail their opponent's progress in some way. Each character has his own unique tactic. As the game progresses, bluffing and deduction become increasingly important to gain an advantage over your opponents.

In the second part of the player's turn, each will have a choice of three different illegal operations to perform, and may perform any one of the three before ending their turn.

The first player to reach the required level of respect wins the game.

150235.name: Realms (Fate)
150235.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a big fantasy setting for FATE, with the core FATE rules baked right in. Fate is a generic role-playing game system designed to offer the least possible obstruction to role-playing. Fate has a large number of innovative gaming mechanics. This game includes the Fate core rules and a fantasy setting in one integrated package.

Realms (FATE Edition) is set on a fantasy continent, divided into realms. These realms include human city states, elven forest kingdoms, halfling mounds and dwarven halls. There are monsters roaming the wild places, and there is treasure too.

This distinctive background, with a high-fantasy feel, integrates beautifully with the Fate rules to create an immersive setting where the GM's and players' imaginations can run wild.

This PDF includes everything needed to start playing, with character creation rules, a bestiary, descriptions of realms and religions, gear, and some gritty detail on the advantages and disadvantages of various weapons and armor.

So start exploring this fantasy version of FATE now!

150236.name: Battle Market
150236.description: Battle Market is one part financial management game and one part fight to the death. You go around the board buying property and paying rent. Along the way, each property you control grants you a special power. Most of these special powers are useful for attacking your rivals. Unlike most games in this genre, the ultimate goal isn't to bankrupt the other players, but to kill them.

150237.name: Extreme Future: Fate Edition
150237.description:
From publisher blurb:

Extreme Future is now available as a setting for FATE. Fate is a generic role-playing game system designed to offer the least possible obstruction to role-playing. Fate has a large number of innovative gaming mechanics. This game includes the Fate core rules and the Extreme Future setting in one integrated package.

Extreme Future is about a universe where human space spans the galaxy, but where we share it with countless alien powers and robot empires. It's a dangerous galaxy, strewn with the remains of civilizations that came before us, their secrets, powerful weapons, and enigmatic ruins waiting to be explored.

This distinctive background, with a high-adventure, space-opera feel, integrates beautifully with the Fate rules to create a huge game universe where the GM's and players' imaginations can run wild.

This PDF includes everything needed to start playing, all wrapped up in a beautifully illustrated book.

The book contains character creation rules – which are also used to create robots, aliens and vehicles – and lots and lots of examples of vehicles, equipment and monsters. There are whole systems, planets, an adventure, mecha and psionics, all implemented in Fate's simple but sophisticated and powerful way.

So start exploring the Extreme Future now!

150238.name: Spaceward Ho!: Sci-Fi Combat and Role-Playing Game
150238.description:
From publisher blurb:

"The superdreadnought's shields were flaring in numerous locations, with more impacts every second, as they angled away enormously dangerous energy beams and deflected mass-driver rods. The titanic monster of a spaceship was engaged with an equally huge enemy carrier, and none had stood in it's way so long before..."

The game is designed to be as simple and versatile as possible. It aims to strike a good balance between the detail needed to give each vehicle its own character, and keeping information concise enough that large forces can be quickly created.

Any unit can be created, from the lowly and ubiquitous space marine, all the way up to planet-crushing space stations and superdreadnoughts. The game can even be used to simulate huge organic monsters able to go toe-to-toe with huge military spaceships.

Spaceward Ho! Lends itself very well to use as a rules-light role-playing game, but where many sci-fi role-playing games run into trouble when characters are confronted by vehicles and spaceships, Spaceward Ho! copes with these confrontations with ease.

150239.name: Vaporetto: Orbital Barge
150239.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Vaporetto is a grav barge originally designed for use in and around the floating city of Tarazet. The grav barges also travel down to the planetary surface below, and up to orbiting space stations.

However, the Vaporetto saw its finest hour during a long-ago civil war. After a failed military coup 700 years ago, the popular government defended itself using militarized versions of the Vaporetto.

The most popular of these was the ‘Viper’ which had two squad support weapons mounted at the doors, operated by a pair of door gunners.

The original door gunners at the start of the coup were government troopers. Later, as the coup turned to civil war, the door gunner position often used non-military volunteers.

This supplement contains deck plans, artwork showing the four different variants, counters for use in space battles, and lots of background information. There are so many of these grav barges floating around the city that it's easy to flag one down and commandeer it. It is also easy to increase the armour and add door guns to make this design a formidable opponent in small skirmishes.

150240.name: Ironclad: Patrol Spaceship
150240.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ironclad has three decks and is 400ft long. It is a cross between a gunboat and a police station, ideal for shooting your players out of space and then locking them away in the cells inside.

All three decks are detailed across large png images that can be uploaded straight to Roll20, or your favourite virtual tabletop.

All interior areas are described, and there is also a brief intro to the spaceship's operator, the Interstellar Space Transport Authority.

A spaceship profile for use with the Spaceward Ho! game is included, along with a rules-light version of the game to give more insight into what the numbers in the spaceship profile mean.

So, whether you have been deputized to clear the spacelanes of pirates, or whether you are a pirate sitting in a cell in the belly of this spaceship, these are the deckplans you need.

150241.name: Bright Blade: Trader
150241.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Bright Blade-class trader is a two-decker, and measures 43 meters from bow to drive nacelles, 11 meters across the beam and has a capacity of 200,000kg.

It is armed to defend against pirates, and also has dummy gun emplacements, systems designed to look like guns if the ship is scanned, to further deter attack.

The Tarazet Deep Space Navy has bought several ex-traders for use as inexpensive patrol spaceships, but most are operated by independent traders. If you go aboard as a passenger, be warned, the trading captain will take you to many different adventures on the way along the trade route to your final destination.

These deckplans include;

Area and system descriptions
Color deckplans
Printer-friendly monochrome maps
Counters to use on the color deckplans
Background sections on, design and operators
Spaceship statistics




There is also a quick-start version of the Spaceward Ho! vehicle combat system as an added bonus, and to make it even easier to integrate this spaceship into your game.

150242.name: Fuwalda:  Starfighter (Second Edition)
150242.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement gives enough detail to allow players to really get to know the spaceship. It is a great starship to be put at the disposal of a small group of players for their own use, and it will serve their characters well.

The supplement includes large numbers of 3D illustrations and many alternate variants. In this second edition there is increased information on the ‘Dominator’ variant. There is also a hex sheet and counters that can be used to start gaming with the Fuwalda straight away.

Extensive technical specifications are provided, using Spaceward Ho! rules, with background to the design decisions, to allow the spaceship to be easily integrated into an ongoing game, whatever system is being used.

Deck plans are included of the science scout variant, and there is an illustration showing the hull equipment and its uses.

There are descriptions, of weapons, hull systems, equipment, shields, armour and hardpoints. The variants mentioned also come with background information about where and how they are used.
There is also a small adventure hook, and the Spaceship Ho! space combat rules are also included as a reference to the spaceship's statistics.

There is a lot of content packed into this spaceship supplement, so let's take this bucket o' bolts for a spin!

150243.name: Descender: Dropship
150243.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Descender-Class Light Dropship is a versatile dropship with a wide ramp and space for infantry, cargo or even a small vehicle, such as a Tigress armored personnel carrier.

The landing possibilities of the Descender-class are almost unlimited, and where landing is impossible, for example densely packed jungle, the ability of the spaceship to ‘hover’ on its grav motors allows troops to deploy by abseiling or grav belt.

The Descender has a heavy turret mounted on its back and also a flexible mount below the 'chin' of the cockpit.

The dorsal turret often mounts a missile launcher and the 'chin' mount often contains twin blaster cannon, but armaments vary according to mission and the level of resistance that is expected.

In the assault role, Descender's are generally more heavily armed for self-protection, both in transit and for suppression of the landing zone. This extra armament may be in the form of door gunners, or the modification of the stub-wing heat vanes with hard points for the carriage of missiles and rocket pods.

These deckplans include.

Spaceship statistics
Area descriptions
Color deckplans with legend and key, and printer-friendly monochrome maps
Background sections on, design, operators and typical missions.




There is also a quick-start version of the Spaceward Ho! vehicle combat system as an added bonus.

A short adventure hook is also included to show how this design can serve as a platform for unique planetary-assault adventures.

150244.name: Seeker: Seeker-class Exploration Vessel
150244.description:
From publisher blurb:

These starship deckplans cover four decks of the Seeker-class Exploration Vessel. All areas of the spaceship are mapped in detail with descriptions of equipment, systems, and internal spaces (rooms, airlocks, and corridors), and, along with the deckplans, there are tactical maps of each room and corridor. The tactical maps are full-color, to a scale of 1m per square and represent areas such as; crew cabin, droid storage locker, bridge, ready room, sick bay, shuttle bay, observation deck, main airlock, etc, etc, etc.. These tactical maps are intended for use with the Seeker-class spaceship, but they can be used to represent an almost infinite number of similar spaceships, just like dungeon tiles. Full and detailed stats are provided for the Extreme Future game, with notes, allowing the spaceship to be easily converted for use in many other Sci-Fi games, of either space opera, or hard science types.

These deckplans include.

Spaceship statistics
Area descriptions
Colour deckplans with legend and key
Tactical maps of all rooms, airlocks, and corridors, so that boarding actions and other combats can be played anywhere in the starship interior.
Background sections on builders, operators and typical use.

150245.name: Tigress Exploration Vehicle
150245.description:
From publisher blurb:

Roughly two centuries ago, the Miodellian Army concluded that the militarized civilian trucks in use no longer satisfied their requirements. A requirement was posted for a versatile light transport unit. Mioakima Training Asteroid was the main testing grounds of the Tigress VLTU-A.

The Tigress became the vehicular backbone of the Miodellian Army as it defended its resource-rich, small moons. The Tigress was designed primarily for personnel and light cargo transport behind front lines, not as a front line fighting vehicle. It has since been replaced by much more advanced grav propulsion vehicles in military service, but is still often encountered in use by mercenaries and civilian forces.

Including stats, tactical maps and front, rear and side elevations for both the civilian and militarized version. The perfect runabout for a group of sci-fi characters who like to ride into action in style.

150246.name: Harasser: Interdiction Mecha
150246.description:
From publisher blurb:

After examining many concepts, the Corrington Yards decided on designing a completely new mecha. The new design would be faster than all current or foreseeable enemy mecha, and would carry a huge payload of missiles. Its high speed would make it easy for the design to evade both enemy mecha and ground fire.

The design had been in service for a few decades when the Beach War broke out. With an eye to making the Harasser more versatile, provision was made for four blaster cannon which could be installed in the upper torso, immediately under the cockpit, and firing via blast tubes and troughs through the shoulder joints. As the conflict escalated, the design was given even more firepower, with a pair of ion cannon.

The Harasser went on to carve a name for itself as one of the most dangerous mecha in the galaxy.

150247.name: Galsheen: Fast Transport Spaceship
150247.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Galsheen-class fast transporter is a truly huge spaceship with eight decks. All of the spaceship's decks are described in detail with descriptions of equipment, systems, and internal spaces (rooms, airlocks, and corridors etc). Full and detailed stats are provided for the Extreme Future game, with notes, allowing the spaceship to be easily converted for use in many other Sci-Fi games.

This supplement includes;

Spaceship statistics
Area descriptions
Color deck layouts with legend and key
Background sections on, design, operators and typical missions.




There is even a short adventure hook to show how this design can easily be integrated into an ongoing game.

150248.name: Extreme Future 4: Tarazet
150248.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is now the 4th edition of Extreme Future, and the game keeps growing and getting richer.

Extreme Future is about a universe where human space spans the galaxy, but where we share it with countless alien powers and even robot empires.
It's a dangerous galaxy, strewn with the remains of civilizations that came before us, their secrets, powerful weapons, and enigmatic ruins waiting to be explored.
Extreme Future 4 is a role-playing game with refined rules and a lot of distictive background information and examples.

It includes everything needed to start playing, all wrapped up in a beautifully illustrated book.
The book contains character creation rules, robot creation rules, vehicle creation rules and lots and lots of examples of vehicles, equipment and monsters. There are whole systems, planets, an adventure, mecha and psionics, all implemented in a simple but sophisticated and powerful way.

So start exploring the Extreme Future now!

150249.name: Deep Space Encounters
150249.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep Space Encounters, for the Extreme Future game, brings those boring journeys from star to star alive.

Now every time your character leaves planetside is a chance for adventure. There will always be the chance of encountering, aliens, anomalies, space patrols, bounty hunters, pirates, monsters, abandoned space stations, ghost ships, and ancient weapons, among many many more.

Over 70 encounters are included in the supplement, with scores of variants and details to expand these even more.

Space travel will never be boring or predictable again, so join the crew and make the jump to lightspeed.

150250.name: X and O
150250.description:
From publisher blurb:

You wanted it, and here it is. An add on characters for The Delucci Family (M&M).

Miranda and Krista O'Shea (Identical Twins), run a very lucrative private investigations company called, X & O Inc. But in reality, the investigation company is a cover for X & O to run an NSA Black Ops Assassination ring. The targets are both foreign and domestic.

So don’t wait. Pick’em up, drop’em into your campaign today.

150251.name: Gadget Guide: Traps
150251.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each Gadget Guide in the series takes a look at a particular type of devices in Mutants & Masterminds game terms, putting together the effects and modifiers from the Hero's Handbook to present different a wide variety of gadgets of that type. It also looks at specific concepts related to creating and using those devices in play. The Guide is a catalog of ready to use toys for your M&M game!


Traps

"I have you now, heroes! HA HA HA HA HA!" They are a part of every well-prepared villain’s bag of tricks, ranging from the fiendishly complex to the seemingly simple—traps. Some are meant just to capture those who would invade a villain's secret lair or interfere with important plans. Others are meant to interrogate, torture, or kill those unfortunate enough to fall into the villain's clutches. All of them are potential challenges for heroes in your Mutants & Masterminds games.

150252.name: Gadget Guide: Spytech
150252.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each Gadget Guide in the series takes a look at a particular type of devices in Mutants & Masterminds game terms, putting together the effects and modifiers from the Hero's Handbook to present different a wide variety of gadgets of that type. It also looks at specific concepts related to creating and using those devices in play. The Guide is a catalog of ready to use toys for your M&M game!


Spy-Tech

Technology has long been used to provide an advantage when it comes to getting access to things one should not have, whether places, people, goods, or information. Necessity is the mother of invention, and the needs of criminals and spies have inspired a variety of technology, including a range of countermeasures. Spy-Tech looks at gadgets used for infiltration, burglary, deception, disguise, and surveillance, and the equipment used to detect and defend against all of those things.

150253.name: Genetrix
150253.description:
From publisher blurb:

Genetrix

For Niobe Winslow, motherhood is both a fervent hope and a curse. The wild card virus has given her the power to birth aces, but her diminutive offspring are short-lived, and Niobe is on the run from those who see her—and her children—as nothing more than resources to exploit.

150254.name: Noel Matthews
150254.description:
From publisher blurb:

Noel Matthews

The spy game has been called a "wilderness of mirrors," but what—and who—Noel Matthews sees when he looks into one depends on the time of day. Is it the feminine avatar of the night, the masculine avatar of the day, or the intersexed British secret agent of the Order of the Helix?

150255.description:
Players are trying to find the golden helmet, which was buried with a mighty man centuries ago in the area of municipality of Lieto. They travel around Lieto and the player who is the first to find the helmet is the winner.

Game play is simple roll and move, the helmet is always in the same location. There are some other locations along the track, where players might get a free roll or lose a turn. About one fourth before the goal it is possible to choose from three different paths.

The game is basically an advertisement of the Lieto.
150255.name: Liedon kultainen kypärä

150256.name: Lohengrin
150256.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lohengrin

Lohengrin is full of romantic notions, but what do you expect from a German ace with the power to create glowy knightly armor and weapons out of phantasmal (and indestructible) "ghost steel"? The "Swan Knight" is a stalwart of the Committee, and one of its most powerful aces!

150257.name: Stuntman
150257.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stuntman

He can be hurt, even killed, but he'll always bounce back! Stuntman has an amazing regenerative power that lets him take risks no sane person would, but what he really wants is the fame and fortune of being a celebrity, and he's willing to take some risks to get there as well.

150258.name: City of Shiran
150258.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shiran is Hârn’s smallest city. Located on the north bank of the Thard River near Lake Benath, it is the second-largest settlement in the Thardic Republic and capital of Shiran Province, one of six in the Republic. Shiran is one of the Republic’s economic and cultural centers. The city has a reputation for corruption and hedonism and is known throughout Hârn as the “City of Sins.”

Shiran offers game masters many opportunities as the site of urban intrigue and adventure.

The Shiran article contains an overview of the city's history, economics, religion, government, and military forces. In addition to a full-page color player map, color GM maps are provided for each district of the city and more than 125 locations are described. Color floor plans and detailed descriptions are included for the Pamesani Arena, site of gladiatorial games and depraved spectacles; the Crimson Palace, Hârn's most famous house of courtesans; and the Temple of Halea, the Empress of Opulence and Queen of Pleasures.

Some material in this article was originally published in Cities of Hârn (1983) and Son of Cities (1987). The article has been greatly expanded and organized to allow for future expansion of new plans and sites within the city.

150259.name: Dinosaurs of the Lost Valley
150259.description:
From publisher blurb:

The canyon is a mysterious place, lush and green. Unfamiliar sounds reach you through the mists. Looking about, there are plants not seen in millions of years. Suddenly, an impossibly large creature steps out from the palms and cycads. The hairs on your fore- arms and nape prickle...

It towers over you, three times your height. Its weight is measured in tons, not pounds. It welcomes you to the Lost Valley with a rumbling roar that you feel from your collar-bones to the soles of your feet. Eureka! At last you have discovered the Dinosaurs of the Lost Valley!

This is a sourcebook for Cavemaster, the award-winning Stonepunk role-playing game. Included are dozens of new dinosaur species with illustrations, plus two playable saurian breeds!

150260.name: Mutant Manifesto
150260.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mutant Manifesto provides a horrific examination of the magic and mechanics of mutation, blending elements of science fiction and fantasy in a magnificently mutated melange. This product is ideal for alchemists, summoners, and wizards seeking to create their own mutated minions and awful experiments, but it also deals with the hateful backlash against all manner of mutants. From spells like blightcore meltdown, summon horde of flesh, and the ominously titled one of us to genetic purification and mutagenic reversion, this product covers both sides of the mutant question, with the deviant (wizard) and xenocidist (ranger) archetypes standing forth as paragons of genetic purity or perversion. More feats and spells await within, as well as a sample grimoire delving into the twisted arts of mutation, the dreaded libram Omnia Mutandis!

150261.name: Feasting at Lanterngeist (Pathfinder)
150261.description:
From publisher blurb:

A simple festival gone terribly wrong brings menace to 9th-level characters!

A simple harvest festival in an unremarkable village turns horribly, terribly wrong, in a way they can only when adventurers are involved. A simple disappearance threatens to become a massacre as a hidden menace long slumbering prepares to burst forth in the midst of this rustic revel. Will your heroes be able to thwart this menace, or will they become a part of the Feasting at Lanterngeist?

Check out this gothic-themed adventure and the rest of our Gothic Adventure Path Plug-Ins and Make Your Game Legendary! This adventure was designed for PCs of 9th-10th level.

150262.name: Granite Dwarves
150262.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever wanted to play an available race…but have your character be slightly different? The Expanded Races series for Castles & Crusades allows you to do just that.

In this pdf, we present granite dwarves, an alternate cold-weather dwarf for your campaign. For players, the pdf also provides optional abilities, allowing you to further customize your PCs—with the Castle Keeper’s permission, of course. For CKs, the pdf provides a new creature (frigid goblins), two new items, and the ecology of the granite dwarves, giving you the information needed to plug the granite dwarves into any ongoing campaign.

Broaden your character choices with the Expanded Races series today!

150263.name: Treatment Room
150263.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a full-color, 16 x 10 inch, floor plan of a Treatment Room, with Hex, Square and No overlay.

This Product includes the VTT files for online play.

Includes a 360° View of the map.

Game Masters need quality maps for their miniatures. DramaScape™ is committed to bringing Game Masters the maps they need.

“Let’s go chop up this chop-doc!”

The treatment room is a single map of a surgery room. The product includes a 360-degree panoramic view of the room.

The treatment room is intended for use in modern or near future science fiction settings.

Adventure hooks for use with this product.

Hunt for a Madman: There have been a string of murders lately in a small town with victims found having their skulls opened and brains removed. The strange serial killings have rocked the small town bringing a media circus with them. The player characters are playing agents sent to solve the high profile case and take over for the overwhelmed local police force. They search the crime scenes, interview relatives, and try and find a link between the murders. Eventually, the group discovers that everyone murdered so far once worked at an asylum that was closed about twenty years ago. They find a list of people who work at the asylum and discover that only one person who worked at the asylum is left.

They rush to the scene, finding evidence of a struggle, but no victim. A car races off into the night and the agents scramble to their vehicles to chase them, leading to the killer’s house. The ex-asylum patient runs with the victim to his surgery room. The patient tries to strap down the survivor, use a bone saw to cut their skull open, and remove the brain screaming, “You examined my mind for so long, it is high time that I got to see yours!” If successful, he places it into a jar of formaldehyde before sealing it. If interrupted by the agents, he uses his bone saw and other surgical tools to cut them apart. After defeating the serial killer, the agents discover that the room has multiple brains in formaldehyde filled jars, one for each of the victims.

Surgical Complications: One of the party members may have lost an arm or leg in a recent firefight and now needs a replacement. A local chop-doc offers cheap biological and mechanical body part replacements. They find the chop-doc through a contact of the party. The group goes to the surgery room and they find it to be a dirty place, but the chop-doc is offering the lowest prices in town…

Meanwhile, the leader of a local group of thugs has been hunting this chop-doc for a while, having a seemingly good replacement put in that started malfunctioning a few weeks later. The faulty arm erupted with weapon fire, killing several of his men before they were forced to chop his arm off for their own safety. He wants the chop-doc dead and has sent his thugs to kill him after finding out where his surgery room is located.

The group finds themselves suddenly under attack from outside through the two southern windows. The chop-doc tells the rest of the group that the surgery won’t be completed unless they can buy him some time against the thugs. The chop-doc fixes the arm of the party member while the rest have to hold them off. Thugs also attempt to assault the main door, bringing wicked, rusted machetes with them hoping to exact a special kind of vengeance on the doc. When the surgery is completed, the group needs to finish off the thugs and escape since the cops are sure to be on their way by now.

150264.name: A Trick on the Tain (S&W)
150264.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enter a harsh and unforgiving tundra known as the Tain where traveling these lands means certain death for most. The party of adventurers become caught up in the the plight of the native inhabitants and the cruel designs of an evil hag. The actions of these heroes could bring about the end of a people or save them depending on the choice they make.

Intended for use with 4-6 adventurers of 1st -3rd level, it can be adapted to suit the GM’s needs.

150265.description:
Players are citizens of Turku and their mission is to show the city for tourists. They need to move through several sightseeing places and then end in the railway station to finish their mission. First one to complete the round is the winner.

The play area is a stylized map of Turku with several different routes around the city. Players move by rolling a die. Some of the locations are marked with red, and on those locations something special happens and players refer the rulebook.

The game is most likely a fundraiser, several local companies are shown on the map and the special locations have references to them.
150265.name: Turku-peli

150266.name: Meanwhile
150266.description:
From the Author:

"Meanwhile" begins as our young hero in dire need of a bathroom, knocks on the door of a mysterious recluse. His mansion is in fact a wonderous laboratory filled with amazing inventions: A mind reading helmet, a doomsday device and a time travel machine (although it can only go back ten minutes).

Which invention will young Jimmy play with? YOU, the reader get to decide in my branchiest and most complex interactive comic to date. "Meanwhile" works via a network of tubes connecting each panel to the next. Sometimes these tubes split in two giving the readers a choice of which path they would like to follow. Sometimes these tubes even lead off the page and onto tabs sticking out from other parts of the book.

150267.name: Hexopolis
150267.description:
Hexopolis is a fast-paced, intense strategy card game that includes tactical elements thanks to a dynamic board and zombies controlled by all players. Expect to be kept on your toes with cutthroat moves and counter-moves.

The game is won and lost by activating ingredients on the table; two different ones to win, two identical ones to lose.

Players start by creating the board from a set of hexagonal tiles around a tile marked as the Altar set in the middle of the table. Then, they draw five cards and play their move in turns.

The different actions from the cards include summoning zombies, moving them to specific tiles to bring ingredient cards from one's hand to the table, or sacrifice zombies on the Altar tile to activate or deactivate ingredients already on the table.
Cards can also be combined into advanced actions that bend the rules (steal cards, cancel actions, etc.).

Rules are in English and French. Cards are bilingual.

Comes as a printed-on-demand box or as a PDF file.

150268.name: Tavulotto
150268.description:
Each player has a 3x3 board that he randomly fills with tiles, which have parts of words. The rest of the tiles are shuffled and one of them is turned face-up.

Players try to make a word matching the tile to one or more of their tiles on the board. The fastest one takes the tile and removes the used tiles from his board. The one who clears the board first is the winner.

150269.description:
POOCH: "A New Exciting Game of Dogs That Try To Outsmart The Ever Watchful Dog Catcher"

Dogs have wandered far from their homes and kennels, and now try to get back without being caught by the dog catcher.

Game includes a blow-molded plastic base, four plastic dog tokens, a dog catcher truck, and a spinner.
150269.name: Pooch

150270.name: Come Inside My Body
150270.description:
User Summary:

An illustration-based gamebook adventure inside the human body. (It's been pointed out that the contents are kid-friendly, despite the title's innuendo.)

Created during the National Gallery of Victoria's "Inherent Vice" 24-hour comic event.

150271.name: Candy Box 2
150271.description:
User Summary

Like the first Candy Box, this game starts with a blank screen and a counter for candies... but if you wait long enough an actual rpg will be unlocked. There will be a map, quests, puzzles... will you manage to defeat the ultimate boss, the developer?

150272.name: Anki Drive
150272.description:
Anki DRIVE is a racing game like no other. It uses Artificial Intelligence (AI) and robotics to take the best of video games and combine it with the best of physical games. It’s a video game in the real world. You hold the cars in your hand, and the track rolls out on your living room floor.
You can play ANKI Drive against your friends, or against an AI-enabled opponent. The more you race, the more points you earn, which you redeem to upgrade your cars’ weapons and capabilities.

Source: The Developer Website.

User Summary

Anki Drive is a new breed of game... It combines elements of video games, real world interaction and RPG style leveling.

The cars are equipped with virtual weapons and other items. Each car has energy, you use this for your weapons and you could say your HP. If you run out of energy and you take damage from another car you get disabled. The car that disabled you gets a point for the KILL.

You play until someone gets 5, 10, or 20 points. At that time the game ends and the cars stop. You are assigned UPGRADE points for your performance in the match, that you can use to upgrade weapons or car performance. These points follow the player not the car, whereas the upgrades (most at least) follow the car. Just like a CCG you can trade the car with another player and the upgrades go with the car. If you earned UPGRADE points and have not spent them they stay with the player.

The more you play the better upgraded and equipped your car becomes, but you still have to drive it yourself. So even a poorly equipped car with a very good driver can win.

While not 100% a video game or an RPG it has the best of all worlds... Think CAR WARS for the modern day!!!

150273.name: Motörhead
150273.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The riffin', the loudness, the drinks, the girls, the songs, the lyrics, the fights, the fuck-ups and the wins, plus much, much more...

The Rock Science Motörhead Game includes 1,600 questions on the band's history from Lemmy's first steps into rock 'n' roll to the awakening of the monster that Motörhead is today. Round up your friends and play the loudest trivia game in the world. Three levels of difficulty — Poser, Fan and Scientist — and tense betting means that the novice can give the hardcore fan a fair fight.

150274.name: Steamscapes: North America
150274.description:
Publisher Blurb:

North America in 1871 is a land of adventure, opportunity, and conflict. Inventors from the American Consolidated Union supply automatons and steam-powered machinery to the oil fields of Texas and the mines of the Rocky Mountain Republic. Wells Fargo airships and steam carts compete with the Southern Pacific's monopoly on transcontinental rail travel. Native saboteurs raid across the borders from their home in the Plains Tribal Federation to destroy the technology that threatens their land.

Steamscapes: North America is the first setting book for Steamscapes. It includes extensive alternative historical backgrounds for the four most prominent nations of North America and offers six new professions with associated skills and edge trees, as well as the automaton racial template. It provides several introductory scenarios and a variety of character templates so GMs and players can jump right in and start playing.

Steamscapes: North America requires the Savage Worlds core rulebook to play.

150275.name: Flickin' Cars With Guns
150275.description:
Flickin' Cars With Guns is a tabletop dexterity game for 2 or more players playable in as little as 10 minutes. Players use diecast toy cars (like Hot Wheels or Matchbox) to represent armed vehicles. The goal is to destroy your opponents by shooting and crashing into them.

The game is meant to be played on a standard kitchen table, and you can use household items as obstacles and terrain. A 4'x3' table littered with plates, cups, and bowls is pretty standard. In fact playing a quick game after dinner, before cleaning up the table, is one of the funnest approaches.

Each turn the player "flicks" their car twice and shoots once. The act of flicking is where the physical skill and challenge of the game come in. Crashing into an obstacle hurts your car, and accidentally flicking off the table is penalized as well, so players have to be careful.

Shooting is done by rolling 2D6 with a to-hit target number equal to the number of inches to your target. So if your opponent is 8" away you need 8+ to hit. Double damage on double 6s, and shots always miss on double 1s.

There are several variants and optional rules that can be bolted onto this core system, such as droppable weapons, demolition derby mode, a drinking game, stunt bonuses, power ups, using playing cards, etc. to ensure plenty of longevity and suitability for all types of players.

boardgameintegration.200294: Squillo Time Travels: Satiri e Baccanti

150276.description:
Bordello d'Oriente is an adult card game where each player plays the role of a pimp and manages his girls making them gain money and fight against the opponents' babies. The goal is to defeat the opponents maneuvering his call girls with the limits and abilities dictated by the board.

There are four kind of girls: escorts, street hookers, young hopefuls and, new in Bordello d'Oriente and not found in Squillo, geishas, asian girls with new power and abilities. Each girl has her own peculiarities, parcel and can be equipped with a wilde array of items and "pimped up" with power-ups.

Bordello d'Oriente can be played without Squillo or can be used to extend it with its 100 and more new cards (girls, power-ups, events and the brand new "trap cards"). The game also includes six guest cards drawn by guest artists.
150276.name: Squillo: Bordello d'Oriente

150277.description:
Card game of the Roman Empire in the second half of the third century AD, a fifty-year period during which the average reign of an emperor was a mere 2.5 years.

Each player controls a number of imperial candidates whom they try to push to the top position to gain honor and prestige by solving some of Rome's many crises -- invasions by Goths, Persians and Palymrans plus the incessant demands of the populace -- before quickly yielding to the next emperor.

In a system reminiscent of King's Breakfast, players draft influence cards which they may later deploy to help them win top jobs in the empire or secretly use against opponents to make existing crises more difficult to handle. To gain power players must commit cards sufficient to outpoll the opposition and solve crises, but must avoid overcommitment that reduces future options and opportunities. In addition, each candidate has a different special ability which must be reckoned with.

At the end of play the player with the most prestige points wins.
150277.name: Rome in Crisis

150280.name: Milne Bay
150280.description:
Game description from the publisher:

"Australian troops had, at Milne Bay in New Guinea, inflicted on the Japanese their first undoubted defeat on land. Some of us may forget that of all the Allies it was the Australian soldiers who first broke the spell of the invincibility of the Japanese Army." —Field Marshall Sir William Slim

Defeated at sea in the battle of the Coral Sea in May and then distracted by the US Marine Corps landings on Guadalcanal, the Japanese High Command was forced to change its plans for New Guinea. After diverting the previously allocated Army regiment to reinforce Guadacanal, it fell to the Navy to gather a scratch force to capture the "lightly defended" airfield on the eastern tip of New Guinea.

Unfortunately for Japanese plans, those months of delays allowed Australia to finish assembling a brigade of Militia at Milne Bay during July, then rush a veteran AIF brigade there shortly before the Japanese landings commenced on August 25th, 1942.

Several scenarios are included in Milne Bay to allow players to explore different Australian and Japanese plans.

150281.name: Grid-Hammer
150281.description:
Grid-Hammer is a tabletop game for 2 to 4 players that's played on a 9x9 square board called the "Grid". The object of the game is to move any one of your ten pieces across the Grid and past your opponents' defenses, then exit with this piece off the opposite side of the board.

Pieces move, climb, rotate, capture, transform, and combine into new hybrid pieces as they surge across the board and off the Grid.

Grid-Hammer is themed on the Grid itself. What would an ecosystem populated by grid creatures look like?

150282.name: Starpires
150282.description:
User Summary

Starpires is a classic, turn-based, massively multiplayer strategy game. Your scope is to forge the largest possible galactic empire. Colonize various distinct planet types and strengthen your economy and research capabilities. Also, turn after turn build up your population, infrastructure, defenses and assault fleet. Attack and obliterate pirates, as well as other players in PvP combat. Your ultimate goal is to forge the largest possible galactic empire.

150283.name: Pandora's Dice Wheel
150283.description:
From the front of the box:

Pandora's Dice Wheel is designed to improve your role playing game or any game that uses dice. It replaces 9 dice commonly used in fantasy games (such as Dungeons and Dragons). These include d100 and d30.

By a simple spin of the wheel, you can quickly see your results. There are no loose dice to get lost, and everything is in one handy place. No matter what your skill level, you'll find Pandora's Dice Wheel easy to use and a great addition to your gaming treasures.

Available in Plastic, Deluxe (hardwood and brass, or custom (made to your specifications).

Dice odds rolled: d3, d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20, d30 and d%.

150284.name: Mise en Place: The Culinary Knowledge Game
150284.description: Mise en Place: The Culinary Knowledge Game is a fun and educational game designed to be played by up to six players or teams. Players are immersed in a restaurant environment where they encounter nearly 1200 questions based on culinary terms and concepts. Players begin as entry-level employees and are prompted to answer questions in each of the six certification areas in order to be promoted to Apprentice, Sous Chef, and finally to Executive Chef to win the game. Along the path to promotion, players encounter tally it up questions on measurements, recipe conversions, and the use of fractions and percentages.

150285.description:
Battle Mice is a near-perfect information card game for two players.

The deck consists of three identical sets of mice numbered 1–8. Each player receives one deck, then the last "neutral" deck is shuffled, two of those cards are put aside, and the rest dealt three to each player. Each player then places his first eight mice in a 3x3 grid with the middle square left empty. The neutral mice are kept as a hand of cards.

On a player's turn, he can move one mouse one step. A mouse that moves into the middle empty square has escaped, and the opponent's mouse with the same number is defeated (turned over). Each mouse has a special ability that affects only the two adjacent mice; for example, the fighter mouse protects the adjacent mice from being defeated, the nurse mouse heals a defeated mouse, the speed mouse allows adjacent mice to move twice, and so on. Each time a mouse exits, the active player can place a neutral mouse from his hand on one of the corner squares, if available.

At the end of the game, players receive one point per escaped mouse, but some of the mice give an extra bonus depending on the order in which they escaped. This order is determined by the two neutral mice set aside at the start of the game.
150285.name: Battle Mice

150286.description:
GötzenDiener is a quick set-collecting card game.

The deck consists of five types of cards representing objects of worship, numbered 1–5, of various quantities. On a player's turn, he picks a card, then either keeps it or sends it to another player who cannot refuse the card. If a player gets a hand of four cards, he must discard all cards of any one type from his hand, applying the effect on those card(s).

The game ends when either the deck runs out, someone has a hand of three identical cards, or someone discards a 5. All players then show their hands, earning points for the most common object of worship in hand and the runner-up, and being penalized for everything else, those objects being heretical symbols.
150286.name: GötzenDiener

150287.name: Cavern Crawl
150287.description:
In Cavern Crawl, players take on the role of one of 4 adventurers to explore the caverns, fight monsters and collect loot. It can be played either cooperatively or competitively.

Players start on the same "Start" card, and have slightly different attack, search and defense abilities depending on their character. On their turn, they first draw a map card and connect it to the already placed cards, expanding the caverns and creating more opportunities for battles and loot.

Combat and gaining coins works through dice rolls. Players have to beat certain defence scores of the enemies in their roll, and they gain the associated rewards if they're successful. This can also include treasure cards which provide bonuses and extra abilities.

Players can pool their dice rolls together if they are on the same space, to make it easier to gain rewards or defeat monsters. In this case, the rewards are split.

Players can also attack each other for the chance to steal coins from their opponents.

The goal of the game is to be the first to find 10 coins and make it back to the entrance. Each character has an additional secondary objective which provides an alternative winning condition.

150289.name: Fisherman's Profit
150289.description:
Fisherman's Profit is a simple bluffing "outsmart the others" card game based on the Japanese proverb "If snipe and seashell fight, the fisherman profits", meaning that if two struggle, a third party wins.

From a deck of either blue or red seashells of different values, three cards are placed face down on the play area, and in turn, players peek at the unoccupied seashells, then place either a fisherman or a snipe on one of them. When all have placed, the seashells are turned up and resolved: Blue seashells can be taken only by snipes, and red only by the fishermen. If two have placed on the same, the latter will steal a previously claimed seashell from the former — but if both fisherman and snipe are on the same seashell, the fisherman profits according to the old proverb and both gets the seashell and catches the bird.

150290.name: Dungeon (Issue 219 - Oct 2013)
150290.description:
Contents:

1 Twilight by Christopher Perkins
The Halloween season is here, and we have lots of scary stuff this month to celebrate.

2 Blades of the Stygian Masque by Will Doyle
A fiendish guild of assassins plans to slay
a god. Is there any force in the multiverse that can stop the Stygian Masque? A D&D adventure for characters of levels 25–27.

25 The Star-Touched Grove by Tyler Gelvin
Visit a druid’s grove corrupted by the Far Realm. A D&D Side Trek adventure for characters of levels 8–9.

30 Dark Legacy of Evard by Richard Baker
Evard, master of shadow magic, is dead—or is he? A sinister force has the citizens of Duponde in its clutches and threatens to drag the entire town into the Shadowfell. This D&D adventure for characters of levels 1–3 was originally published for a D&D Encounters season.

150291.description:
User summary:

A simple he-thinks-that-I-think card game.

Players have a set of cards numbered 1–6, where 6 is the king and 1 is a simple pawn. The back of each card is the Pariah, which is zero.
Each turn, players roll a die each and may play face down any card of that number or lower. All turned face up, and you count number of wins. The King wins over all cards except the fool (2), all other cards win over the fool. If a player has played a card higher than the number he rolled, he cannot turn the card, and it's a Pariah, which loses to all. Each win is awarded 1 point.

Every card has a special power, that usually affects his ability to play next turn. For example, the Pariah allows the player to not roll the die, but choose die result for the next turn.

This is repeated for 5 rounds, which counts as one hand. The player with most points after three hands wins the game.
150291.name: Pariah

150292.name: X-Live
150292.description:
User summary:

A solitaire card game based on the concept of rhythmic video games.

The player has a band of five dancers from a selection of 11, numbered 1–5. The dancers are put in a line, where each dancer is either in the front row or back row. From a shuffled deck of notes also numbered 1–5, five cards are lined up. Each turn, the cards of the lest represented colour will "fall down" (are slid down a bit) and must be "caught" by the team of dancers. However, in order to achieve a "perfect rhythm", a note must be caught by a dancer with the same number, if caught by a dancer with a number at most 1 more or less than the note is "good" if the note and the dancer are of the same colour; anything else is a "fail".
Before each catch, the player can only move one dancer one step, either from back row to front row, or sideways, in which case they swap places with whoever was beside them. However, moving sideways to a spot where no dancer is is not counted as a move, and will also cause the dancer who now ends up in the same column as the moved one, to move in the opposite direction, a so-called "cross move".

Being in the back row gives the dancer one extra turn to catch the note. Also, apart from the current row of falling notes, the player will have another row of notes above it, enabling the player to plan his moves one turn ahead.

The final score is decided by the number of perfects and good rhythm catches. Also, before each game, the player chooses which song to dance to; each song having a special effect on the game. Each dancer also has a special power to activate once per game.

150293.description:
The Ravens of Thri Sahashri is a two-player cooperative card game. One player is playing the girl Ren who has lost her memory; the other is the detective trying to repair it. The game is about trying to communicate as well as possible by simply the choice of cards. (Note: "Thri Sahashri" is the buddhist term for a trillion worlds combined, which in this case means "the other plane".)

Of a deck consisting of cards of five colors and numbered 1–5, the Ren player draws four cards and keeps them face down. The goal for both players is to ensure that when the hand ends, the playing field has cards of these colors and these colors only.

Each round, the detective draws as many cards as he wishes from the shuffled deck, putting them on the playing field according to the marks on the cards. The deck also contains ravens, which when drawn will "eat" any discarded cards of that color and threaten to take them out of the game.

When the detective player is done, the Ren player picks one of the cards in the playing field and puts on the leftmost still "incomplete" hidden card. A hidden card is complete when that card plus the cards placed on it total 7. (The fourth pile, however, should total only 5, according to the Japanese poem metric "dodoitsu" that goes 7-7-7-5.)

Once all four hidden cards are completed, the round ends and unless the playing field has exactly the colors represented among the hidden cards, the players have failed. The game is played for three hands, but in the final hand, one hidden card must be completed per round, lest the players fail. Players also fail if the deck runs out or if all five Ravens are drawn.
150293.name: The Ravens of Thri Sahashri

150294.description:
COGZ is a mad scientist strategy board game set in the steampunk era, where someone has broken the mad professor’s chromatic cogtraption!
You are a cognizant cogineer trying to repair the broken cogtraption before the professor returns. The other cogineers all seem to think they have the superior cognition needed to rebuild the chromatic device. It’s time to prove you are the true cogineer genius!
Hurry! You recognise there isn’t much time to do this incognito before the professor returns with his cog-nac…



How to Play

Cogineers are all swapping segments of the broken cogtraption to repair it. As long as the segment is different, cogineers gain cognition (game points) for doing so. When a mechanism is repaired fully it can no longer be modified by the other cogineers who all have their own agenda for repairs. There is bonus cognition and bonus turns to be awarded for clever repairs as well.

COGZ is a very simple game though it hides a huge amount of strategic depth which is normally discovered as cogineers gain experience. The best way to learn the game is to play the game. You can download the latest rules from the website (http://cogz.raez.net) and if you signup to the Newsletter you can also get the download link for the print and play version.



Game Play Features


Mensa Endorsed - COGZ has been tested by Mensa Members from a number of countries and has been endorsed by the High IQ Society Mensa.
Colour Blind Accessible - COGZ has been heavily tested with Colour Blind people with various visual impairments and optimised to be accessible to the common colour blind limitations.
Variants Included



COGZ included a book of variants. Tournaments, Team play, Different board layouts, 3D board setups and increase player range from 1-12 players.



Free Shipping - COGZ has free shipping to any international destination. It will also include VAT in Europe and GST in Australia.
Multiple Languages - COGZ has been translated into multiple languages. The latest rules can be downloaded from the website download section when they are complete.



Play Tested - COGZ has been play tested for almost 3 years and the game play has been repeatedly improved.
Wide Age - Both kids and adults can play COGZ and learn new skills and strategies as they progress.
Wide Skill - COGZ can be played very lightly right through to intense strategic planning.
Improve IQ - The more you play COGZ the better your pattern matching, planning and strategy will become.
Modular - The broken cogtraption is constructed from the Cog Tiles and provides infinite variations.
Elegant - The COGZ rules have been refined repeatedly to be as polished as a nice brass cog.
Competitive - In 2 or 3 players, COGZ can be incredibly strategic. COGZ Tournament variant is included.
Casual - In higher numbers of players (5 and 6), COGZ is more casual and social fun.
Simple - There are numerous layers of strategy in COGZ making it simple to learn but hard to master.




Game Component Features


1200dpi graphics
thick cardboard
linen finish on all components
cotton drawstring bag
foil logo printing on Drawstring bag
solid brass game gadget interscrews
game gadget functional gear mechanisms



COGZ will be available primarily via the RAEZ Shop shop.RAEZ.net and your favourite retail store.
150294.name: COGZ

150295.name: D.D. Dogma

boardgameartist.71625: フジオカ　アデリ (Aderi Fujioka)

150295.description:
D.D. Dogma is a party-style card game simulating the back-and-forth dialogue between roleplayers and the game master in an RPG session.

Each player selects a team of heroes from the available line-up, then receives six quest cards and a number of play cards that signify dice numbers.

Taking turns, players ask an opponent for a quest; that player unveils one of his quests, then the asking player tries to solve the quest by rolling as many dice as he has heroes, activating their abilities to generate resources such as "battle", "magic", "thievery" and so on. Each quest has its own clear requirements, and if the player manages to generate the correct resources, he gains the victory points the quest generates; if not, these points go to the quest owner.

After the dice roll, players can adjust the values of the dice by playing cards from their hands, either elevating, lowering or re-rolling the dice rolled. After this is done, the dice are applied to the lineup of heroes, activating different abilities.

150296.description:
For the first time, a game about Marshall amps. Explore the exciting life of Jim Marshall as the Father of Loud, a great musician and champion engineer.

The only Marshall trivia game. 50 years of rock history. A tribute to the gods of riffs.

The loudest rock game ever.


1,600 trivia questions ranging from early rock and metal to current artists. All questions have three levels of difficulty: Poser, Fan and Scientist. All players are always involved since they bet on each other’s rock knowledge.

The goal is to be the first to finish one lap around the board through the use of rock knowledge, clever betting and a bit of luck. Players answer questions about anecdotes, myths, rockers, albums, songs and Sex, Amps & Rock ‘n’ Roll. You can also be asked to hum the riffs of well-known rock songs.

Features:

Authentic Rock Science Marshall Tortex game paws by DUNLOP, made exclusively for this game.

Inspired by the classic Marshall look of the 50th anniversary amps, the game even has its own Marshall model number.

Exclusive limited edition poster, Rock Science Marshall picks and Marshall stack card holders, found only in this game.
150296.name: Marshall

150297.name: La Notte dei Cloni Assassini freeform Larp

rpg.23879: La Notte dei Cloni Assassini freeform Larp

150297.description:
Designer summary:

This game is an Italian Sci-fi black comedy freeform LARP.

Doctor Mayers, in charge of the factory that produces the Xiroprazz 3000 digestive has been murdered. The supervisor AI has sealed the factory. But what of the 22 worker clones inside?

150298.description:
In the world of computer programming, there can only be one winner - either zeros or ones!

One Zero One is an abstract strategy card game for two players. With identical 16-card decks, each player (as either 0 or 1) plays cards to the program display, endeavouring to gain control of lines of program code. Each line is worth a set number of points. As soon as the program runs, points are tallied and the winner is determined.

Most cards display commands which will affect the cards already in play. The order and position of cards played by each opponent will have a huge bearing on the outcome, as will the ability of the players to adjust their strategies as the programming code changes.

Game #1 in 'The Mike Line' of games from Grail Games.
150298.name: One Zero One

150299.name: Dragonero GDR Scatola Base
150299.description:
From the publisher blurb

In Dragonero GdR potrete visitare le terre descritte da Luca Enoch e Stefano Vietti, e magnificamente disegnate per Sergio Bonelli Editore. Dovrete risolvere enigmi che potranno condurvi alla morte, affrontare creature inquietanti e talmente minacciose che solo dei veri eroi come i protagonisti della serie a fumetti sarebbero in grado di affrontare, dovrete lottare per emergere fra torme di nemici che cercheranno, con l’astuzia o il confronto aperto, di farvi cadere e di cancellare financo il vostro ricordo dalle terre dell’Erondàr.

Costruito su un sistema esistente e conosciuto ma con meccaniche nuove ed innovative, Dragonero GdR è stato provato e sviluppato da un team completamente italiano sulla base delle aspettative dei giocatori, delle necessità della trama e dei meccanismi imposti dal bellissimo fumetto di Dragonero: una scoperta sia per i giocatori esperti che per i neofiti.

Nella scatola base troverete il
- Manuale di Gioco
- Mappa dell'Erondàr

English Translation by Google (with user corrections)
In the Dragonero RPG you can visit the lands described by Luca Enoch and Stefano Vietti, and wonderfully drawn for Sergio Bonelli Editore. You'll have to solve puzzles that could lead to your death, face creatures so threatening and disturbing that only real heroes like the characters of the comic series would be able to deal with, you will have to struggle to emerge from hordes of enemies that will try, through cunning or open confrontation, to bring you down and erase even your memory from the lands of Erondàr.

Built on an existing and known system but with new and innovative mechanics, Dragonero RPG has been tested and developed by an entirely Italian team, taking into account the expectations of the players, the needs of the plot and the mechanisms imposed by the beautiful comic Dragonero: a discovery both for experienced players and for newbies.
In the box you will find the basic

Rulebook
Map of Erondàr





The Dragonero Rulebook includes:

All the basic rules to create the heroes of the world and to play Dragonero: races, classes, skills, abilities, talents, equipment, combat, magic and magical objects.
The rules for GM: PNG, environment and storytelling techniques.
Web Enhancement Digital Free Online e-wyrd.com and App Store. Follow us on Facebook pages Dragonero and Dragonero GDR!

150300.name: Mythos Player's Guide
150300.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Olympians have spoken and you are to join the ranks of heroes and heroines involved in the Heavenly Contest! The Olympian deities are in a race to find the successor to Zeus’s throne, with the successor acquiring the greatest number of followers. But the gods and goddesses are quite busy, and to shine their light upon the mortals of Hellas requires intervention of a divine scale. Heroic deeds are a must if one is to prove themselves worthy for the gratification of Olympus and the pursuit of seeing their patron deity rise to rulership! Are you strong, brave, and smart enough for the challenge? We will see how you fair against the great beasts of Hellas and the heroes and heroines who support your rival deity. This is the Heavenly Contest. This is Mythos!

In Mythos, you assume the role of a demigod or devoted human of the gods and goddesses of Olympus in a heroic mythological representation of Ancient Greece. Heroes and heroines join in the Heavenly Contest to prove their worth to the deities and spread the word of their patron deity to the mortals of Hellas, in hopes of raising their patron deity to the Olympus throne. Heroes and heroines come from all walks of life, representing their patron deity as adventurers, fighters, hoplites, Olympic athletes, courtesans, sages, and rogues. Through affiliations with deific cults and Mystery Cults, they gain access to great powers and follow the strands of Fate as they travel Hellas in search of their next, grand performance.
