Inside the Mythos player's guide you will find:

An introduction to mythological Ancient Greece and the Heavenly Contest.
The demigod character race and its associated Divine Edges, more powerful than those you’ve seen before.
New Edges and Hindrances.
A completely new Arcane system to represent membership in one of the Mystery Cults.
A collection of patron deities from Greek Mythology.
Everything you need to create a Mythos character!

150301.name: AutoHARP SF Xtreme
150301.description:
From publisher blurb:

AutoHARP SF Xtreme is an add-on database (drawing upon the HARP SF Xtreme supplement) for the AutoHARP SF software.

The database file includes Vehicle Combat, Vehicles in general added to the items, Cyberware, Interstellar Travel, a Virtual Character converter and the ability to create an AI or Robotic character, providing you with the full suite of options available in HARP SF & HARP SF Xtreme

The software works under Windows and most Linux distributions. Use the exe file for Windows and the jar files for Windows or Linux - note the jar files require the Java Runtime Environment.

150302.name: Hyperion
150302.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet HYPERION!!

Never-before-available in any format! This newest solo release features a hero from the WGU's distant past in a new role, with new powers, and with a new mission that takes place light years away in a sister galaxy. Who is Hyperion? Will he side with the enigma known as Regent, or against him? Could anyone stop him, if necessary??

150303.description: Walnut Grove: Scoring Summary is a promotional reference card distributed by Lookout Games in 2011 to aide players in tallying their points.
150303.name: Walnut Grove: Scoring Summary

150304.name: Story
150304.description:
Can you tell a good story?

In the board game Story, you and your opponents match pictures, explain why they belong together and then vote for the player who told the best story. The reason why your picture is the best match is up to you. No explanation is more correct than another.

After each round, the players show who they have voted for and points are given accordingly. The player who receives the most votes is awarded 1 point. Every player who has voted for that player’s story receives 3 points. Each player receives between 0 and 4 points each turn.

The player that first reaches 20 points or more wins.

150305.name: The Haunted Manor House
150305.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 1"=5' battle map of a haunted or abandoned manor house. It could is set in a generic era so that it can be used in a wider range of genres such as fantasy, modern, or something set in the victorian era. This map could be a house used by a lesser vampire in a Vampire or Ravenloft game, or it could be a house inhabited by a lich, or multiple ghosts. There are plenty of possibilities!

There are five different versions of this map, covering 3 different floors. Other features include:

25"x15" in size. This is smaller than previous releases, but consider that area doubled as there is a second floor above the first, and an optional basement as well, for a total of 57.5"x40"!
Abandoned version - An abandoned version of the house is included where all furnishings have been removed and the sense of decay is greater as a result. There are both day and night versions of the abandoned manor house.
Inhabited version - A fully furnished version is included, with both night and day maps included. Though the house does have furnishings, that doesn't mean the house wasn't abandoned by its owners. Who knows what the undead tenants may have done to scare them off! Of course, with the night maps, the candelabras are lit, so someone is definitely home.
Black and White version - There is also a printer friendly black and white version included.
Included map key to help you understand the command center better.

150306.name: The Destroyed Command Center
150306.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nestled in the center of a recently fallen outpost, this command center was bombarded and then overrun by an enemy army. Though the army itself moved on seeking bigger targets shortly after the outpost fell, a small garrison of soldiers were left to hold the outpost and ensure that no one returned to reclaim it. They are still here, and your players must find some way to defeat them.

This is a 1"=5' battle map of a destroyed command center for use in miniature gaming. Features of this map pack include:

66" x 66" in size. That's 5.5' x 5.5' in case you don't want to do the math!
Snowy version - Since this map was originally envisioned in a snowy area, the original environment is included.
Grassy version - If the time and/or environment of your game doesn't call for a snowy area, a grass version is included.
Black and White version - A more printer friendly black and white version is included to keep printing costs down.
Included map key to help you understand the command center better.
A sample of the VTT version of this map is also included as a free bonus!




This map is a replica of a smaller virtual table top version found in the VTT Campaign Maps Volume I map pack. Because I had to create this map from scratch (since the original was far too small for miniature gaming), some details may have changed between that map and this one.

150307.name: The City Block
150307.description:
From publisher blurb:

Battle Maps: The City Block is the first 1"=5' full color miniature battle map offering from Stoneworker Cartography. It is a very large map when completely printed out, spanning 88 pages at eighty by eighty inches. That's almost 6.7 feet of pure battle mapping goodness!

This map is a replica of a smaller virtual table top version of the City Block map, found here. Because I had to create this map from scratch (since the original was far too small for miniature gaming), some details may have changed between the original and this one.

Included within are both a colored version and a black and white version of this map. There is also a small key included to demonstrate the major features of the map.

Keep in mind that it may not be necessary to print the entire 88 pages of this map for your game. 6.7' is a lot of space being used up by a single map, and most tables aren't large enough to accommodate this file in its entirety. If you find this is the case, you can always print out smaller sections of the map to cover only the areas you need.

150308.description:
Trivia game about Stockholm with 1500 questions.

The object of the game is to be the first to claim an area of the city by answering questions or being lucky with the dice.

Event cards can be used to steal questions and more.
150308.name: Hufvudstaden

150309.name: VTT Campaign Maps Volume I
150309.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a collection of 40 high quality fantasy maps covering 22 different locations, created for use with Virtual Table Top (VTT) software (Such as Fantasy Grounds II or d20Pro, among others). Each map is in .jpeg format for ease of use and import into your gaming software.

Included in this map pack are the following locations:

Ambusher's campsite
A destroyed command center
Enemy general's camp
Estate gardens (nobility or palatial)
Minor noble estate house (Levels 1 & 2)
Noble estate backyard
Village of Sandomere's Vale
A swamp campsite
Aerial view of a balcony far above a city (Extends from a tower)
A snowy bridge
A dungeon
An entire city block (with alleys)
A clock tower (under attack)
A dock warehouse (with ship)
A firepit campsite
A bridge spanning between two tall towers (city below)
A jail
A library
Two different inns (One with two levels)
A sewer system
A town hall




The majority of the maps are 2000 px by 2000 px in size and feature night and day versions to make it easy to fit your time setting and to aid in identification of terrain and map features. All maps are colored and feature lighting schemes so they will visually be more realistic than a standard map drawn on graph paper.

There are both grid and gridless versions of each map, so that you have the choice of using your VTT software's built in grid capabilities if you wish. Both versions feature a grid size box to aid you and your players with distances.

Because these maps were originally created for my own personal campaign, I've included a .PDF file which describes features of the map and illustrates how it was used in my game, as well as gives suggestions for other possible uses.

150310.name: Bloodbath at Camp Terrahorra
150310.description:
PDF Description

The hormonal counselors at Camp Terrahorra are getting everything ready for the campers to arrive. There’s cabins to clean, firewood to cut, and of course lots of illegal drugs and alcohol to consume and maybe a even some good old-fashioned premarital sex if you’re lucky. You and your friends don’t have a care in the world.
Well, except the crazed murderer who’s said to stalk these very woods, that is. Supposedly a cannibal killer named Ollie Stigers escaped from the mental institution across the river a couple years ago and now lives in the woods preying on lost campers. But those are just stories, right?

150311.name: Church of Consumption
150311.description:
User summary:

Ruins of a Church inhabitated by a cult of obese people, feasting on the flesh of a sleeping god.

211083.name: Welcome Back to the Dungeon: Easter Egg

150312.description:
Welcome to the Dungeon — first released as Dungeon of Mandom — is a push-your-luck dungeon delve in which 2-4 players take turns essentially daring each other to go into a dungeon with less equipment than they start off with while filling the dungeon with monsters. Players can win the game by winning 2 rounds or get eliminated from the game by losing 2 rounds. Each player has a 2-sided players card that has a white side and a red side. The first win taps the player card and the 1st loss flips the card over to the red side. A 2nd loss will have the player turn the card back into the box.

The game is played in rounds. The player sets up the base character and all the equipment equipped. This represents every player as a fully equipped dungeon delver.

Each round, the start player (the person who challenged the dungeon last or the last player to be in a dungeon) can choose to draw a card from the monster deck or pass their turn.

If they choose to draw, they can do one of two things: (1) keep it and de-equip an equipment or (2) place it face down in the dungeon. Placing it face down in the dungeon creates the dungeon deck and fills the dungeon with monsters that the challenger will have to face later. If they choose to pass their turn, they cannot participate in the rest of the round. Once only one person is left after all the other players have passed their turn, that player then becomes the challenger and must go into the dungeon with only the equipment he has equipped.

The player then flips cards off the dungeon deck and fights the monsters within. Some equipment allow you to null the enemy damage or be able to withstand it by increasing your HP. If the player survives the dungeon with at least 1 HP, they win that round. If not, they lose. The players then reshuffles all the cards to make a new monster deck and re-equips all the equipment to start a new round.

The game ends when someone has won twice or one player is the last man standing.

Welcome to the Dungeon includes four different sets of character cards whereas Dungeon of Mandom has only a single character.
150312.name: Welcome to the Dungeon

150313.name: Yumekaki
150313.description:
In Yumekaki, players play cards and tell a story that intertwines together. Cards have special symbols in their drawings that tell the player in what way they should tell their part of the story, e.g., telling the story in ten syllables, creating a dialogue with the items in the art, or telling an unfinished story that the next player must pick up. The game ends when players play a card with a popped bubble indicator the second time.

The game comes in two sets: the Starbox and the Moonbox. They can be combined for a larger game.

150314.name: Crash_Em_Thrash_Em_Warbots
150314.description:
/Intro_Start

Welcome to the Crash 'Em Arena. It is in this simulation that players compete in a mechanized brawl by controlling their assigned Crash 'Em Bot. This is done by inputting /Programs (/Program cards) into their Bot to initiate commands for movement, attacking an opponent, or even hacking their systems in order to sabotage their plans. Once enough points are awarded, usually through beating on opponents, the combatant who earns those points first is declared the victor!

Let the games begin.

/End_Intro

150316.name: Rune Crash
150316.description:
Rune Crash is an abstract board game from 1 to 4 players where the goal is to have the most knowledge points at the end of the game.

Combine 3 or more runes in a line and get the knowledge points. Explore the power of the special runes and be careful with the bombs that will sabotage your discoveries.

In the Solitary rules your objective is to get as many Dolmens as possible before the 40 round.

•••

Rune Crash es un juego abstracto jugable de 1 a 4 jugadores donde la meta es obtener la mayor cantidad de puntos al final del juego.

Combina 3 o mas runas en linea para obtener los puntos de conocimiento. Explora el poder de las runas especiales y ten cuidado con las bombas que sabotearan tus descubrimientos.

En el modo solitario el objetivo es obtener la mayor cantidad de dolmenes antes del round 40.

150317.name: Star Punk
150317.description:
A role playing game about kicking space travel up a notch and disrupting the status quo.

From the front page.

Made for the 1KM1KT 2013 Harder Than Granite 24HR RPG contest.

150318.name: Los Señores del Mal
150318.description:
Its not easy to be a Master of Evil. The working hours suck... Finding efficient minions is a pain... and keeping your well-earned treasure safe from the hands of the so called "Heroes" ends up being a full-time job. But... this is YOUR JOB and fame in the Inner Circle of Evil is everything to you so why not show the other Masters how a demonic job is really done! Masters of Evil is a game for 1 to 6 players where each player takes the role of an Evil Master that is repelling the attack of a variety of heroes trying to gain as much reputation as possible by imprisoning the heroes when defeated.

At the beginning of the game 5 hero cards are dealt to each player so 3 can be chosen. Those heroes will be attacking your Den. Each turn a Monster is Summoned and you will have to place one of your minion tokens on one of your heroes that have that monster symbol. If you complete a card by filling all the monster, traps, and spells symbols you defeat that hero and can claim it as a reward by imprisoning him/her into your dungeon cell. Some heroes provide a special reward when defeated... from adding an extra monster to getting a special Overlord ability.

After placing minions a die is rolled to determine if a type of hero attacks. To repel an attack you can remove monsters from that hero card for a value equal, bigger or lower than the hero attack (defined by the roll of 1D6). If you repel the complete attack you are undamaged. If you repel a portion you can get the rest of the damage by reducing your life (which begins with 10). Also you can simply nullify the attack of a hero by distracting them with one of your treasures. Spells can be used to change the summoned monster type and Traps can nullify any attack (even if they are not in the card of an attacking hero).

When the 6th hero is collected by any player the game is over and the scoring phase begins. Players get the points in the hero cards but also get points for the most types of each monster and if they collect at least 3 cards of a Hero Type.


No es facil ser un Señor del Mal. Las horas a las que hay que levantarse apestan... Encontrar sirvientes eficientes es un dolor de medula... Y conservar tu "bien merecido" tesoro de las garras de los heroes termina siendo un trabajo full-time. Pero es tu OFICIO y la fama adquirida en el circulo Interno de la Maldad lo es todo para ti... asi que porque no mostrar a los demas Señores como se hace un buen trabajo demoniaco! En los Señores del Mal los jugadores toman el rol de Señores Oscuros que estan repeliendo el ataque de audaces heroes aprisionandolos cuando son derrotados para asi ganar la tan preciada fama.

Al comienzo del juego se entregaran 5 cartas de heroe a cada jugador de las que seran elegidas 3. Esos heroes atacaran tu Guarida. Cada turno sera Invocado un Monstruo y tendras que colocar un token de minion en uno de los heroes que tenga en su carta a dicho monstruo disponible. Si completas todos los slots de la carta derrotas al heroe y puedes reclamar la recompensa aprisionandolo en una celda. Algunos heroes proveen recompensas especiales cuando son derrotados... desde otorgar un monstruo extra a darle al Overlord una habilidad permanente.

Luego de colocar los minions se tira un dado para determinar el tipo de heroe que atacara. Para repeler un ataque se pueden remover monstruos de la carta de dicho heroe por un valor igual, superior o inferior que el ataque del heroe (definido por un D6). Si repeles completamente el ataque no eres dañado. Si solo se repele una porcion recibes el resto del daño reduciendo tu vida (que comienza en 10). Tambien puedes anular un ataque entregandole uno de tus tesoros. Los hechizos pueden ser usados para invocar un monstruo diferente del que se ha invocado y las Trampas anulan cualquier ataque (incluso si no estan en la carta del heroe atacante)

Cuando un jugador aprisiona a su sexto heroe el juego termina y comienza la ronda de puntaje. Los jugadores obtienen puntos por cada heroe capturado, pero tambien por mayoria de determinado tipo de monstruo y variedad de heroes.

150320.name: Necromo Nightmare

rpg.3528: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

150320.description:
From the introduction

The year is 3072. The fires of the Word of Blake’s Jihad threaten to consume the Inner Sphere. On the borders of Capellan space, the vital world of Necromo has suddenly gone silent, perhaps the victim of a Blakist strike. But what could hit such a busy and well-defended planet so hard that even the Chancellor’s best would fail to call for help?

Time to find out…

BattleTech Adventures: Necromo Nightmare takes players to the dark world of Necromo, on the Confederation’s border with the Federated Suns—a world mysteriously silenced by a lightning attack by unknown forces. Can your team discover the cause of this shipyard planet’s unexplained blackout, and live to tell the tale? Necromo Nightmare includes a guide to this important world, personal biographies on several key players, and adventure Tracks designed for use with A Time of War: The BattleTech Role-Playing Game and the A Time of War Companion, as well as special rules, terrain guides, maps, and Record Sheets for key non-player characters and equipment unique to this story.

150321.name: Footprints (Issue 18 - Apr 2013)
150321.description:
Table of Contents:
% in lair .................................. 3
The Cult of the Devourer ................... 3
A Riddle ................................... 9
The Mired Cathedral ....................... 10
Magic Items ............................... 16
The Holy Sword ............................ 17
Tribal Spellcasters Revisited ............. 20
Creatures of the Tulgey Wood .............. 28
The Sorcerer .............................. 30
An Unhealthy Obsession with Equipment ..... 35

150322.name: Steampunk Tower
150322.description:
User Summary

Steampunk Tower is a tower defense game with several unique mechanics. First, there is only one big central tower on which the various cannons are purchased and placed. Second, the central tower gets higher as the game proceeds, so there are more floors on which to place your cannons. Third, you can move your cannons around on different floors and/or change their orientation. Finally, you can upgrade your cannons and play additional challenge levels. These will test your tactical skills but will also reward you with many extra points!

150323.description:
Berserk: Knights and Villains can be played on its own or as an expansion for Berserk: War of the Realms. The cards in Knights and Villains are a bit simpler than in the base set, but that does not mean that it is less interesting to play with them.

At the beginning of the game, you choose your side — Knights or Villains — then you recruit your army. All the creatures in this game have a cost, life, movement and basic strike, and some have additional abilities written on the card. The random factor in this game is a die; any player may use regular d6 die, or a special d6 die for attack or defense. Players place their creatures on the battlefield and the game begins. You can move and act with your creatures in any sequence.

Berserk: Knights and Villains includes both quick play and full rules inside the box.
150323.name: Berserk: Knights and Villains

150326.name: Into The Odd
150326.description:
User Summary:

Into The Odd is a Survival Horror Role-Playing Game.


The world is too large for anyone to fully map and too old for academics to accurately record. Explorers return from every direction with tales of bizarre places, wondrous and horrific. You are an Explorer, braving the unknown in search of riches, fame, knowledge or power.

150328.name: The Beast of Ledsham
150328.description:
From the PDF:

'This full length investigative adventure set in the ancient village of Ledsham is perfect for novice investigators or experienced characters alike and can be run as a one off or easily integrated into a full campaign. The full adventure should take roughly 3-4 game sessions to play through and can be run with as many characters as desired.

"Something evil lurks in the woodland of the manor of Ledsham, eating game and scaring the villagers. The Norman baron Ilbert de Lacy will take harsh measures against the village unless the brave investigators can find out the truth behind the beast and deal with the problem once and for all."

This adventure requires the core Maesltrom Domesday rulebook to play.'

150331.name: Prisoner's Dilemma: Camp 16
150331.description:
You remember the outside world and you remember liking it. But by now, you’ve been in Camp 16 so long, you’re forgetting what it looked and felt like. Inside the camp you face certain death, outside the camp you face starvation, sickness, bitter cold, enemy territory, and even death at the hands of your own comrades. Struggle is life. In Prisoner’s Dilemma: Camp 16 you play as either Prisoner #75044 or Prisoner #44233, two prisoners unaware of their crime, and hungry for freedom.

In this two player game, each player has a prisoner, and chooses one of three possible win conditions (Martyr/Survivalist/Comrade). Players will take turns reading a scenario, then bargaining with their fellow prisoner to come to a conclusion about whether to choose a selfless [o] path or a selfish [x] path. Based on the combination of the two player’s choices, players will take or gain damage according to the Results table beneath the scenario. If the players survive and meet their individual win conditions, they win. If they die, they lose. You must make good decisions to keep yourself alive, though sometimes that may mean making personal sacrifices in order to stay alive in the long run.

150334.name: Sexism
150334.description:
Your goal in Sexism is to move from the doll house to the White House, with the first player to cross the finish line winning. What you win, however, depends on your gender and whether you proceed to the "Man's Goal" or the "Woman's Goal". If you win as a woman, the game instructs others that "You are now a person and must be treated as such for 24 hours"; if a man, you receive a cartoon of a large thumb pushing a woman down and a declaration that "Congratulations, you've won — or have you?"

Gameplay consists mostly of drawing cards, reading the text on them (e.g., "You're all for women's liberation, but nobody's going to catch YOU going to a woman doctor. Go back one step."), then moving forward or backward as dictated. Some cards require the active player to act out a role, then others guess who or what the player was trying to be.

The game rules suggest playing as the opposite gender "because this can cause some hilarious role-playing situations".

150335.name: Willkommen im Adri

rpgseries.23840: AHL - Living Greyhawk Ahlissa (Adri/Innspa) Regional Adventures

Eine Expedition zu einer alten Tempelanlage bringt die Spielerfiguren auf die Spur diverser Geschehnisse im Adri-Wald - und ein uraltes Geheimnis beginnt sich zu enthüllen . . .
Ein Abenteuer für neue Spielercharaktere im Adri-Wald nach den Regeln der D&D-Drittauflage. Für Charaktere der Stufen 1 - 4.

'An expedition to an old temple site sets the characters on the track of several activities in the Adri - and an age old secret starts to unveil . . .
An adventure for new characters set in the Adri according to Dungeons & Dragons 3rd edition rules. For characters level 1 to 4.'

150336.name: Der Ruhm vergangener Tage

rpgseries.23840: AHL - Living Greyhawk Ahlissa (Adri/Innspa) Regional Adventures

150336.description:
From the cover of the adventure

Eine Truppe umherreisender Schauspieler kommt auf ihrer Tournee nach Herbergsbad, um eine der wichtigsten Schlachten in der Geschichte Aerdys in einem atemberaubenden Spektakel nachzustellen. Doch scheinbar wird einer von ihnen von gefährlichen Attentätern gejagt.
Für Charaktere der Stufen 1 - 4.

'A troupe of traveling entertainers comes to the city, preparing to re-enact some of the most important battles in Aerdy history in a thrilling spectacle. But someone among their number seems to hunted by deadly assassins... An adventure for beginning characters, using 3rd edition D&D® rules. For characters levels 1-4.' (this translation is from the cover of the english version of the adventure, by Dr. Rainer Nagel)

150337.description:
"Your prize will be the doom of you. Krakens rise from the sea, Theon, or did you forget that during your years among the wolves?"
–George R.R. Martin, A Clash of Arms

Spoils of War is the first Chapter Pack in the "Conquest and Defiance" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. In Spoils of War, each of the six Great Houses of Westeros enjoy the plunder and glories of their victories...even as those trophies place them at risk to lose their positions of power. Among the Chapter Pack's sixty cards (three copies each of twenty individual cards), you'll find captives, spies, vengeful schemes, righteous fury, and deadly, crippling treachery.

Many of the new cards from Spoils of War feature the "prized" keyword, which balances tremendous risks and rewards in deck-building and play. These cards lend material, in-game value to the riches you plunder, the captives you seize, and the castles you successfully siege. But can you hold them once you win them? Prized cards give your opponents power when they enter your discard or dead piles, so it’s up to you to leverage your spoils toward victory!
150337.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Spoils of War

39953.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game

rpgseries.23840: AHL - Living Greyhawk Ahlissa (Adri/Innspa) Regional Adventures

150338.description:
From the cover of the module:

Banditen machen seit einiger Zeit die Handelsstrasse nach Alfersfurt unsicher. Gerade nach dem glücklich zurückgeschlagenen Angriff von Prinz Molil ist der Ort auf den Handel angewiesen. Wer steckt hinter diesen Überfällen? Und was bezweckt er mit ihnen? Für Charaktere der Stufen 1 - 8 (Ebene 1 - 3).

'For some time now, Bandits make the trade route to Elversford unsafe. Right now, after the lucky defeat of prince Molil's assault, the village of Elversford depends on the trade. Who is behind those attacks? And what is the goal? For characters level 1 to 8 (Layer 1 - 3).'

150339.name: Portholes
150339.description:
Portholes is a space strategy game set in the LUNA-2 space prison.

Plot: A digital voice: "auto-destruct sequence initiated"... The doors of the prison cells open automatically. Four convicts: thieves, assassins, tax evaders and politicians, have to find a way to ignite the safety pod engines and flee LUNA-2 space station.

Gameplay: miniature tactical game with cards, equip items, custom dice combat system and tile portals.

One of the players controls the guards, and the other player(s) control the convicts.

GOAL: Find the the RED key needed to reach the safety pod, place the "Power cell", re-activate KAL 9000, ignite the engines and flee LUNA-2 space prison.

If the convicts' HP reach zero, the guards win.

150341.description:
PDF Description:

An Adventure Site in the Galaxy of Seeded Space

150342.name: The Baleful Spring
150342.description:
PDF Description:

An adventure for a party of 3-6 characters of 2nd to 4th level. The PCs are on a mission to secure peace between a COunt and the neighbouring lizardfolk.

150343.description:
PDF Description:

A valuable prototype (and associated documentation) has been stolen from the MacGuffin Corporation. Hackers hired by MacGuffin have traced the theft to an executive of rival firm Blackacre Trust. MacGuffin wants to hire you to replace the prototype with a faked copy that will lead Blackacre R&D down blind alleys for at least a year.

150344.name: The Devil's Acre
150344.description:
PDF Description:

￼￼Our heroes agree to stand vigil over a penitent NPC of level 1-8. The terms of this person’s penance: to pray from dusk till dawn for three nights with no more than a breath’s rest, eating nothing and drinking only water either day or night, at the site of an ages-old pact between Heaven and Hell...

Adventure game scenario for character levels 4-6

High above the streets below, the party faces off against a deadly band of thieves.

A fallen dwarf citadel, now infested by orcs.

The Choose One Promo Pack includes the following cards:

Born with superpowers or Transformed as an adult
Kirk or Picard
Religion or Politics
Goatee or Sideburns
Nightmare about falling or Nightmare about being chased
150347.name: Choose One! Promo Pack

150348.name: Aka Fuji
150348.description: Aka Fuji is a dice-based game that uses 15 numbered craft sticks. The sticks have illustrations on either side: a red Mount Fuji on one side, and a blue Mount Fuji on the other. Six cards, separated into three red Mount Fuji cards and three blue, are passed out to players. The players' goal is to use the custom die results to turn the sticks over to the side that matches their card. The player, or team, who first flips all the sticks to the side shown on their card wins.

150349.name: Deductio
150349.description:
Deductio is a French card game for 2-8 players.

The rules of the game

Beginner

Choose the number of cards you want to play with. To start, 3 cards per player are dealt.

Example : you have 3 players and you decide to play with 3 cards. Take the numbered cards from 1 to 10. Mix them up, and distribute them face down. The last card is placed onto the table.

The oldest player begins. He multiplies a couple of his cards and then announces the result.

Example : the first player has cards 2, 5 and 8. Consequently he can associate 3 couples of cards : 2 and 5, 2 and 8, 5 and 8. He chose the first and declares : "10".

His opponents have to deduce which couple it is.

Example : to obtain 10, you can either have the 2 and the 5, or the 1 and the 10. In that case, the second player has the 1 : thus he validates the first hypothesis.

Players take turns in a clockwise direction declaring a multiple, until one player has identified which card is on the table. He says "Deductio" and declares the number of the hidden card without showing the card to the others. If he is right, he scores a point. If he can identify the cards in each player's hand without any mistake, he scores a bonus point, and the hand is over. If he is wrong, he loses 1 point and the hand goes on.

The first player to score 10 points wins the game.

Experienced

Play with 4 cards or more following the same rules. The number of possible couples (for example, 6 couples for 4 cards) and the multiples related to each value increase.

In turns, each player can play the joker card. He puts it in front of him and turns it face down once used. It will allow him to pass his turn once without declaring any number. It can be played at any time.

150350.name: Camwhores
150350.description:
From the text:
Written for Round 3 of the Ronnies, April 2011
Ingredients: Amazon and Lust
[...]

Welcome to the wonderful, wild world of amateur softcore porn. Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to cajole Marks into buying you presents from your Amazon wishlist for the least amount of personal investment and physical depravity possible — while not letting it affect your real life.

150352.name: Hostile Takeover
150352.description:
In the not too distant future the world is ruled by massive corporations that wage war with each other over the control of empires. Literal wars fought by private armies proved to be overly costly in resources, profits, and public opinion, so the Wolf & Phoenix Marketing Conglomerate introduced an out-of-the-box way for corporate entities to resolve their differences: The Hostile Takeover Arena. Corporations that have reached an impasse in negotiations can avoid expensive, lengthy legal battles or risky sabotage by simply hiring a team of trained warriors to out-maneuver the competition in a quick, bloody, ratings-exploding spectacle.

In Hostile Takeover, players control a mercenary team trying to outwit and outgun the competition. Each Character has strengths and weaknesses that must be wisely used to gain the upper hand. Can you lead your team of mercenaries to victory amid the chaos of battle?

Hostile Takeover is played on a modular board (usually 30”x30”) filled with 1” Squares. Force fields and other terrain features are placed on the board to simulate a sci-fi battle arena. Players each use their team of 4 mercenaries to accomplish scenario specific objectives that earn them victory points. The first player to earn enough victory points (determined by scenario and number of players) is the winner. Each scenario is specifically designed to bring all teams together in a flurry of combat.

At the start of each Round players select an Action Card (Move, Melee, Fire or Aim/Overwatch) for each of their unwounded characters. Players also assign 4 Energy Tokens to their characters. Energy Tokens are used to boost the characters in a variety of ways and also enable the use of each character’s unique Special Action. Players then roll for Initiative. Finally, players go in Initiative order activating 1 of their characters. This continues until all characters have acted or become pinned or wounded. There is a quick Clean Up step at the end of the round and then a new round begins.

Ranged and Melee Combat checks are handled by rolling 3d6 and trying to equal or exceed a given target number. Each Character has a chart describing their ranged and melee weapons that quickly and easily provides the target number to roll against based on a variety of factors.

150353.name: Albiele Island
150353.description:
From the introduction

Albiele Island is a haven to some of the worst scum to ever sail an ocean. Pirates, smugglers, slavers and similar sorts all use the island as a convenient place from which to ply their trades throughout the seas of southern Anuire. The island is slightly over 50 miles long and varies from 6 to 25 miles in width. Albiele Island is in fact one of the few pieces of the once mighty Deismaar range not swallowed by the Straits of Aerele.
The western end of the island is heavily wooded. A low range of hills extends down the centre of the island for most of its length. Steep cliffs protect a small, natural harbour which is the home of the thriving Albiele Town. Sparse plains and empty beaches make up the rest of the island’s geography. Each of the areas of the island is presented in more detail below.

150354.name: Player's Secrets of Dhoesone
150354.description:
From the introduction

Welcome to Dhoesone, the northernmost realm of Anuire bordered by the wild Rjurik, savage goblins, raging giants and eerie elves. Torn between 3 competing faiths and fought over by conniving guilders the realm stands at a cross-road in more ways than one. Can prosperity be restored to the land? Or is the realm doomed to fall to infighting?
Only the new regent can say…
The Player’s Secrets of Dhoesone is a sourcebook for use with the Birthright campaign setting for the Dungeons and Dragons role-playing game. It is intended for use by a player-regent of the realm, a DM running a campaign in or around Dhoesone, or as a source of ideas and adventure hooks for those playing elsewhere in Cerilia.
Players wishing to use some of the people, places, plots, etc in this product are advised to discuss them with their GM. The authors note that in all cases the GM’s word is final.

We won’t sue, they might, consider yourselves warned.

150355.description:
User summary

Fan-made booklet describing the Anuirean Domain of Mieres.

150356.name: Source Holdings of the College of Sorcery
150356.description:
From the introduction

Deep within the depths of the lowest levels of the destroyed Royal College of Sorcery, there lies a place of power. Legends within the most ancient texts of the College tell of a handful of special places around Cerilia that hold great significance for practitioners of true magic.

150357.description: Last Night on Earth: Red Zombies with Grave Weapons is a set of seven different zombie miniatures in red plastic, adding a third color of zombies that can be used with the "Grave Weapons" card deck introduced in the Last Night on Earth: Survival of the Fittest expansion.

boardgameaccessory.42116: Last Night on Earth: Survival of the Fittest

150358.name: Fire Starters
150358.description:
From the publisher's website:

Fire Starters: 10 Adventure Seeds to Spark Your Cyberpunk Campaign was designed to help Game Masters find some inspiration for their next cyberpunk campaign or one-shot adventure. Though I encourage fans to use these adventures with Psi-punk, Fire Starters is systemless and usable with any cyberpunk system or setting.

The book offers 10 adventure seeds, complete with introduction, background, complications, conclusions, and follow-up adventure hooks for using the seeds in an ongoing campaign. Each adventure seed is roughly one page in length, so it’s easy to find the information you need to get started building your adventures.

150359.name: Favela Wars
150359.description:
There can be only one king of the slums!

War for drug territory is raging in Rio de Janeiro between Police and Dealers. Neither will be satisfied until the last slum is occupied. Choose your side, plot your strategy, challenge your friends! A turn-based strategy game like you've never seen before!

Source: The Game Website.

150360.name: Nazo Puyo 2
150360.description:
User Summary

Nazo Puyo 2 is a Japanese SEGA Game Gear exclusive and sequel to Nazo Puyo. Like Nazo Puyo, Nazo Puyo 2 is spinoff of the Puyo Puyo series of games.

150361.description:
Promo card given out at SPIEL 2013.

User translation:

"You can show the life points of your heroes here. Use some coins or glass pieces."
150361.name: Kleine Helden: die Lebenspunkte deiner Helden anzeigen

150363.name: The Shackled Self
150363.description:
From the introduction:

In a game of The Shackled Self you, the players, collectively tell the story of a great Prince, or Princess, who left a sheltered life amongst all of earthly delights and went to the Mountain, undertaking a regime of asceticism so that he, or she, may become a Saint. The Prince made this choice out of necessity, after understanding there is no other way for the world itself to be saved from impending doom. But Temptation lurks: the charms of the flesh – of love, even – hailing from the past impede the route to ascetic sainthood and may condemn the Prince to tragic defeat. Or maybe not? Maybe it is success which would be the most tragic, while so-called Temptation actually speaks for a little sanity through the inhumane harshness of the Mountain?

[...]

There are three distinct roles in the game: the Prince, the Temptation and the Mountain. Each player plays one and only one such role throughout the game.

158470.name: Dig Down Dwarf: Gems of Norcia!

150364.description:
Dig Down Dwarf is a dice game in which each player takes on the role of a dwarf chieftain in line for the throne. In the game, you roll dice to obtain gems from the mine. Gain the most valuable collection of gems, and you'll be crowned the new dwarf king!

On your turn, you draw two random gems from the bag and place them on the table. You then roll four six-sided dice. Certain gems require a certain number sequence in order to mine them; roll that sequence, and you can take all the gems of that type! As the game progresses, more and more gems will be added to the table, giving players choices as to which gems they want to try to mine. Sometimes you'll need to press your luck in order to succeed.

Once the bag runs out of gems, you enter the final round, with players needing to do their best to snag the last gems.
150364.name: Dig Down Dwarf

150365.description:
Augustus: Maximus Promo Card is a single card representing (as you might expect) the Emperor Augustus, who is now entering the game himself to aid one of the players.

During game set-up, the youngest player takes this card and places it in front of himself. During the game, when a token drawn from the bag doesn't allow the holder of Augustus to place a legion on a card, this player can choose to place one legion on a card (or move one legion), then pass the Augustus Maximus card to another player.
150365.name: Augustus: Maximus Promo Card

150366.name: Carnival Arcane: The LARP
150366.description:
publisher blurb

Despite the popularity of big circus attractions, small carnivals still tour the American countryside in 1928. While most carnival-goers seek only diversion and entertainment, a few want something more, something that cannot be found in the everyday world of light and reason, and the Lancaster-Rigby Carnival is rumored to offer what no one else can.

The carnival train arrived yesterday in the New England coastal town of Warren's Rock. Opening-day receipts were fair, but the day isn't over. Tonight, for one night only, Lancaster-Rigby presents the Carnival Arcane.

The tents are up, the lights are strung, and the barker is ready to show you in....

Figments of Your Imagination (FYI) proudly presents Carnival Arcane: The LARP, the first in our licensed series of live action scenarios inspired by the horror-themed music of Midnight Syndicate. Based on their acclaimed album, Carnival Arcane, this scenario allows players to step into the roles of characters from the album and townsfolk, some with dark secrets, some with powers that defy explanation, and some with murder in mind.

During the day, Lancaster-Rigby is much like other carnivals, its colorful tents and avenues lined with clowns, side-shows, animal acts, games of skill and chance, and caramel popcorn. However, at midnight, long after most people have gone to bed, the carnival lights come back on and the gates swing wide, admitting anyone brave or desperate enough to contact the Other Side, or buy potions that heal incurable maladies, or procure supernatural means to fight one's enemies, real or perceived. The Carnival Arcane doesn't deal in sleight-of-hand or bottles of snake oil. Within its confines, patrons will experience true power, true miracles, and perhaps true fear. Of course, all such things come at a price, and those who willingly enter the Carnival Arcane must also be willing to pay....

The 96-page book contains everything you need to run this exciting event:

• Simple rules that keep the action moving
• Comprehensive plot summaries
• Detailed character sheets
• Informative and enlightening player handouts
• Prop, decoration, and menu suggestions
• Extensive Game Master notes
• General advice on running LARPs, such as finding locations and attracting players

Our narrative-style character sheets clearly explain each character's past as well as their secrets, goals, and resources. Multiple story lines give every player a chance to get involved. Note that this is a plot-driven LARP with no boffer (foam weapon) combat. The landscape format makes it easy to read both onscreen and in print.

Carnival Arcane: The LARP is written for 11-20 players and one or two GMs, with a suggested running time of 4-5 hours. Try our easy, fast-playing rules, or use your favorite system. The album Carnival Arcane is not included nor required, but we strongly recommend playing it in the background during the event, to help set the mood and create the proper atmosphere.

150367.name: Djinnbusters
150367.description:
From the introduction:

This game lets you play a ghost/spirit/demon/baklava hunter in the fictional kingdom of Al Aalam. You and your friends will traverse the vast desert on your flying carpets, from the most grandiose palace in the capital city to the lonely dunes of the night, hunting down every nasty, slimy ghost – and hopefully, even catch them!

The overarching milieu of this game is that portrayed in the movie Aladdin (that is, Western Asia, or the stereotypically view of it); hot deserts, white palaces, sultans, much sought after oases, spices, and pants so wide that a strong wind could blow you away.

But there’s also the supernatural side to it (who needs ghostbustin’ heroes when there’s no ghost?); evil spirits, levitating djinns, and six hundred year old sultans that refuses to die because they can’t find their shoes. All eager to spread fear and havoc.

150368.name: Dragon Kings World Book
150368.description:
From publisher blurb:

Khitus is a world in decline. New heroes must emerge to challenge the wicked before all is lost …

The benevolent Dragon Kings who ruled over Khitus have inexplicably vanished, leaving once-powerful nations at the mercy of foul creatures. Cold Skins and Krikis grow numerous and bold. Desperate cities of the Old Countries struggle against savage marauders who draw ever closer to their crumbling walls. Ancient wizard schools guard their tomes, essential to their dark sorcerous bargains, more jealously than ever, while the followers of a mysterious prophet rekindle the magic-that-is-not-magic. The essential materials of life and civilization are ruthlessly plundered by the mysterious Pretenders in their Black Fortress, leaving the southern lands, especially, in dire straits.

Adventurers must face the wrath of a violent world, not only to survive but to right these wrongs, protect the innocent, discover the fate of the Dragon Kings, and reintroduce some semblance of justice to a world on the brink of destruction.

Dragon Kings is a new fantasy game setting conceived and presented in fiction, art, and music simultaneously. Written by Timothy B. Brown (creator of Dark Sun and 2300AD), Dragon Kings is the spiritual successor to the popular fantasy setting, Dark Sun.

Dragon Kings includes:

 · A hardbound game book
· A progressive rock CD
· An art-intensive, concert-style book that expands heavily on each song (with lyrics, stories, maps, more art, and so on)

With the PDF available in March 2014, and a planned hardcopy shipping date of June 2014, the game book is rules-agnostic, with PDF supplements for different game systems (Pathfinder, Savage Worlds, FATE, and 13th Age).

Each song on the Dragon Kings progressive rock epic album follows our hero's life from his desperate stand against mercenary raiders to his enslavement on the mighty caravans and his subsequent escape and encounter with an ancient, gentle folk who impart mysterious truths about Khitus, the world of the Dragon Kings…

Every song has its own two-page spread in the album book, expanding upon the material and bringing it to life. Contributors include Timothy Brown, Mike Stone (formerly of Queensryche), Mark Stevens, and Frank Klepaki.

 That’s Dragon Kings: a fantasy world envisioned and created in fiction, art, and music all at once!

150369.name: Mechabrick: Gangs of Neon City
150369.description:
Mechabrick is a range of precision molded plastic kits to convert your minifigs into 1/144 scale fighting robots or 'mecha'. You can upgrade your mechs with weapons and accessories and then battle for supremacy in a fast-paced board game using buildings and scenery built from your favourite plastic toy building bricks.

The first game in the Mechabrick product line is Gangs of Neon City. Set in the back-streets of a futuristic far-eastern metropolis the game uses durable plastic gaming boards (supplied in the game box) printed with a brick-standard grid pattern (4-bricks square) upon which movement and shooting range of the robots is measured.

It's up to you and your imagination to build, change and rebuild the buildings and scenery on your game board from plastic toy building bricks and create your perfect battle environment.

The game sets two or more players in a head-to-head battle of turn-based play using 'action points' to choose whether each robot should move, shoot or both in each turn. Customisation and upgrades to your robots are key to a decisive win, but be careful not to weigh down your mech with too many upgrades and make them too slow to fight!

The printed rulebook supplied with the boxed game is only 4 pages long and is designed to be fun and fast-paced for all the family. We will be publishing free add-ons and expanded rules for the game to keep even the most hardened gamers interested for many years to come.

The boxed game includes four of the 'Wakazashi-Class' mech kits (two black and two white), four plastic game boards, a decal sheet to customize your mechs and your scenery, two D6 dice and a full rule/instruction booklet.

150370.description:
Zeppeldrome, is a serious steampunk race through silly obstacles with a hazardous, modular board and cards that are used to help you or mess with opponents as you all race to be the first to travel the length of the airship raceway.

Game-Play
Each turn, players look at the top half of the cards in their hands and choose one that shows the route they will attempt to take that turn in their effort to get past (or through) silly, yet hazardous, obstacles. The players reveal the chosen flight plan cards simultaneously.

Next, each player uses the often silly, but always strategic, actions on as many of their remaining cards as they like. These actions will either disrupt their opponents, or help themselves (or both).

Once card-play is finished, the last-place player moves any obstacles that need moving on the board (such as the falling Lemmings in the "Tragic Lemming 'Migration'"), and then the players move their dirigibles along the now-final path that resulted from their initial plan, plus cards that were played on them.

As players move, obstacles on the board (including the other players’ dirigibles) affect movement in positive or negative ways (depending on how skillful and lucky the players were in their card-play).

The first player over the finish line is the winner!
150370.name: Zeppeldrome

150371.name: Sheepland
150371.description:
A sunny land of rolling green meadows, lush forests, and majestic mountains. The peaceful, happy people of the island want nothing more than to roam the land with their fuzzy little flocks of fluffy white sheep. All is well and good, until somebody has the bright idea to put up some fences…

Now the shepherds must compete for the most profitable lands to raise their flocks, driving the sheep to the lands they own—and fencing them in so they don’t wander off and join some other shepherd’s flock!

And then there’s that strange black sheep that keeps showing up. His rare black wool is certain to fetch a pretty price in the market for the shepherd that can pen him in!

Can you corral the finest herd in the best lands and become the richest shepherd in Sheepland?

Source: The Developer Website.

150372.name: Collapsible D: the Final Minutes of the Titanic
150372.description:
Collapsible D™: the Final Minutes of the Titanic is a riveting game of survival set during the last dramatic minutes on board the Titanic.

The goal is to save your Passengers, each worthing victory points, on the lifeboats. The faster you will save them, the more points you will get. While you lead your passengers to safety, the icy waters of the Atlantic Ocean quickly flood the gigantic hull.

Collapsible D™: The Final Minutes of the Titanic is released to commemorate the centenary of the distaster of the british passenger liner. On 14 April 1912, on her maiden voyage, RMS Titanic sank after the collision with an iceberg.

Source: The Developer Website.

150373.description:
These are additional cards made by gaming industry veterans and bonus cards that can be added to enhance Adventurer: The Card Game. They were made available from retailers, web orders, and other venues:


Golden Portal: Found only in the Limited Edition Castle Deck
Shade the Trickster: This is a Guest Designer Card by Gary Gygax. This is available from the website and from select retailers. We also have the great honor in knowing this is also the very last thing Gary designed before he passed away in March.
Warden's Pool of Darkness: This is a Guest Designer Card by James M. Ward and pays homage to the great gold box Dungeons and Dragons game he help create to the computer. This is available from the website and from select retailers.

150375.name: Invasion Z
150375.description:
Invasion Z is a Zombie Survival Game. The story is about an outbreak of Zombie-like creatures after a Meteor disintegrates in the atmosphere raining a strange color into Buenos Aires City. This rain causes the population to get sick and then die, only to become the dreaded ghouls that crave for the flesh.

Gameplay has 5 basic steps:

1) MAINTENCANCE: Operatives untap all the used items and Profile card, and Mission penalties are applied to the main Counters.

2) OPERATIVES STEP: Heroes move around the board, hunting zombies, rescueing people, finding useful items and trying to avoid the inevitable fate that awaits them.

3) ZOMBIES MOVE: All zombies move closer to the base in the center of the board.

4) EVENTS STEP: Depending on the levels of the Event Counter one or two events might happen. A special die is rolled and the event takes effect.

5) ZOMBIE STEP: Depending on the levels of the Zombie Counter one or two extra zombies will be added to the Zombie Roll. Usually 1 die per rescuer is roll (between 3 and 4 die total) plus any extra die added by the Zombie Counter placing zombies in the suburbs of the map. A 6 rolled is a miss and do not adds any zombie.

The objective of the game is to rescue the 8 survivors that stand hidden on the locations of the outer ring of the board and then return to the center tile to be retrieved by the rescue team.

The Heroes lose if at any time there are 3 zombies on the central location tile.

The Items deck works as a counter that will increase the difficulty as the game progresses with some "bad luck" cards that can be a devastating force against the heroes.

There are several ways of losing the game and only one way to win so usually players will feel very rewarded when they win as it´s usually on the edge of oblivion.

218041.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game - BGG Crossroads Promo

boardgameintegration.193037: Dead of Winter: The Long Night

boardgamehonor.26776: 2014 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork & Presentation Nominee

150376.description:
Game description from the publisher:

"Crossroads" is a new series from Plaid Hat Games that tests a group of survivors' ability to work together and stay alive while facing crises and challenges from both outside and inside.

Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game, the first game in this series, puts 2-5 players in a small, weakened colony of survivors in a world where most of humanity is either dead or diseased, flesh-craving monsters. Each player leads a faction of survivors with dozens of different characters in the game.

Dead of Winter is a meta-cooperative psychological survival game. This means players are working together toward one common victory condition — but for each individual player to achieve victory, he must also complete his personal secret objective. This secret objective could relate to a psychological tick that's fairly harmless to most others in the colony, a dangerous obsession that could put the main objective at risk, a desire for sabotage of the main mission, or (worst of all) vengeance against the colony! Certain games could end with all players winning, some winning and some losing, or all players losing. Work toward the group's goal, but don't get walked all over by a loudmouth who's looking out only for his own interests!

Dead of Winter is an experience that can be accomplished only through the medium of tabletop games. It's a story-centric game about surviving through a harsh winter in an apocalyptic world. The survivors are all dealing with their own psychological imperatives, but must still find a way to work together to fight off outside threats, resolve crises, find food and supplies, and keep the colony's morale up.

Dead of Winter has players making frequent, difficult, heavily- thematic, wildly-varying decisions that often have them deciding between what is best for the colony and what is best for themselves.

150378.name: The Forlangen
150378.description:
From Introduction:

A visage of beauty that makes her hard to resist, the young woman approaching looks pleadingly across the faces of those before her with tears falling from her eyes. Her sorrowful expression changes quickly to one of passion’s rage as she opens her mouth and screams.

150380.name: Character Folio: Mathus – Technician

rpg.19360: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire

150380.description:
From publisher blurb

The technician Mathus is a free bonus character for the Star Wars: Edge of the Empire Beginner Game that can be used as an additional or alternative character to the characters in the starter set.

150381.name: Character Folio: Sasha – Explorer

rpg.19360: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire

150381.description:
From publisher blurb

The explorer Sasha is a free bonus character for the Star Wars: Edge of the Empire Beginner Game that can be used as an additional or alternative character to the characters in the starter set.

150382.name: CH (Custom Humanoid)-1

rpg.19360: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire

150382.description:
Free RPG Day 2013 Character for use with Shadows of a Black Sun

From Introduction:

In addition to its custom chassis, CH-1 features unique self-improvement programming. The droid is driven to continue its creator’s legacy and modify, upgrade, and customize itself to perfection, and will eliminate any who stand in its way (including its former master). Mechanics and equipment aren’t cheap, however. Luckily, the droid discovered that collecting bounties both paid well and gave it a chance to hone its skills. Ever since the Bounty Hunter Guild accepted it into its ranks, CH-1 has done jobs wherever it can. Its work recently brought it to Coruscant, where the droid heard the Pyke Syndicate was placing a price on the head of an unauthorized, rogue bounty hunter.

150383.name: Something Happened at the Temple Near Glourm
150383.description:
PDF Description:

The monks of the Temple near Glourm haven’t stopped by Glourm for weeks. They usually stop by periodically for supplies. The townsfolk that have ventured up to the temple haven’t returned. Livestock has gone missing. And now there are frequent ground tremors. The remaining townsfolk are afraid for their lives. It’s noticed that Joden the blacksmith is missing. Lourke offers the party 300 gold to find out what’s going on at the temple. Half up front. Half upon completion.

150384.description: Superfight: The Green Deck — an expansion for the Superfight party game in which players pit unusual characters with superpowers and superweaknesses against one another — consists of one hundred kid-friendly cards from fairy tales to cartoons to food weapons.
150384.name: Superfight: The Green Deck
