150386.description: Superfight: The Blue Deck — an expansion for the Superfight party game in which players pit unusual characters with superpowers and superweaknesses against one another — consists of one hundred cards that feature locations in which the characters can fight, from comic book conventions to the wild west to oceans of gelatin.
150386.name: Superfight: The Blue Deck

150387.description: Superfight: The Purple Deck — an expansion for the Superfight party game in which players pit unusual characters with superpowers and superweaknesses against one another — consists of one hundred scenario cards that feature everything from land mines to kitten stampedes to disabling electric devices, adding an extra level of hilarious fun to every round.
150387.name: Superfight: The Purple Deck

150388.name: Superfight: The Orange Deck
150388.description: Superfight: The Orange Deck — an expansion for the Superfight party game in which players pit unusual characters with superpowers and superweaknesses against one another — consists of one hundred cards that add geek-friendly subjects to the fights, from sci-fi to fantasy to comic book nerdery.

150389.name: Superfight: The Hero Machine Deck
150389.description:
Superfight: The Hero Machine Deck — an expansion for the Superfight party game in which players pit unusual characters with superpowers and superweaknesses against one another — adds one hundred new cards to your Superfight game that take your available characters in a whole new direction. The cards are split into three decks. Each deck contains words that combine to create a character. When a player plays a "TO THE HERO MACHINE" card, he or she chooses one card from each Hero Machine deck.


Deck 1 contains words like: Super, Giant, Flying, Retired, Flaming, Mutant
Deck 2 contains words like: Monkey, Zombie, Girlfriend, Dino, Bat, Hero, Sumo
Deck 3 contains words like: Assassin, Swarm, Babies, Cyborg, Army, Duo, Love Triangle


Players choose one card from each deck, and place them in order to generate combinations such as "Flying Girlfriend Army", "Giant Zombie Babies", and "Retired Dino Love Triangle". This is a powerful and very funny deck, and will add thousands of possible characters to your game.

150390.name: The Death of Simon Michaels
150390.description:
from the Keeper's Introduction:
This adventure is the kick off point for a Delta Green style operation, based inside the United Kingdom. The English investigators are going to be dragged into a web of intrigue involving the spontaneous combustion of Mr Simon Michaels, a planning officer from the town of Craig Mills in North Yorkshire.

A nuclear storage facility has been taken over by Majestic-12 for the use as a base for MJ-8 Sub Project JOSHUA. This Project is concerned developing Xeno-biological weapon systems, and chemical agents that will effect Greys but leave human beings unaffected.

150391.name: Grabow

rpg.19360: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire

150391.description:
Free RPG Day 2013 Character for use with Shadows of a Black Sun

From Introduction:

Grabow grew up studying with the healers of his clan. When the Separatists and their Trandoshan allies attempted to subjugate his planet, Grabow tended the wounds of his fallen comrades in the Battle of Kashyyyk, treating Wookiees and clone troopers alike. After the collapse of the Republic, he was enslaved with the rest of his species and made to serve the Empire. He managed to escape but has an Imperial bounty on his head for his successful capture and return.

150392.name: Jovel Nial

rpg.19360: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire

150392.description:
Free RPG Day 2013 Character for use with Shadows of a Black Sun

From Introduction:

The Nial clan is a family of politicos, and they arranged for their eldest daughter to follow in their line of work as a Senate aide. For the young Bothan, the intrigue of slicing into government databases far surpassed the constant bickering and posturing on the Senate floor. Consequently, she used much of her time as an aide honing her skills as a technician. Senator Trellev Aquem discovered her talents by accident and kept them a secret. Now she works for him, and by extension, the Pyke crime syndicate, which has Aquem in its pocket.

150393.name: Matwe

rpg.19360: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire

150393.description:
Free RPG Day 2013 Character for use with Shadows of a Black Sun

From Introduction:

Matwe grew up on Coruscant, unfazed by the scope and diversity of the planet. He and his brother, Rikard, explored Coruscant’s seedier sectors, trying to make a living and a name for themselves among the dregs and scoundrels in the underworld. After Rikard botched a job for the Pykes, the crime syndicate demanded that he pay for the losses; Rikard will be stuck working for them until he dies. Matwe can’t bring himself to abandon his brother, and if he ever gets on the Pykes’ bad side, Rikard will be sure to pay.

150394.name: VludKin ClaNz
150394.description:
Developer Summary

VludKin ClaNz is a card game for two players about the struggle of the VludKin for control over the Vlud, the energy upon which their world is built. Each player starts with two VludKin cards from different ClaNz, and their goal is to not have the lowest influence VludKin when the game ends, and therefore be the player controlling the Vlud.

This is an original "stack-building" card game for two players, with a set of rules that are quick and simple to learn, but offering numerous strategic options and dirty tricks on the path to victory.

Each player receives two random VludKin cards from different ClaNz, and during the game they draw a card from the central deck which they then try to win with one of their VludKin, rolling over that VludKin's Influence modified by the card. If this card is an Influence card, they can then place it under one of the VludKin, altering their Influence value based on the Clan type shown on the card. If it's a Power card, then they can carry out the special action on that card before it is discarded.

Failing to win a card will earn the VludKin a -1 Influence token to their total, and they can get rid of these only through trading an Influence card matching their Clan or the use of certain power cards, which might actually move all the tokens to an enemy instead. If an Influence card is failed, then the other player gets a chance to win it. If a Power card is failed, then the power is automatically played by the enemy VludKin opposite; sometimes it's in your advantage to fail a Power card...

During the game, the stacks of cards under each VludKin are built, changing their Influence up and down over turns until the game ends and the player with the lowest VludKin loses. With the ability to play Influence cards on the other player's VludKin and with the use of Power cards to move Influence cards around the stacks, a level of strategy is added to the simple core rules.

The game ends when either a VludKin reaches ten Influence or the central deck is empty, so through the use of Influence and Power cards a tense game builds in which the balance of Influence can change right up to the end on the asymmetrical board game playfield. There is little down time for the players and no hidden hands of cards, so this provides an exciting head-to-head experience.

VludKin ClaNz comes with eight VludKin from four ClaNz, two copies of each of the twelve different power cards, and forty Influence cards. Adding extra sets of the Power and Influence cards gives you the option to customize the central deck to how you want to play, and also gives the option for a longer game.

Can you gain influence over the VludKin in this original card game?

150395.name: Sinoca "Sin" Meeku

rpg.19360: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire

150395.description:
Free RPG Day 2013 Character for use with Shadows of a Black Sun

From Introduction:

Sin comes from a long line of bounty hunters and learned many of their ways, even though she did not join in the family business. The Rodian came to Coruscant ten years ago seeking ever larger fortunes and wrestled her way into the property market. What Sin thought was an innocuous deal turned out to involve the Pykes, and they made sure she would profit more if she undercut her original client deeply. In time, Sin came to appreciate the world of crime and what could be accomplished working outside of the system.

150396.name: Tray'Essek

rpg.19360: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire

150396.description:
Free RPG Day 2013 Character for use with Shadows of a Black Sun

From Introduction:

During a bounty hunting job, fellow clansman Lar’omx betrayed and humiliated Tray'Essek, which according to his beliefs “zeroed out” his jagannath points, denying him a place of honor in Trandoshan society and in the afterlife. The only way to restore his lost points is to kill the one who did this to him. Tray'Essek has devoted his life ever since to killing Lar'omx…and making sure that nobody else kills him first. Last he heard, the traitor was working for Black Sun, and Tray'Essek joined up with the Pykes recently for a chance to finally track Lar’omx down.

150397.name: Migraine
150397.description:
From publisher blurb:

MIGRAINE!!

Once a college student with unending headaches, Migraine can now inflict the same pain on others! Undergoing an experiment that forced him into villainy, he now serves criminal masters as an agent of evil. Beware Migraine, the Tortured Telepath!

150398.name: Department 88
150398.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the land of the rising sun we bring you the manual for Department 88! This sourcebook is a great campaign boost ripe with the inner workings of a major law enforcement agency only for Villains and Vigilantes™, the Original Superhero Role Play.

150399.name: Great Bridge 2
150399.description:
From publisher blurb:

Over twenty more of the most wanted villains from the files of Japan's Department 88. Yet more archetypes from Japanese Manga and Anime for Villains and Vigilantes™ the Original Superhero Role Play.

150400.name: Final Fight with the Furies
150400.description:
From publisher blurb:

An ancient conflict of epic proportions sees the rise of an elite group of villains. As heroes fall, artifacts go missing, and mayhem runs rampant, will your heroes be up to the challenge of a no-holds-barred showdown when even the fate of the world may be on the line? All of this and more in a super-sized mega-adventure for Villains and Vigilantes, the Original Superhero Role Play.

150401.description: Council of Verona: Zombie Romeo and Juliet is a pair of alternate art cards of the star-crossed lovers Romeo and Juliet — now with faces rotting, yet eyes still dewy with shared love — that can be swapped into the Council of Verona card game in place of the original cards. Gameplay remains the same whether the protagonists are living or undead.
150401.name: Council of Verona: Zombie Romeo and Juliet

150402.description:
Dragon and Bandits is a fantasy-themed game in which the players are bandits who sneak around a sleeping dragon, trying to acquire treasure.

Cards accumulated can either be treasure, movement, or dragon movement cards. The treasure cards are saved until the end of the game and added up for points. The movement cards allow the character to move, but at the cost of making noise. As more noise is made, counters are removed from the dragon; if all the counters are removed, the dragon awakes, and every player in the dragon's line of sight must discard all treasure. Players can affect the dragon's line of sight by playing dragon movement cards.

The game ends when the deck of sixty cards is empty, and whoever has the most accumulated treasure wins.
150402.name: Dragon and Bandits

150403.name: Menagerie
150403.description:
From publisher blurb:

Would be world conquerors, ancient civilizations lost in the mists of the icy peaks, and an errand of mercy to get anyone into the holiday spirit. Throw in a compendium of villains and it's a recipe for something new for Villains and Vigilantes, the Original Super Hero Role Play. Menagerie is a collection of short adventures designed for a group of heroes to play through in episode fashion.

150404.name: Mercenaries
150404.description:
From publisher blurb:

MetaHumanResources.com has the right operative at the right price. Good? Evil? Otherwise affiliated? Not a problem! Go to our online database and find that 'special' agent to help your clandestine goals today! Mercenaries is a new resource filled with operatives for hire who may be heroes and villains alike exclusively for Villains and Vigilantes, the Original Super Hero Role Play...

150405.name: Signs of the Zodiac
150405.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dirty deals. High Technology. Throw in a little treachery and it doesn't take a crystal ball to see the future in this awesome new adventure exclusively for Villains and Vigilantes, the Original Super Hero Role Play...

The is a 47 page adventure plus 7 pages of full color printable counters.

150406.name: Always Outnumbered
150406.description:
From publisher blurb:

The greatest heroes are Always Outnumbered! FGU introduces another round of adventures suited for the GM who needs to challenge the lone hero or a duo of crimefighters: Three solo adventures for Villains and Vigilantes, the Original Super Hero Role Play...

...and don't miss the photo opportunity!

150407.name: The Power of One
150407.description:
From publisher blurb:

For use with the Villains and Vigilantes super hero role playing game - A compilation of six solo-adventures to challenge your players! Pit your hero against a Thirties-style gangster, an enraged former pro-wrestler, a vampire on the prowl, an out-of-control gang of thugs, a militant vegan, and a villainess with a strange new power.

All are challenging with original villains in interesting situations for a single hero to prove themself against.

150408.name: Attack on the Poseidon Line
150408.description:
From publisher blurb:

Taking a vacation has never been such a risky proposition... Passengers aboard Poseidon Cruise Lines are being terrorized. One of the world's most prestigious passenger lines has fallen prey to a vicious batch of modern day buccaneers! Can your heroes stop the heists and figure out what's really rocking the boat?

150409.name: Eat Lead, Undead!
150409.description:
The world has come to an end, and zombies, vampires and other horrors run rampant in the street. You and your group of survivors have one chance to get out alive. You've got to mow down hordes of oncoming undead and gather enough supplies to escape the city. Of course some of you might not make it out alive...

Eat Lead, Undead! is a frantic game of dart gun mayhem! Each turn, players move their survivors amidst hordes of swarming undead, which lurk behind stand-up scenery. Players then all fire their dart guns as much as they can for thirty seconds to protect their survivor — or perhaps wound a rival. Any survivor in a clear sector may gather equipment, while those who are wounded return home empty-handed. The first person to get the right combination of equipment escapes the city and wins!

Eat Lead, Undead! combines elements of Run, Fight or Die and City of Horror with the unique dexterity mechanism of dart guns for a riotous and unique co-op/competitive experience.

150410.name: Great Bridge
150410.description:
From publisher blurb:

Over twenty of the most wanted villains from the files of Japan's Department 88. Archetypes from Japanese Manga and Anime are all represented in V&V terms, along with the organization of Department 88.

150411.name: Dark Ronin
150411.description:
From the text:
A rules-lite roleplaying game of Ronin in feudal Japan. Dark Ronin is a hack of Cthulhu Dark by Graham Walmsley.

User note:
As Cthulhu Dark is to losing sanity, Ronin Dark is about losing face.

150412.name: The Wrath of Achilles
150412.description:
From Publisher Blurb:

You are Achilles, the greatest hero Greece has ever known. You fight with honor and pride. Your skills at arms are unmatched. You have never experienced defeat. But on the battlefields of Troy you have a decision to make: stay true to your code of honor and not fight, or come to the aid of your countrymen and win fame and glory, becoming an even greater legend.

In The Wrath of Achilles, you become Achilles, hero of all of Greece. You confront the same choices he faced in the pages of Homer's Iliad, but with a twist: you are in control of your destiny. You can choose a different path as you follow you fate. Thirteen different endings await you. Only one path leads to glory. Twelve lead to death, defeat, and shame.

150413.name: The Exile of Aeneas
150413.description:
From Publisher Blurb:

You are Aeneas, Troy's preeminent hero. Your loyalty and integrity are legendary. Will your values hold firm after the destruction of your city, a grueling exile, and yet another war?

In The Exile of Aeneas, you face the same decisions as Aeneas in Vergil's Aeneid, but you control the outcome. Only one path leads to your destiny. Thirty-one others lead to death, defeat, or shame.

Readers ages eight and up will experience Aeneas' exile and travels firsthand in Ed DeHoratius' dramatic, dynamically illustrated text.

Special Features

Prose story of the Aeneid that puts you right in the action
32 different endings—depending on your choices
5 illustrations by award-winning comic book artist Brian Delandro Hardison

150414.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 59 - Jan 2010)
150414.description:
This issue contains an article about the midgard con campaign, clerical buildings and the adventure Das Kloster über den Wolken (The cloister above the clouds).

Articles of this issue that are considered official:


Burg Feagist - (page 9)
Zaerabaldâm - Samen vom Blut der Götter - (page 52)
Das Selbstbild der Seemeister - (page 59)

150415.name: The Journey of Odysseus
150415.description:
From Publisher Blurb:

You are Odysseus, the wiliest hero of ancient Greece. Your love for family is as strong as your quest for adventure. What will you do, when given the choice of immortality? Or when a man-eating monster has you and your men trapped in his cave?

In The Journey of Odysseus, you face the same challenges as Odysseus in Homer's Odyssey, but you are in control of your destiny. Only one path brings success and satisfaction. Twenty-nine others lead to death, defeat, shame, or unending regret.

Readers ages 8 and up will experience Odysseus' journeys firsthand in Ed DeHoratius' dramatic text, dynamically illustrated by award-winning comic book artist Brian Delandro Hardison.

Special Features

Prose story of the Odyssey that puts you right in the action
30 different endings - depending on your choices
5 illustrations by award-winning comic book artist Brian Delandro Hardison

150416.name: Reiter der schwarzen Sonne (Special Edition)
150416.description:
User Summary:

Reiter der schwarzen Sonne is a massive German gamebook by Swen Harder that sports over 1350 sections. The book won a RPC Fantasy Jury Award 2013.

Alongside the regular editions (first printing 2012, revised and slightly expanded 2013), Mantikore published special editions which bundled the book with a 20-page booklet Die Geheimnisse von Reiter der schwarzen Sonne, folded color map, poster and bookmarks in a slipcase. The first special edition was limited to 111 copies. The second special edition included a soundtrack: 10 tracks composed by Sven Mencke for Reiter der schwarzen Sonne.

Publisher Blurb:

Du bist ein Ugarith, ein Meister der Nacht, der ohne Erinnerung an Herkunft und Vergangenheit nach der Ausübung einer ver­hängnisvollen Bluttat erwacht. Geächtet und verfolgt musst du dir fortan den Weg in die Freiheit erkämpfen, deine über­menschlichen Kräfte ergründen, um schließlich deine heilige Pflicht - die Begradigung des Weltenflusses - zu erfüllen...

Ob das Schicksal des Ugarith zu einem glücklichen, neutralen oder düsteren Ende gelangt, hängt jedoch einzig von deinen Entscheidungen ab - denn dies ist kein gewöhnlicher Roman, sondern ein Fantasy-Spielbuch!

Reiter der schwarzen Sonne ist mit mehr als 1.350 Sektionen das größte jemals veröffentlichte Spielbuch und setzt durch seinen innovativen Umgang mit Sektionsverweisen und hohen Wieder­spielwert neue Maßstäbe für das Genre. Besonders charakteristisch sind das Finden versteckter Bonussektionen, Endgegnerkämpfe im eigenen, ausführlichen Kampfkapitel und das Lösen komplexer Rätsel.

Publisher Blurb (User Translation)

You're an Ugarith, a master of the night, waking up with no memory of your origin and history after causing a terrible bloodbath. Outlawed and persecuted you have to fight for yourself and your freedom, explore your superhuman powers, and finally fulfil your sacred duty: the straightening of the world river...

Whether the fate of the Ugarith comes to a happy, neutral or dark end, however, depends only on your decisions - because this is no ordinary novel, but a fantasy gamebook!

Reiter der schwarzen Sonne (Rider of the Black Sun) is the biggest gamebook ever published with more than 1,350 sections, and by its innovative use of section references and high replay value it sets new standards for the genre. Especially characteristic are hidden bonus sections, boss battles in its own extensive combat chapter, and solving complex puzzles.

150417.name: The Centerville Incident
150417.description:
From publisher blurb:

Danger lurks in a small town! Fugitives from the law are loose! Can these cretins continue to elude the long arm of the law? Just how long is the long arm of the law anyway? Be prepared to find out in this awesome new action-packed adventure NOW AVAILABLE for the Villains and VigilantesTMSuperhero Role-Playing Game.

150418.name: The Sands of Time
150418.description:
From publisher blurb:

Time runs amok as the world changes right before the heroes' eyes... but no one else seems to notice! Has the world turned upside down or is there a rational, scientific explanation for all the strange twists? Only your heroes can set everything right in this new epic adventure NOW AVAILABLE for the Villains and VigilantesTM

150419.name: Enemies at Large
150419.description:

150421.name: Vigilantes International
150421.description:
From publisher blurb:

SOMETIMES EVEN HEROES NEED HELP. THEY MAY BE OUTNUMBERED OR "OUTGUNNED" BY A VILLAIN GROUP. NOW THAT HELP IS AT HAND WITH AN INTERNATIONAL LISTING OF OVER THIRTY POTENTIAL ALLIES TO WORK WITH PLAYER-HEROES WHEN HELP IS NEEDED. ALSO INCLUDING THE BONUS ADVENTURE MIND OVER MATTER.

150422.description:
Bloody Ridge: Decision on Guadalcanal, 13 September 1942 (BR for short) is a purpose-designed solitaire wargame of low complexity simulating the climactic Japanese night attack of that date. The attacked was aimed at nothing less than the capture of Henderson Field and the annihilation of the entire US ground force on the island.

You are on the offensive, commanding the Japanese attack force that’s attempting to break through the US Marine defense. The rules system, with your help in handling the mechanics of the process, runs the Marine defense. You win by exiting one or more Japanese units off the north edge of the map, or by eliminating the 1st Marine Division headquarters.

Each game turn of BR is equal to about two hours of “real time.” Each hexagon represents 125 yards from side to opposite side. Each unit-counter represents a fire-team, squad, platoon, company or some other similarly sized ad hoc grouping of infantry and/or support weapons. The effect of the historically important off-map USMC field artillery is covered by the bombardment rules (see section 8.0).
150422.name: Bloody Ridge: Decision on Guadalcanal, 13 September 1942

150423.description:
Bolster your armies with Into the Breach, the second expansion for Warmachine: High Command!

Into the Breach contains five copies each of 16 different cards, plus four additional warcaster cards to bring new strategies to your Cygnar, Khador, Protectorate of Menoth, and Cryx decks.

Requires Warmachine: High Command core set to play.
150423.name: Warmachine: High Command – Into the Breach

150424.description:
Ghost Division is a solitaire game in which you, the player, take command of General Erwin Rommel’s 7th Panzer Division during the drive across Belgium and France in those heady days of May and June of 1940 (there are four German formations in the game that drive the events of play: The 7th Panzer Division, a regiment of the 5th Panzer Division, a regiment of SS-Totenkopf Division, and the 15th Motorized Corps’ non-divisional units, also representing OKW non-divisional units). Each has a separate colored unit box for ease of identification. The Allies are controlled by the game system. As the player, your objective is to drive as far as possible, cutting off the Allied armies in Belgium and possibly preventing the Dunkirk evacuation, thereby gaining a great victory for yourself.

As your forces drive across the map, they will encounter various Allied Forces, represented by face down Fog of War and Allied Formation counters. When encountering an Allied Formation, play temporarily stops in order to resolve the Combat Sequence, with the game system generating forces that your own forces will have to defeat.
150424.name: Ghost Division: The 7th Panzer Division's Drive to the Sea

150425.name: Escape from the Micro-Universe
150425.description:
From publisher blurb:

NEW FOR USE WITH VILLAINS AND VIGILANTES: AN ADVENTURE LIKE NO OTHER! the strange murders of prize-winning researchers rocks the scientific community on the eve of a spectacular symposium event hosted by some of the most brilliant minds on earth. what sort of CHAOS could be afoot? When the heroes are contacted by a terrified professor, they are drawn into the very vortex of a madman’s plot. can YOUR HEROES...
... ESCAPE FROM THE MICRO-UNIVERSE??!!!

150426.description:
This alternative history wargame examines the strategic and operational possibilities inherent in the campaign that would have occurred within France in June 1940 if that country’s government had resolved not to give up, as was the case historically. The assumption is that they instead chose to evacuate as much of the French Army as possible to France d’Outre Mer (Algeria). The resultant campaign, then, is one of strategic retreat and pursuit. The German player must try to destroy as much of the evacuating French force as possible, while keeping his own losses to a minimum in doing so.

Both sides’ orders of battle are entirely historical. The game length is held to only one month because, had the Germans not triumphed in that amount of time, the delay thereby caused to their plans for the next year would’ve then amounted to a major defeat in itself in the wider war.

Each game turn represents two days. Each hex represents eight miles (13 km) from side to opposite side.
150426.name: France Fights On

150427.description:
The Next War in Lebanon is an operational level wargame of a speculative Israeli invasion of Lebanon in the near future. The context is an Israeli invasion with the goal of eliminating the presence of Hezbollah terrorist group, and presumes a much larger invasion than the 2006 incursion (which is also included as a scenario). One player (the IDF) is assigned the role of the IDF (Israeli Defense Force) commander, and the other player is assigned the role of the Hezbollah forces, as well as Syrian and Iranian forces if certain events occur to cause their entry into the game (or players may agree to have these additional forces in the mix from the beginning of the game instead).

The game map features northern Israel and southern Lebanon, divided into 21 large hex territories, representing three categories of terrain: Urban (a major population center, such as the cities of Tyre, Sidon and Nabatiye), Populated (full of villages and small towns, and numerous roads), and Remote (rough terrain with few inhabitants or roads.) Stacking in any hex zone is unlimited, and units move and conduct operations within these hex zones to win the game.
150427.name: The Next War in Lebanon

150428.description: Ascension: Tower of Ascendancy is a promotional card given to Kickstarter backers of Ascension Online that costs 5 runes to purchase and is worth 3 honor. When this Enlightened Construct is in play, once per turn you can draw a card; if you do, each other player can give you 1 honor to draw a card.
150428.name: Ascension: Darkness Unleashed – Tower of Ascendancy

150429.description:
Carrier Solitaire puts you in command of a US Navy carrier task force operating against the Soviet fleet in the North Atlantic in the 1980’s. This is a solitaire game, played in scenarios. The player must accomplish the scenario’s Objective, which will be generated at random at the start of the scenario.
You, the player, must manage your carrier, its air group, and your escorts. As you operate your battlegroup, you will encounter various Soviet warships, aircraft, missiles, and unexpected opportunities and objectives. These are represented by Incident chits.

The game presumes that you are seeing the situation from the bridge of an aircraft carrier. Hence, carrier operations are shown in considerable detail, while other US Navy and opposing Soviet actions are more abstracted.
The possibility of running into enemy forces will be increased via the Alert Level, representing how much the Soviet Navy’s command is concentrating its resources against your task force. When contact is made with enemy forces, you will go to the game’s Tactical Routine to resolve combat. A scenario ends when you reach your Objective, where you must use your boldness to accomplish the final objective.
150429.name: Carrier Battlegroup: Solitaire

150430.name: Streets of Shadow (Victoriana)
150430.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are dangers lurking in the shadows of the Smoke – and some of the most dangerous are stirring at the wrong time. With the War in the Crimea going badly for the British, the rumour of conscription has sent anarchists into the street. Against the backdrop of social unrest and increasing danger a web of troubles grows, culminating in a fearsome threat to the entire city.

Streets of Shadow is a six-adventure campaign that takes the characters from a case of kidnapped children to rumours of dragons and sinister threats to London itself, all woven together in a web of coincidence and connection. Three of the adventures have been previously published, but are now fully compatible with Victoriana Third Edition Core Rulebook and integrated with the other adventures in the campaign.

150431.name: The Devil in the Dark
150431.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this Penny Dreadful, the adventurers are hired by Sir Travis Duquesne, a financier who has been referred to them by fellow Oriental club member Henry Doyle. Through his accountant, Sir Travis asks the adventurers to investigate the strange happenings at a Midlands coal mine. Travelling to Bremerstoke village, they discover that someone has let a demon loose in the mine that has not only sparked a strike but threatens to ravage the countryside.

Originally published as a first edition penny dreadful, The Devil in the Dark has been expanded and revised for the third edition of Victoriana. It was originally intended to be incorporated into Streets of Shadow, but we couldn’t fit it in due to space limitations. The Devil in the Dark stands on its own as a complete penny dreadful.

150432.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 62 - Jun 2013)
150432.description:
This is the last issue, that was based on the fourth edition of Midgard. It contains the second part of the description of the folk of the wolflings, the adventure Ardewans Anwesen, an article about aranian raiders and more.

Articles of this issue that are considered official:


Die Baharvand - (page 45)

150433.name: Danger in the Depths, Issue #1
150433.description:
From publisher blurb:

Danger in the Depths, Issue 1. While dealing with an energency in a Pacific coast city, an unusual refugee comes ashore pursued by aquatic armsmen. He’s seeking sanctuary on the surface. Demands are soon received for his return to an undersea tyrant... Failure to meet these demands will result in a brutal assault from beneath the waves!

150434.name: Pathogen
150434.description:
Pathogen is a revolutionary strategy game for mobile and tablet devices. Designed with the classic board game experience in mind, Pathogen brings mechanics and play styles of classics like Chess and Go to a whole new level. Easy to learn, but with an infinite depth of strategic options, Pathogen will have you challenging your friends for years to come.

Source: The Game Website.

150435.name: Danger in the Depths, Issue #2
150435.description:
From publisher blurb:

Danger in the Depths, Issue 2. Will your heroes survive thousands of miles from civilization? Hundreds of miles from hope? Several miles from air? Don't miss the exciting conclusion as the evil tyrant Shalel musters her loyal followers to crush an uprising led by your heroes and their new-found ally... a rebellious prince in exile!

150436.name: Into the Sub Realm
150436.description:
From publisher blurb:

The player-heroes must track down the cause of mysterious catastrophes around the world, which will lead them to the elemental forces that control the earth and to an underground world and culture devoted to the earth powers.

150437.name: Enter the Gene Pool
150437.description:
From publisher blurb:

A super-scientist, a formula to induce mutations and super powers, a villain team using kidnapping to obtain resources for experiments and build “street-cred” add up to a challenge for the heroes - can they stop the gene pool?

150438.name: Citizen Report
150438.description:
From publisher blurb:

New for VILLAINS AND VIGILANTES - A TOOL BOX OF BUSINESSES, ORGANIZATIONS, CORPORATIONS, USEFUL NOTABLE CITIZENS, AND 6 COMPLETE STREET GANGS. not rules - OPTIONS! To fit any v&v campaign. A tool box for gamemasters. Sections on corporations, organizations, six complete themed street gangs, gang weapons, useful citizens for any campaign, bystanders, police and security personnel, and vehicles. All are options and some will fit any GM's tastes.

150439.name: Shoot'n' Hoops
150439.description:
The Exciting Mini BasketBall Game. (From the Box)

The players take turns to flip mini basketballs into a multi hoop stand each hoop scoring different points, 4 balls per player with 9 hoops to target, highest score wins. An Alternative / Solo game option of 'three in a row / Tic-Tac-Toe' challenge is also suggested in the how to play guide.

150440.name: Broken Earth Player's Guide (Savage Worlds)
150440.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bombs fell. Billions died. Now you must pick up the pieces and rebuild this Broken Earth.

Broken Earth is an adventure setting that takes place in a post-apocalyptic version of Earth. It deals with a small fraction of the world, what was once the northern Midwest of the United States, and a tiny bit of southern Central Canada. As an adventure setting, Broken Earth includes many compelling locations and adventures, but also gives the heroes freedom to explore the world.

The Broken Earth Players Guide describes everything that players need to create characters for Broken Earth, including new edges, powers, and setting rules.

150441.description:
This is a game of a series using the W-39 (Wrzesien 1939 - September 1939) system rules.

The Battle of the Bzura (or Kutno or Battle of Kutno — German name) was a battle in the opening campaign of World War II during the 1939 German invasion of Poland, fought between 9 and 19 September, 1939, between Polish and German forces. Finally, the Germans outflanked the Polish forces and took all of western Poland. It was the single largest battle in the 1939 September campaign and took place to the west of Warsaw, near the Bzura River. In it, a Polish breakout attack gained initial success but eventually faltered after a concentrated German counterattack.
